Cajun Albacore Nigiri
1/2 Order Cynthia Roll (5 pcs)
1/2 Order Royal California Roll (5 pcs)

Everything was so good, the service was prompt and all the food came out in good time. Would definitely recommend this place for the sushi lover who doesn't like the craziness of other AYCE sushi places. More secluded, more intimate. Definitely worth it!
Great food and very friendly staff. I recommend trying the lemon role! It's amazing all you can eat here is approximately $28.00

Uni was great 
Sweet shrimp was impressive 
Pixie roll - the soft shelf crab ROCKED 
Poke was good 
Collar was very smooth in texture and yum 

Don't really remember what else I ordered but they were pretty good in general.... The only downside was the food came kind of slow because it was pretty busy that day even when we were dinning at 3pm.

Very rude employees made unpleasant dining.
Too long to get food served and water refill was never been easy.
Also i got sick after eating here.

You can't beat Sushi Mons' AYCE selections. Very fresh sushi and great bang for the buck. One of those "melt in your mouth" type of deal. AYCE is $25/ per person. 

Be prepared to wait approx 40 minutes to be seated on Friday and Saturday nights though. Even the sushi bar can get really crowded..
Arturo is always my sushi chef here & he is by far the most efficient , sociable chef , attentive chef there . I come back all the time & wait just to have him as my chef .

We shouldnt come back here

Service is still poor. It took 15 minutes just to get our drink. Server is not paying attention to its customers, takes 30 minutes to get our orders.

We will never come back here ever

As a regular (ate here well over 20 times) I would say this place is a hit or miss. On a busy night i would skip this place altogether.  While the raw scallops the best I have had for an all you can eat place the service is just horrible. On their slower nights the service is wonderful and the food is equally great. I dislike how rude the host/cashier person can be. I get it 'you have a high volume of people in that small restaurant' BUT that does not justify treating your paying guests like a burden. I will say the food is pretty tasty and for what you pay it's worth it. Service needs improvement regardless. Go check it out.

This is a decent place but I can see myself be a fan eventually.  Decided to check out this place since it was close to the house and the sushi place I usually go to is now a bit too far.  The price was decent but holly cow the rolls were big!  I can usually eat about three to four rolls and extra but I was completely stuffed after two rolls.  The rolls weren't the prettiest and fell apart when I picked it up but it could also be that we went around 12:30AM...and they closed at 2AM.  But for as late as it was, they had a pretty decent crowd.  I will definitely go back and I can see myself eventually be a fan.  I just need to give them a few chances to see me as a regular.  Overall, it was good...working on being great. =)

We had a great time the staff was friendly the fish was fresh. Everything we ordered came out quickly and we had all around good time this is all you can eat place and my favorite one of them all and I've tried a bunch in the city I just wanted the best so I came hear

***Yelp Challenge 2016 1/100***

Love sushi and especially salmon belly! I always stick with nigri. I like to keep it real! LOL I love mixing things up and getting things like ikura and quail egg. One thing about lunch here is that they don't have uni available. It's ok though. They have many others to choose from. The super white tuna, poke and orgasm salad were all UNO! 

The chef was also super cool. He had a smile the entire time. I recommend this spot to anyone looking to try something different. It's not as packed as the location on eastern. Also don't forget to ask for your stamp car for all you avid sushi eaters! If you don't want it you can give it to me haha JK Happy Sushi Eating. This place will not disappoint.

Sushi Mon is my sushi home away from home.  Since I travel to Las Vegas often, I have tried all the high end sushi eateries you can imagine.  Although all were amazing, the hit to your wallet is worse than some of the gambling tables in Vegas.  

$26.95 gets you all you can eat sushi which includes a plethora of choices. Keep and eye on their chalk board for special cuts. For instance I was fortunate enough to have had Blue Fin tuna which normally is an fin and a leg - yes that was cheesy, sue me - but it was included in the deal. 1 order per person on the special items.

The house rules are simple and if you can't read, they provide simple illustrations to follow. Despite the handy instruction card they have at the bar, you will inevitably have someone try to cheat the system.  I don't know about you but the last person I try to antagonize is man who is very skilled with a super sharp knife. 

If eating as much sushi as humanly possible is your objective, then void the rolls or ordering too many sides dishes.  Stick with the nigiri and venture out of your comfort zone. Don't be afraid to ask for suggestions and letting them know of any allergies you may have. I have a shell fish allergy so they prepared my sushi on a different cutting board to avoid cross contamination.

That is really going the extra mile because other sushi establishments I frequent can care less.  The attention to detail and their customer service sets them apart. 

If you want great sushi at a reasonable price, Sushi Mon will definitely hit the spot. Oh and don't forget to try the lychee sorbet... Simply the best!!!

Called on the way there to ask how long the wait was and the man on the phone said 35 minutes. Arrived there (literally) 2 minutes after the phone call, checked in and the same guy said it was an hour wait. Basically told us false info on the phone to persuade us to go. Disappointed.

The rice is big on sushi and they didn't even cook the rice throughly before they make sushi with it, and the most horrible thing they did was charge my son who's 2 years $3 for sharing our ayce.  What kind of business that charges a 2 year old toddler for sharing his parents food.  The menu didn't stated anything about kids charge and the waitress even dare to question why do I get upset after hearing that.  What the hell, I can't even express myself in this damn restaurant and they will charge your toddle for sharing.  I want to give this restaurant 0 star and will never recommend anybody going and I will never come back again!!!

Get the sexy girl. and the dinner combos are great for 2 people.  Would recommend to friends and family.  Service is good and the sushi is fresh.  Enjoyed meals there every time they are consistent with their excellent food.
My experence was ok ... it wasnt the best to die for sushi but the reson why i gave it 3 stars is the service...

Ok, here we go. Now I'm not sure if it's because I have been to many sushi places. But this place was horrible. My girlfriend and I went there expecting really outstanding service. What we received was the complete opposite. They took way too long to prepare sushi as far as drinks we practically had to chase down and corner the employees just to get out first set of drinks. As far as refills you have you be even more aggressive, otherwise you will die of thirst.
   Employees here do not care for customer service. They are not attentive to your needs. This company will not get anymore business from me or anyone I speak to. I do not recommend this place. I advise that you search elsewhere, that is unless you like to be over charged for crappy service.

This place use to be my favorite sushi restaurant, however, they are not any more. The quality of the sushi is fair to poor. The fish does not taste fresh.  The restaurant was closed down by the Dept of Health a few months ago, for one day, due to a large amount of flies and food being kept at incorrect temperatures. I still gave them a chance after that. The last time I was at Sushi Mon I saw a large roach crawling down the wall behind the sushi bar.  I will never go back. I was a loyal customer for six years and I will find a new sushi restaurant to spend my money at.

Went here last night with a group of people. First off you walk in and there is the smell of sewer. Big no no with me. Asked for manager and everybody acts like that's normal for that smell. They have fans blowing when you sit down for a reason. Food is good. We tried pretty much everything on the menu. I agree with other posts on the staff except for one server who stood out from the rest. If she leaves the place is screwed.  They do use a hand held computer for orders which is good.

sushi mon you are consistently delicious! always busy but regaurdless always great service and food. My only complaint is that SOME sushi chefs go heavy on the rice. Other than that everything is great, i love how its open late so i can enjoy after a night of drinking. Price is very reasonable!!!

I decided to try this restaurant instead of my usual sushi place. The food was good and the prices seemed fair from the online menu, but I was not satisfied at all. I called in and ordered it for take out (my boyfriend and I wanted a nice night in for Valentine's Day). When I got there to pick it up, the staff was completely rude and said they had no record of my order so it was never even placed! They said it would be ready in 15 minutes. Fine. After FORTY-FIVE minutes went by, my order was finally "ready", but they forgot one of my rolls, and I had to wait even longer for it to be actually done! Then I got home. I was so disappointed! The rolls are so tiny that it reminded me of how gas station sushi looks - the entire roll could fit in my hand, not exaggerating! The couple extra bucks I would pay at my usual place doesn't seem so bad now. I definitely will not be a customer here again.

# A M A Z I N G

- B R E A K D O W N (# of + stars = rating)
* A T M O S P H E R E/C O N C E P T: +1 star
* F O O D/P R E S E N T A T I O N: +1 star
* P O R T I O N/C O S T: +1 star
* S E R V I C E: +1 star
* R E V I S I T: +1 star

This place is awesome for cheap and extremely tasty sushi... smack dab in the desert of Nevada. Huh. AND it's ALL YOU CAN EAT! EAT ALL THE THINGS!

The cuts are pretty huge.. just the right amount and not with a ton of wasabi like you normally get at other all you can eat sushi restaurants.

My friends and I kept ordering a bazillion orders of yellowtail because it is our favorite! It's about $25 total for as many as you want!! Ahhh!! The waiters were awesome and very quick.

They started us out on one order on a normal plate, then started bringing our orders on huge plates with 8 orders on them because the yellowtail disappeared into our bellies. Friends: "Wow, our orders are getting bigger." Me: "Wow, the fish cuts are getting bigger and bigger. I think they want us out."

This place is also open LATE! We arrived in Vegas at midnight and my friend who lives around the area took us here at around 1 am and we ate for an hour til we were full! Wish there was one in Torrance!

P A R K I N G

Easy lot.

Great AYCE sushi. Try the Albacore Nigiri, Baked Grren Muscles, Sexy Girl Roll, Ecstasy Roll, and Mochi ice cream to finish it off. Very friendly and fast sushi chefs. 

Tip: come for a late lunch (before 4pm) and enjoy AYCE sushi and food for only $21.95. 

Warning: stay away from the 9-1-1 roll unless you can handle extreme amounts of jalapeño heat. This roll may put a speed bump on your sushi experience.

I went there 3 times in the past year. First two times were excellent.  The third time not a charm. The sushi rice was cold and mushy.  Cuts of fish were fresh but small. Too much rice for a small piece of fish.  Also very thinly sliced. Teriyaki chicken was precooked with sauce poured over. Pretty dry.  Could be different chef.  Price is reasonable. Will try again because maybe caught a bad day. Servers always good and pleasant.  If your consider price probably 4 stars.

Great sashimi, all you can eat made to order so its fresh, and great service! Would recommend to my friends and family!

Try the volcano baked roll....so good! The spicy tuna rolls were really yummy. And the sashimi was so fresh and so good. The baked mussels were excellent as well.

The mesquite rolls and halibut were allright. And the dinner price was a lil pricey like almost 30$ per person. I think coming with a lot of people would maximize ur experience bc that way you can try more stuff. Also note: u can order 1/2 orders and handroll anything. At the end of the dinner, my friend and i were way too stuffed b/c we were trying to eat everything and if we had known we could 1/2 orders/handrolls that would have helped :)

Clean location, went there about 10pm.  The sushi was a bit on the warm side.  The spicy tuna roll was good.  Overall average food.  Although service is better than most sushi places.  That is why I chose to give it a 3 instead of 2 stars.

I know this restaurant is owned and managed by the same people as the one on the south side of town, but this one seems just a touch below, and I'm not sure why.  It's still great, and I've been here many times.  Same rolls and food are good here.

Do get:
Futomaki
Spider Roll
Unagi
Super White Tuna
Yellowtail Collar
Green Tea creme brulee
Something with Scallop Yum on it

This is my favorite AYCE sushi place in town.  They make the best Futomaki and Spider rolls out of anywhere I've been.  They also have great unagi there.  When they have yellowtail collar as a special I suggest you get it.  Another great special is their green tea creme brulee.  They include all their side dishes for their AYCE price, and they have great hot tea to accompany any meal.  It gets quite packed in here, so be ready for a wait, or go after the lunch rush and before dinner (2pm-6pm).

OMG, all you can eat sushi for $28!! And I'm not talking about the nasty Todai or buffet style stuff! This place has a full menu of sushi, sashimi, rolls, appetizers, and desserts that you can order endless amounts of if you choose to do their all you can eat option. Otherwise, the rolls will cost you $4 to $9 each. You can also do half orders of each roll so that you get more variety! Of course, you need to finish everything or be charged for the price of that plate. Not like anyone would waste good sushi, right?! I've never been so full in my life! 

My favorite roll here was the deep fried philadelphia roll...mmm. I think I ate 3 full orders of various deep fried rolls that night! Another thing to try here is the fried shrimp heads! I didn't think I would like them, but they are delicious! Crispy and flavorful :) The desserts here are good too...I had the strawberry mochi and lychee sorbet.

Word of advice...it's probably not a good idea to do an all-you-can-eat dinner less than a few hours before you go out clubbing and binge drinking. I'll be coming here for lunch next time!

I'm surprised at all the bad reviews. I've been here several times and the food has always been terrific. Yes, around certain hours, you'll have to wait. That just means a lot of people enjoy eating there. :-) Their take-out service is outstanding. I ordered a full meal today and it was ready in five minutes. Friendly service and I love their sushi! Good prices, too. I'll definitely be back.

2 thumbs up for this place!!!!!!!!!!!!

I saw my fd's pic when she went to vegas and i was told the sushi is GOOD (she's not a sushi lover). So I went there to try in my vegas trip (you know how hard you have to squeeze a quota out from the vegas buffets when you only stay there a few days) Then, I came out with a fat belly with high satisifation =)

1st, their price is reasonable!! only $27 for all-you-can eat with all FRESH sushi!!! You can really tell the freshness of sashimi WORTH every penny you pay!! Unlike other sushi buffet, they give you cheaper fish to maintain their cost, sushi mon has really good sushi (or even better than some Jap rest)!!! The sauce with some sashimi give you a better taste or refreshment! I love their citrus sauce!!!!

2nd, like all buffet, they'll remind you dun waste the food so you have to finish the rice. However, unlike other sushi buffet, their sushi rice is abit smaller than usual so that will give you more room to try other food. 

3rd, even though they limit your dining time to 45mins (dinner hours), but that's enough!! Because the chefs made it quick and won't waste your time!!! 

4th, all other hot dishes and appetizers are also delicious =)

So combine all these reasons, I went there twice on my 3days vegas trip. I'll definitely go there again when i go vegas =)

Great food great service favorite sushi restaurant! Went here with my wife and had a great experience drinks and plates were always Instantly refilled the sushi chef himself was very nice and would talk and laugh with us. Just a great time altogether

I come here quite often because the location is very close to me. It just so happens that they serve very good quality sushi! It has been a few months since I have last visited, but today it seemed like it was exceptionally flavorful. The staff is also fantastic. They're all super sweet and attentive. 
The rolls are always delicious, and well made, especially when they're AYCE which at many places tends to be sloppy. My favorites are their takoyaki, baked green mussels, garlic tuna, super white tuna, red snapper, the Moon Roll, and the Ecstasy Roll.
A couple of small things I wish they could improve on are outside seating and a tiny bit more effort on sweeping. With the outside seating, it gets pretty busy some nights, and you can not sit unless your entire party is present. With the sweeping, the restaurant is pretty much always clean, but my boyfriend dropped a piece from his roll today and there was rice everywhere under his seat. We got the attention of one the staff and told them what happened, and if I was a host or server there, my first instinct would be to sweep it up right away.

Incredibly sick!! I Ordered take out on 11/30/16 at around 8pm. Purchased 2 chicken teriyaki combination dinners, baked mussels( which i suspect to be the culprit here)and gyoza. Upon waking the next morning, my girlfriend began vomiting. She said her stomach was a wreck and she was physically ill and could not leave the house. I on the other hand was in training for a new job and had to attend work. About an hour into my day, I noticed a queasy ache creeping in my stomach. This queasy ache quickly escalated, and in less then an hour I was running to the bathroom to vomit. Unable to leave work, I had to push on. I was having terrible cold sweats, my body was achy from head to toe, and every so often I had to run back to the bathroom to puke. Upon returning home, my girlfriend, who was still in an awful state (still is), called Sushi Mon to inform them of the issue. To our surprise the restaurant did not offer us any kind of apology or even a refund but informed us to go to the doctor and show them paperwork to prove our story. I went to the doctor today. My girlfriend wants her own immune system to fight it . She's the kind that unless she's dying she doesn't go to Doctors office . If she doesn't feel better by tomorrow she will definitely go to the doctor. But I'm in utter disbelief on how this restaurant handles such public health concerns. This is how outbreaks happen! Don't plan to eat here ever again!

Sushi Mon was a regular place I'd go to with my friends or family or whoever else loves it there!
All you can eat sushi for 20 something dollars is winners!! 
The staff were always friendly and welcoming which is a huge plus at any restaurant.
Sushi is fresh and so good; the selection is awesome! 
I wish we had a Sushi Mon in HAWAII!
Wow! Sushi Mon just topped our list for sushi in Vegas. Nigiri was some of the best we've ever tasted. Rolls were fantastic. Sushi chefs were top notch. Definitely coming back!

First time we wanted to dine here, there was a 30 minute wait. We were too hungry so we left but anticipated our return since there were so many good reviews on here.

I hate to say our experience did not live up to expectations..

We sat at the bar for all you can eat. The sushi chefs didn't talk much at all, and the waiter was pretty slow in refilling drinks. Mine was empty for 5 minutes before they came to refill it.

I was enjoying my calamari and my Volcano Roll. I then ordered a deep-fried roll which I had never tried before, and stopped when I pulled a long hair out of a piece of my sushi. I completely lost my appetite and won't be returning. I really don't see what the hype is about, we've had 200% better experiences at I Love Sushi.

Great place. Cheap and open late! 
Five star for the sturdy toothpicks

The sushi is good not the best I've ever had. Just good, period. For the price is a bit overpriced the sushi didn't quite look like the picture. But overall was tasty. We also ordered on the side the fried gyoza and the seaweed salad, and mango mochi and green tea ice cream for dessert. Gyoza was good, seaweed salad was sub par, mango mochi was delicious, and the green tea ice cream had chunks of ice cubes in it. Not good.

The service and cleanliness, but especially service is what knocks it down several pegs for me. My mom and I got off work together and when we sat down at the bar tonight we could barely hear the server over the music/loudness. And a couple of customers came in after us and sat down near us and seemed to be friends with the sushi chef and started chatting away. Not only did they get served their appetizer and their ginger and wasabi first but they got their drinks with their water. I ordered a drink I didn't even get, luckily wasn't charged for it. The counter where we were sitting hasn't really been wiped off it was still dirty and grungy from the previous diners. 

Seemed like the sushi chef was angry with me specifically because I asked the server to get us some wasabi and ginger. He didn't want to make eye contact and only spoke to my mom when he did speak to us. Which was only twice the entire meal. The other chefs smiled and were doing their things, but ours was clearly enjoying himself entertaining his friends.
Disappointing since I am a big sushi fan and I just moved to Vegas and I've been asking for recommendations. This was one of them. I'll likely not be back.
My friends and I come here for a day trip from Cali to Vegas from time to time. If that doesn't say good food (for the price) then what does?

We went last night kind of late for the AYCE dinner.  Being from Reno, the capital of AYCE sushi, we were too spoiled to spend for a la carte anywhere else in Vegas, and this place was recommended by a few people.  Checking yelp and looking over the menu we got excited, the variety was great.  
I like to start with nigiri but the fish looked bad, my yellowtail had a lot of different shades to it, maybe it's the way they cut it or maybe it's just kind of old but they do give good fish to rice ratiio.  Also, the salmon didn't come with lemon on it as it does at my favorite place back home, and the sushi chef was fairly inattentive when I wanted to ask for some slices so I just dealt with it.
The long rolls were not anything to write home about either.  They were loosely rolled and had a lot of rice, so much that when I picked one up it fell into soy sauce which splattered ALL over me.  When this happened, the sushi chef offered soda water, which was nice, but it didn't have to happen at all.  
We ordered a couple rolls with no issue but when my boyfriend ordered the Monster roll, thinking it would be piled high with fish, we got disappointed.  The chef made something that looked delicious then piled a whole bowl worth of rice onto it, rolled it up and served it.  My boyfriend decided the only way he could fit it in his mouth would be to take out the actual roll and discard the rice.  He told the waiter he wasn't going to eat it and the waiter was very nice, saying he would have warned him if he'd asked, stating it might be better for a table of 5 people (it's only 5 slices).  We just wish the chef had warned us. But we weren't charged for not eating the rice which was good, cause they charge over $12 for that roll, and that's almost half the cost of dinner.  
So, to summarize, love the AYCE, love the late hours and variety of rolls.  There was so much we wanted to try that we didn't get a chance to.    Service is also excellent but the chef could've been better/more service oriented.

We were at sushi mon on December 24th. It was a little bit of wait for 3 of us to get seated. This is our 4th time and we figured things out. We ordered specials on the chalk board first, because they are always fresh and good. The yellowtail collar appetizer was great. I felt like I was back in japan in a small izakaya. 

We only order nigiri sushi because we love fish. Seared tuna, seared salmon and fresh scallop were our favorites of the day. Their fish is always very fresh and as good as being in japan. They sometimes get rice either not cooked right or the chef did not roll it tight enough, and rice can fall apart. However , we hit the good night and all nigiri made were near perfect.

We tried other AYCE sushi places, but this place is the best among them!

The food was good but it takes forever for them to bring the food out. I ordered spider roll, it was pretty big so it was hard to eat in one piece. The dynamite was good but it took a while for them to bring it out. I actually had to ask them again for it. And since it was sweet, I needed to off-set the taste so I also ordered shumai. It took half an hour and still no shumai. I finally asked one of the servers for it and within a couple minutes, they brought it out. Were they just sitting on it?

We are fans, closest to our house and last one to try. The service is awesome, lots of staff and friendly faces. My hubby is a fan of AYCE and tried many items, enjoying them all. I tried rolls, and am happy that they office 1/2 rolls, BUT they are 5 huge pieces. I ordered 2 and couldn't even finish. The miso soup was so-so, I didn't have mine...it was scalding when it arrive and later I did not want to use up valuable space. We tried the shu-mai (terrible, should not have ordered) and chicken yakitori (it was fine) apps, but apps are a mistake if you are there for sushi and rolls. I truly wish that the AYCE places offered true half rolls or made their rolls smaller. Bigger isn't better in this case because you cant enjoy variety if you have a small stomach. I had 4 pieces left and the server explained if I left more than 2 she would have to charge me ala carte. Didn't matter, my meal (2 half rolls and yakitori) didn't even come to the 26.95 price, actually I would have saved money. But for those like me who's eyes are bigger than their stomach, beware. I understand their position, just good to know. Awesome red bean and green tea ice cream. Everything we saw coming from behind the sushi counter looked amazing, everything fresh and the temp expected. We went at 5pm, good time, not too crowded and we know this place does get crowded regularly. Nice selection and many items that don't have cream cheese (wish that had not become a thing). Anyway, recommend this place highly.

The all you can eat is an amazing deal!! We got so much good quality food for a great price! Everything on the menu is included in the deal and it is all high quality.

I lived in Japan for 3 1/2 year, and while the quality here is not quite at that level, it is amazingly great for the states and phenomenal considering its in the desert!

Highly highly recommend!

Everyone says this place is better than Sushi Kaya but I have to disagree. The rolls here are nothing special and I'm a roll girl... The salmon nigiri is pretty fresh and good but that itself won't keep me from coming here. They don't have too may options with rolls or side dishes either. I would only come here if I really wanted AYCE and was in the area. Though the service is very attentive and sweet.
Great place...great service & very close to my home.  The wait was not bad for a Friday night. This is now my new favorite sushi place.

The first time I came here was to try the all-you-can-eat, and my friends all say it's a great value-- but if you're like me and don't want to stuff yourself, go with ala carte ordering!

This is place is perfect for me because they let you order HALF rolls which are also half priced! So it's four rolls for about $4-5 dollars an order. 
I love it because this way I get to try all the rolls I want without stuffing myself and still end up paying less than all-you-can-eat (but I always go with a friend though so we split the bill, usually around $20-25 each after tip when we have about 7 half rolls. 

My favorites:

- New York Girl in Las Vegas (unique salmon w/ cream cheese and a lemon slice)
- Orion Roll (i LOVE the albacore on on the outside)
- ANY of the baked rolls (Flying JJ, Volcano, Volcano 2-- too good.)

On an endnote-- the chefs are usually pretty friendly too and it's actually pretty nice sitting at the bar even when you're with someone. :]

Large fish, little rice + AYCE = Me very happy.

I've been coming back to this place for a couple of years now. Filled a couple of frequent eater's cards. However it looks like they are cutting back. The last time visited they took a few things off the menu, like Uni. About 25-30 bucks (pre tax-pre tip-pre drink) depending on if you hit dinner or lunch.

I go here because it's close.

Yellowtail collar is strong. Fish is fresh. Only thing I don't like is that the rice falls apart too easily. That is kind of a big thing when it comes to sushi.

Would I go here again? Sure, but I definitely would drive farther to go to a better place.

Sushi Mon's Chef Soto is one of Las Vegas' best-kept secrets!* Go right before lunch ends, around 3PM, sit at the bar, and make a new friend.  I  have him do an omakase-style meal of nigiri and the daily specials (which are all reliably great!), and eat until I can't anymore.
Soto is good at pacing so you can enjoy quite a few pieces of fish before unbuttoning your pants or admitting defeat, and is quite charming to make conversation with as you munch.

Stellar stand-outs: fresh scallop, garlic tuna, cajun albacore, tuna hand roll, ika with mint (totally crazy!), and the sea bass. Sides of mussels, miso, orgasm salad and/or sashimi salad are also good add-ons. 

I'm not too big on rolls here unless I'm ordering to-go, but the Lemon roll, Crispy Spicy Roll, and Moon roll are all good picks- they have quite an extensive menu organized by specials, fried rolls, and tempura rolls and most have pictures to accompany them.

For dessert, I tend to stick to the classic green tea ice cream which is never gritty or chalky, while my BF swears by their tempura ice cream (today's special flavor was chocolate-fudge), but they also have a green tea creme brulee on the dinner menu that I've been meaning to try.

All the staff here are incredibly friendly and genuine, but Chef Soto is my favorite. Even if he's not working, all the guys are willing to feed you the best quality and best tasting fish in town, served with a smile and a joke or two.

EDIT: dropping my rating. Chef Soto and several other familiar faces behind the bar are gone, and with them the top-notch service and quality I've loved about this place.

I live close by so I always drop in late night since their open till 2am.
For the all you can eat sushi of $27...you can't go wrong.  I'm not a fan of their yellowtail sushi...one time it didn't taste fresh so now I stick to the rolls.  My fav by far is the Jay Jay roll...shrimp tempura, avocado, philly creamcheese, asparagus, wrapped in seaweed and rice...topped with eel sauce...melts in your mouth!!!!!  This roll is priced at $8.  You can't go wrong with all the other rolls either...and their reasonably priced, but if you can put down some sushi..go with the all you can eat! :)
Location is decent...not like super nice but it's decent..at least they have a flat screen where they have sports on all the time!

If you have a craving for sushi and you need to feed it really quick with good sushi then this is the place, but if you want to really impress a date or significant other..hit up Yellowtail on the strip!

ps.  Jay Jay roll! my fav!

After moving to Henderson/Vegas 2 months ago, I've finally found my new favorite sushi restaurant. Everyone was incredibly nice (especially our chef!) and most importantly, the sushi was wonderful. Definitely plan on coming back!

All you can you sushi made to order in Vegas. Very fresh sushi in the middle of the desert believe it or not. For around $25/person you get a wide variety of fresh sushi and side dishes. The restaurant was not too big but we came for lunch on Sunday so we didn't have to wait, I heard it gets crowded at peak times. My favorite are definitely all the nigiri and they don't give you a huge piece of rice as filler. There are a couple of high end more expensive items on the menu that you can only have one order per person. I say take full advantage and order it all because they were all very delicious; Uni, sweet shrimp, cajun salmon, amberjack, and yellowtail collar. 

We stuffed our face and proud of it. All you can ask for in Sushi are freshness and variety and SushiMon satisfy both. Only downside, it is located about 20min drive from the main strip and if you do not have a car, it's not worth it to taxi out there.
i really liked this place, the prices are reasonable, the servings are generous, the food is good, and the service is not too slow.

After waiting for hours to get a table, FINALLY!!!  I can't believe that I consumed so much sushi in an hour.

The fishes are fair, the service is sub-par, but the prices are really good.

I'm usually very skeptical of AYCE sushi... but this place was surprisingly good. 

Decent sushi (quality and prep), great selection of the basics and the rolls. They don't have any fancy fish selections but they have the basic and they are done well. The fish was fresh, the service quick. The fish to rice ratio of the nigiri was good. The rice was done well, not too tangy, not mushy, doesn't fall apart. Loved the yellowtail, red snapper, and albacore that day. I'd say pass on the fried oysters and the green mussels. Rolls are ok. 

All in all, definitely worth the $30 and the ~25mins drive off the strip (as a vegas visitor).

I love u guys to death! But these continued 30-45 min waits are getting old! When are u going to expand this location!? And if u aren't u need to create some kind of VIP program!! U should have some kind of VIP card for ur customers that are at ur establishment all the time! The ones u know by name! Or maybe start taking reservations! I have to take my business else where tonight! PLEASE, as a loyal customer, please start takin care of us!!

iono about you TODAI, but this place has the best AYCE sushi 

the first time i came here when i was in vegas, i was too hungover so i didnt have room in my stomach for AYCE so i just ordered 2 rolls special of my choice out of their selection and it was last then $10. i dont remember what i got but i all i know is that the rolls i got were fresh and comforting

so..for the REAL review..came back to this place last weekend..yes another trip to VEGAS! i feel like its my 2nd home alreadyyy

i was ready for the $25 AYCE sushi..started off with salmon collar and tuna poki salad! amazing!! u HAVE to get the salmon collar..i also tried the mussels, gyoza, and the seaweed salad, all awesome!

then i had sunrise roll, baked 428 (chicken teryaki inside a sushi?!)  flying jason roll, baked dynamite roll, tried the quail egg shot, halibut nigiri, salmon nigiri, and the Jala Jala roll...im sure theres more but when i remember, ill update

for dessert, green tea and strawberry mochi ice cream, lychee sorbet (YUM) and then to finish it off, tempura ice creamm!!!

you can have it all, just for $25...and this place opens til 2 AM WAHH

The All You Can Eat Option is the way to go at this restaurant. 
There are plenty of choices and everything is made fresh to order. The fish is very fresh. Service is excellent and the entire staff is super friendly. Definately a much better value for your $$ then most of the sushi places in town.

I was brought here by a relative and loved it but I have been bummed out that every time I try to go back the line is out the door! This is a good thing for them, but not for me when I'm starving. Sushi Mon, If you read this, GET A BIGGER RESTURANT so I can eat too!!!

FYI, door opens at 5pm, be sure to get there early. $25 for all you eat (1 hour limit)

On a recent trip from Oahu, we ran into this restaurant while searching for an all you can eat sushi joint...
The 4 of us got there at about 7:30pm on a Wednesday night and had about an hour and a half wait. Besides the reservationist/cashier being a little on the rude side, and the all you can eat sushi menu only allowing each person only 1 order of uni, ama ebi, and the hamachi kama each, the fish was very fresh, and they had nice size cuts of fish on their nigiri sushi. All in all I'd give it a thumbs, and will be returning there on my next visit to Las Vegas! I just hope the reservationist/cashier doesn't read this or the next time my wait will be even longer, buahahaha.

Now who loves Sushi, I do, I do. Well if you're like me and can be picky at times, Ha Ha Ha.  You will be pleasantly surprised that this small place packs a huge punch with delicious food and great customer services. I went for the early lunch All You Can Eat and I had the Sexy Lady Sushi roll and it was amazing full of flavor and I couldn't get enough of it. The Spider roll was also a top pick and all the other appetizers I tried I really enjoyed. The staff from Chef to wait staff were really good and very attentive to our table. There's no shortage of parking and their restroom was very clean. The grand finale of my lunch was dessert and their Strawberry Monchi ice cream made my day. Be sure to get a stamp/initials to your loyalty card, because after 10 stamps you get a free dinner.

Definitely a go to place when you're in Vegas and want AYCE Sushi.  

Let me start off with the place.  It's a pretty small location and with the amount of interest, this place gets packed and wait times can range from 10 min to 90 min+.  On our last trip there, we had a party of six and what disturbed us the most was that seating was not on a first come first served basis for larger groups.  You would expect the staff to hold tables that are next to each other and almost nearly closing out to fit a larger group but that was not the case.  Groups of four was being seated before us and we had to wait for a larger table that would normally fit six.  We had to wait almost 90+ minutes before we got a table.  My recommendation is to get there before they open which I believe is 11am or after 2pm when it starts to die down.  

The food there is awesome!  Nothing to complain about.  Try anything that catches your eye.  My top picks are the white tuna, garlic ahi, ama ebi, unagi, masago w/ qual eggs, calamari, shrimp tempura, etc.  

It looks like they opened another location so we'll most likely try that place out when we're back in town.
If you're looking for sushi in Vegas, this place is fantastic. A little off the beaten path for tourists (not a negative, really), the food was stellar.

Went in to try this place again tonight after about 5 years and the sewer smell was the same as the reason we stopped going here. They told us it's only been like that a week and they don't know where it's coming from. I told them it was from the sewer system pipes and we left.

I really don't get why people like this place so much. i go all the time because it's near my house but there are like 5 others in a 2 mile radius that serves all you can eat and is way better.  For awhile I thought the staff was kind of rude. I don't need them looking over my shoulder to see if my half bite of my friend's sushi roll is breaking their "no sharing" rule. Dang, I just want to try so I know whether or not to order. I recommend I love Sushi or Kaizen Sushi (more expensive though). They're close and off Eastern.

I live in the Bay Area so I love fresh fish and sushi rolls. After hearing my cousin, who lives in Vegas, tell me this is the best AYCE spot, I had to stop by. I got seated at the bar right away. I give one star to the staff for being nice and attentive. One star for the quick service and getting my food out quickly. One star for some pretty fresh Salmon nigiri. But their rolls were just not good enough. None of the rolls wowed me enough. I liked a couple rolls but it just wasn't that great. I really liked how big their menu was and how many options they had but I don't think I'll be back again.

Lots of positives. They're open late, you can order half rolls to get more variety, service is pretty quick. There's plenty of cooked stuff for those adverse to raw fish.

We arrived at around 9:30 on a weekday and the restaurant was still at least half full. We were seated quickly, and we noticed a sign saying we only had 1 hour, so we ordered hot tea and a few rolls literally right as we sat down. Our waitress put our order in, and we got some more time to take a closer look at the menu. 

Round 1 comes, and we order our round 2 right away. Then round 3 and 4 fairly soon after that. By round 4, our waitress said to us "you guys know the rules, right? no leftover rice?"
Us: uhh... I think so?
Waitress: you guys still have a monster roll coming
Us: yea, we know

Hahahaha, she wasn't rude about it, but more shocked at how much we were ordering. We read over the rules, just in case, and asked her about the 1 hr rule. She said we were okay, they just don't allow customers to sit for 30 mins before ordering again. We continued for several more rounds, and then even ordered 2 rounds of dessert. I loved the green tea ice cream, but the lychee sherbet was a close second.

The fish was pretty decent. Ami ebi was awesome, and so was the yellowtail collar (warning, you can only have 1 order per person of these). Plenty of variety, and definitely worth the $27.

Low quality food and service.
Not worth the high price tag of all you can eat.
I've been to places cheaper than this with top notch customer service and food quality.

We were never introduced to our waiter, had to order from the lady that seated us, after getting our first order and when we were ready to order another round we ended up waiting 30 minutes and the lady we initially ordered from informed us that she is not our waiter. 
Soda was watered down, tuna had a odd consistency, and it took forever to order.

Will not be coming here again.
There are many other sushi restaurants, I recommend going anywhere else.

Loved this place !! Very good for All You Can Eat and at a great price !! The service was very good and they were packed !! 

Very large selection of AYCE and fast with getting it out to you ! They are open from noon till 2am and we ate at the bar ! We will definitely go back ! The place is very clean and expect a little bit of a wait !!

Sushi to rice ratio is way off. 2x the rice to thin slice of fish. Don't order appetizers  (miso soup / seaweed salad) they put extra salt to get you to drink more and eat less. They get mad if you don't finish every grain of their rice. "That's a 'no no'. You must eat all rice or they charge you" says the waitress. Who is "they"? Lol 

Quality of cuts is not good as the sushi "chef" leaves the tough "silver skin" in the fish, making it disappetizing. Add the excessive rice clump to the mix and you get expensive gas station quality sushi.

1 star for the can of Febreeze in the bathroom.  Thank you ;)

Tip: You can easily dump their excess sushi by putting all of it into a napkin and flushing it into their toilet! Or load your mouth and spit it into the toilet, if you don't want to keep asking for napkins!)

Health: Kitchen has a moldy stink to it. You may want to give it a wiff while waiting for your table. You may change you dining plans afterwards. I didn't notice it until I went to dump my rice load. 

Go to Kazuki Sushi on Decatur. WAY BETTER AYCE!

Great place for sushi but also offers other great options. My bf and I go here frequently, the downside is there is usually a wait but they are good at seating as soon as possible. The food here is good and they have some pretty good deals. We often get the dinner special and the beef dinner special they are good with a lot of food and a great price.
Food always good and fresh, get all you can eat, try everything, Salman is the best, I prefer cooked rolls and the cook came up with some special rolls Cartered to my liking

Ok..so if u want me to get straight to the point. I have been to this locatiom 3x. It NEVER dissapoints. I am talking about the best sushi in TOWN!!!! Moon roll, miles roll, JJ Roll the list goes on..chefs are great, food is exceptional, wait staff is friendly. The price moderate, for AYCE, but its worth every penny. This location is better than the one on W. Sahara, since they have more to offer. If someone talks about Sushi-Mon go to THIS LOCATION!!. The sushi chefs are much better, and the food is better and they have more to offer on the menu. Everything comes out fresh, and have not once have had a complaint. Don't forget the strawberrry mochi, and ice cream tempura, baked mussels and ahi poke are great too. This is the real deal, for sushi in vegas, forget the strip, with the over priced rolls. This is the best deal in town, and the best sushi in TOWN!!! If anyone out of town, asks me about sushi, i tell bring them here!

Staff was really friendly as I've always remembered from previous visits when I would be in town. But the quality of the food has unfortunately gone down! 

The chicken yalitori is a thick cut piece of teriyaki on a stick instead of small pieces of juicy chicken. The amount of rice that comes with the nigiri remains small but the quality of the unagi, super white, seared salmon, hamachi, and tamago have declined since my last visit a couple of years ago. Maybe the rolls are still delicious but I only ate nigiri on this visit. 

On the bright side, the tempura is as delicious as I remembered. The yuzu sorbet I could have eaten for the whole hour I was there if I hadn't come with an appetite. 

AYCE- lunch $21.95 / dinner $26.95.

Great "All You Can Eat" sushi restaurant! They have a huge selection of specialty rolls that you must try. Loved the "Sexy Girl" and "Crispy Rice!"  And...save room for ice cream!  Head there early for din (or you may need to wait up to 90 min for a table) and bring your appetite! :)

Food wz good. If you want ur food timely, you need to order at least 15 mins ahead of time. Service is slow, especially if there's more than two tables occupied. I like Makinos better. I get what i want, when i want it.

My wife and I love sushi.  We have been to several Sushi restaurants and sushi buffets in Las Vegas and Henderson.  Personally, I think Sushi Mon is the best - however, it is one of the most expensive.  The only knock on them is:
a.  $27 price tag per head - ouch -- pretty pricey.  Most sushi buffets run around 20-24 bucks.  If you look around, you can get some under 20 too...  If they lower their weekly prices, they probably get more customers. 
b.  1 hour time limit on dinner -- early in the meal, rather than enjoying the meal, I found myself "clock" watching.  But, actually, this was not bad, after 45 minutes, I was ready to be rolled out in a wheel barrow.  I was stuffed and felt like I was going to give birth. Being a guy, this probably would be my 15 minutes of fame on CNN.
c.  You may have to wait 20-40 minutes.  By the way, problem with waiting is that there is NO waiting area.  The street is it.  

We have been here 3 times already.  Unfortunately, they do not take reservations.. Be ready to wait in line.  The first time we were here, we had to wait 45 minutes (ended up shopping at Smith's grocery store to past the time).  Secondly, I would recommend asking to be seated at the BAR.  When they seat you at the table, they give you this menu and you have to hail down a waiter.  I rather sit at the bar and watched the "sushi guys" make the sushi.  Also, you get quicker service instead of waving down a waiter.  You can ask the sushi guy directly to make you the roll.  As for the sushi, it was fresh!  We love the cooked eel, salmon, and yellowtail.  yum... definitely, we will be back!

The sushi quality is fantastic--I can't believe that it's AYCE. And you can get one order of uni, sweet sushi, and some of the other pricey sushi that they have on special. Frequently, you can't see the rice at all underneath the nigiri because the large planks of fish cover the rice entirely. Definitely worth driving away from the strip for.

I don't understand what all the hype is about this place. 
My first experience here, I did not do the all-you-can-eat, but the rolls and sashimi I ordered were just awful. Everything I ordered came warm and sticky, like it had been sitting out for a while. I gave this place a second chance when I went with my man and some friends, and it wasn't any better. 

Major disappointment after all the good things I had heard.

If I could rate this place a zero, I sure would.

My favorite Sushi restaurant. I know there is better and this place is not all fancy inside but I have never had bad Sushi here. The service is also awesome and the staff is great. The place is always packed, that should tel you something, but if you go early you can usually get in pretty fast. The appetizer menu has a ton of items and with the all you can eat you get appetizers and desert. Last time we went in they had taken the Mochi ice cream off the all you can eat but go ahead and splurge to get it, it is awesome!
back for more food, so happy they went up to an A rating. My confidence is back, so is my business, highly recommend
All you can eat sushi, but the catch is that you can only order three dishes (per person) at a time, and finish before you are able to order another round.

Gone downhill!   It used to be one of our favorites for AYCE sushi. We would go almost once a week but slowed down the frequency when we thought their quality was slipping. We noticed a big change with the new management.  Place looks old and bathrooms need cleaning. The food was really disappointing. None of the fish seemed all that fresh although the tempura was still good. If you loved the old Sushi Mon, you may be disappointed with the changes as they are not for the better.

One of the top ayce in town. Service is slow and can take minutes to hours to be seated because of how small the restaurant is. The food itself is great and is always delicious. Average pricing and creative rolls.

just wanted to say it is and always will be my choice of sushi bars. I was introduced by the old chef from NOBU, Lindsey. And i have never really eaten at any other local places. Yum! cant wait till next time

First off, it's hard to compare this place with other sushi joints local to Las Vegas because I am technically a Southern Cali girl. But Overall, I did have a good experience at this place. 

Some friends and I were running some last minute errands in Las Vegas and we were way off the strip to take care of them. We were also quite hungry and just looking for some decent food we saw along the way. It was either Sushi or Greek. Everyone felt like Sushi so as soon as I saw a decent Sushi place, I said "let's go to THAT one!". 

So we parked and headed inside. This place is TINY as heck. We luckily got seated fast but then a line started to form immediately after us. We definitely lucked out! I can only imagine how long you must have to wait to be seated when there are so few seats in this joint.

The service was not bad. But they did forget TWO of our orders. But the sushi was very good. We didn't opt for the All You Can Eat because there's no way I could eat $27 worth of sushi all by myself. I wasn't THAT hungry. I instead just ordered 2 rolls which came out to less than $15 total and I was a happy camper. The rolls were delicious and satisfying. 

This place is busy and seems very popular among all. It must be a rare good sushi place in Vegas and so that's why everyone comes here. In my personal opinion, it's very hard to find good Asian food in Vegas. I have not been very impressed but this place is the first to semi impress me. I would actually come back again if I felt like driving off the strip for some sushi.

We came here on Saturday night for all you can eat Sushi for $27.99 and I must say this was one of hte best Sushi places I have eaten in ages!!!
The best seat is by the sushi bar and the service is faster than you can blink!
When you order a side such as seaweed Salad  you barely are done with the word and your salad is there! and all 5 star!

The wine/beer menu is very cheap also .. 3.65 for a glass of wine?! How cool is that!

Also you get a free Sake shooter included with your meal!

I will DEF be back when I can get to Vegas again!

This place is the exact same as Sushi House Goyemon. 

Everything on the menu is the exact same, therefore I love it just as much and was the same enjoyable experience.

Decor is not as good as Sushi House Goyemon but taste is the same.

Overall service and everything is awesome. The store is small so there might be a little wait time from 20-60mins.
Pretty good all you can eat sushi spot in Las Vegas! Sat at the sushi bar and service was definitely quick and we enjoyed our sushi chef Yasu! Would definitely recommend!
Always great sushi no matter if you are doing AYCE or individual orders. Always a wait for this place.

Average AYCE sushi.

They don't have no real crab meat, even outside the AYCE menu - imitation crab is a deal breaker for me. While some items were good, others not so much. The chef was a nice guy.

Probably it's just that I'm not into AYCE sushi. Maybe I'm just missing Tsukiji Sushi-Zanmai for the incredible value for the price. I know, this is America...

I've been to Sushi Mon many times before and I feel like each time I go I'm more disappointed. I used to love Sushi Mon and would tell everyone it was the best sushi  spot around. However, the past few times I've gone the quality has not been as great as it used to and the service isn't that wonderful either. 

I went with a friend last night and we waited over 40 minutes to be sat. That isn't too unusual for Sushi Mon and before I never minded the wait. However, sushi mon has a website where you can check who is next on the wait list. When we were next to be sat, a party of four was sat down before us and then we were sat shortly after. Not a big deal, but a host should always follow the list. Especially when we had been waiting beyond our quoted time. The server, Claire, also took the order of the table next to us before taking ours. She waited approximately 10 minutes to come take our order and was extremely rude to us when she came to our table. In the middle of our order for AYCE she said "okay is that enough for first round?" Even though the table next to us had ordered far more she never asked them if they were done ordering. Once we ordered our food it took a very long time for it to come out even though the table next to ours who she clearly favored got their food shortly after placing their order. 

The sushi was alright, definitely not as good as it used to be. I found the presentation of the sushi to be sloppy and inconsistent. So with the average sushi and poor service it's safe to say that after being a very loyal Sushi Mon customer I'm not sure if I'll be returning.
Always a wait. The absolute freshest sushi. Great service in spite of being very busy. Worth a try for sure

Everything about this place is just OK. Went in, staff was welcoming and kind. Attentive for the most part. Atmosphere was clean as well and the sushi was just OK. It didn't taste bad but it wasn't memorable also for me compared to other sushi spots I've ate. If I had to pick a roll I liked the best, it would be the Royal California. Their Baked Mussels is pretty good. Not really much I can say more but that.

I have been around the sushi block and I will say that this is still my favorite. I wish the wait was not so long at times and the service could be better, but I do think that the quality and consistency of their fish is incredible.

First of all I would like to recommend this place start taking reservations. Our group lost 2 members due to some confusion about wait time. We were told 1 hour and really only waited 20 minutes. 

AYCE sushi should warrant a wait (as in 4 laps around the parking lot before you are allowed to sit down) and sushi is prepared fresh--- no rolls sitting under fluorescent lights here!

Started with seaweed salad, which was followed by;
Mingus roll
Domingo roll
Yebisu roll
Jala Jala roll
Hurricane roll
Ecstasy roll
Red dragon roll
Pastel roll
Mussels
a few nigiri rolls (yellow tail, halibut)
along with smelt/quail egg roll

My stomach hurt so good that I somehow managed to have a bite of strawberry mochi!!

Dinner was about $26 a person (beverage not included), well worth the wait.

This is my husbands and I's  favorite place to eat sushi. Great fresh fish, and speedy service! I only wish that they expanded the property. It gets a bit stuffy and its usually busy. So for the most part you will be waiting at least 30 mins if you go in the evening. Thank goodness they opended up a sister property Goyemon which gives you the same great taste with great ambience plus its on our side of town. Cant go wrong there! either way its worth checking out :)

Had a craving for sushi and found this place from Yelp.  It was the closest Sushi place from our hotel and the rating was pretty high so we decided to check it out.  

Had an awesome experience, very friendly staff and the fish was high quality.  Good thing we ordered the all you can eat since we ate almost triple of the  amount of what they charge for ayce.  Our sushi chef's name was Mike, very friendly and knowledgable.

We will definitely visit again the next time we're in town and will recommend the place to our family and friends.

We had a good experience in this small restaurant with big surprise in flavors.
The sushi and sashimi was very good absolutely tasty made. Come here if you are looking for fresh and simple sushi that will melt in your mouth. The price was really reasonable with good service. I love to have lunch in this restaurant.

I don't understand the big deal with this place. Yeah, it's open til 2 am, yeah it's all-you-can-eat, but I'd rather eat at Yama earlier or spend like $5 more at Osaka (which is also open til 2 am and has a late night discount menu, which includes philly rolls and japanese lasagna).

The rolls are DECENT. Nothing spectacular. They don't bond the seaweed/rice properly. Or perhaps the rice isn't cooked right. But the rolls look like crap and fall apart easily. 
Japanese lasagna is ONLY tolerable at Osaka. Anytime I see it on a menu somewhere else I have to try it. And it disappoints. Always.

This place is too small. Good luck trying to get a party of 4+ in here. The service is sub-par. It's usually loud as hell and packed - inside and out. I'm not waiting. I don't want to drive to eat somewhere and find out it's too busy to serve me. So I just don't go here - period.

I'm trying to sample most of the good sushi places in Vegas, and when I find an affordable place that serves good standard AND special rolls, I return frequently, especially when service isn't lacking. AND I tell everyone I know about it. Sushi Mon just isn't worthy. Kekkou desu!

If you want bad service & ok sushi, then this is your place.Don't be fooled by the yelp sticker on the front door! We arrived at 1:15 pm.  We needed service for 3 adults & 1 child.  We had to wait for a table, no problem. There is no waiting area. We stood there, blocking the door with our 2 infant car seats, toddler, & 3 adults.  Who's gonna wait outside in the 100deg heat?!   We finally sat down at 1:50, the tables had been clear for a good 10 mins before they finally sat us.   Another 15 mins to tell them we wanted AYCE, we were able to order some food.  
Cons: SLOW AND INCONSIDERATE STAFF.  They need more help, 2 servers & a busser were clearly not enough for the busy lunch hour.  I heard the busboy tell the server we were ready, he simply said ok, I'll be there.  Then 10 more mins passed by.  Not that he wasn't busy, but he was too busy doing other things then to come & take our order.  Then he & the other server had to discuss which one was taking our table.
-The red bean ice cream they served was old-tasting & old-looking.  My friend asked if she could get another since it was so ice cold, her spoon was about to become disfigured as she tried to eat it, but the server said that was how it came, "hard as a brick, sorry".  
-We had to flag them down for everything...
Pros:
-the AYCE menu included hot/cold appetizers as well.  I thought that was a good deal. 

Be back? Probably not, since there are at least 3 more sushi restaurants within a 5 mile radius competing for my business.
Very good AYCE, love the fact that you can do half orders of most rolls.  The chocolate mousse is fantastic.  Not a large restaurant so there is usually a small 10-20 minute wait.

About 9 pm on a Thursday evening, we're off work for the holidays, and craving sushi. So of course it's time for Sushi Mon!

The AYE menu is generous, the staff always friendly, the fish always fresh and my belly always happy and full when I leave. Dang. As I'm writing this review I'm craving it again...

I really like their fried calamari - it's lightly seasoned, fresh, and served with a hint of sauce over a small bed of lettuce.

Here's a tip:  Order from the specials board 1st because items sell out quickly. Be sure to pay attention to the different colored stars since they indicate if you can order 1 per person or more.

My favorite for years was hamachi (yellow tail), but Sushi Mon's super white has taken over. So delicate, fresh, and tender. The halibut is also really nice with just a tiny hint of citrus (I think?).

I also usually love the Sexy Girl (I order a half roll), but the Crispy Rice with spicy tuna will definitely be a repeat.

I always forget my punch card, so thank you for stamping my receipt. Now if I can stop losing my receipts...  No matter, it won't stop me from enjoying Sushi Mon's awesome food!

This is a regular stop for us in Vegas...great price for all you can eat sushi (and green tea ice cream).  This time around was a different story...they brought us a tray of gray....yes, GRAY...fish and tried to pass it off as Toro.  For you sushi eaters in the know - Toro is like the filet mignon of tuna.  One of the girls in our group (who speaks Japanese) spoke to the owner and told her we were not comfortable eating GRAY fish...the owner replied that it was flown in the day before but we were stil skeptical.  No one touched it...not even the guys in our group who will eat anything. 

Sorry Sushi-Mon...can't bullsh*t the bullsh*tters...we won't be back!!!

Very good sushi,  not too much rice at all.  Great selection of all types of nigiri sushi,  we didn't bother with the rolls or appetizers.  Sit at the bar, you'll probably get better,  quicker service but you better know what to order.  Save room for dessert,  the green tea and red bean ice cream is da bomb.

If you go with a group of friends, all of you do the all you can eat. They won't let you share if you are doing the AYCE and a friend isn't.

When i feel like having sushi at work for lunch, I always call here for an order to pick up ;) Its really convenient and ready to pick up in 10 Minutes. 

I usually come here for the AYCE special. You have two sides on the menu and the appetizers and ice cream desserts are also included in the AYCE menu. 

The shrimp Tempura and the Ahi Poke are my two favorite appetizers. I will usually order five servings in one sitting. ;) Great stuff. 

My newest favorite roll there is the Mesquite Roll. Its a Spicy tuna roll topped with Raw Salmon and Mango strips topped with a mango chutney sauce. This roll is refreshing and different from the usual rolls on the menu. 

The place is usually always busy when i go there to eat and the staff usually is very attentive. 

You must try some of the baked rolls that they have on the menu, its really good and I am starting to order those a lot more every time i visit. I order the Jason Roll: California roll with scallops and cream cheese, baked and topped with yum yum sauce. It melts in your mouth, but watch out, let it cool down before biting into it its HOT. and attempting to pick it up while hot is a no-go. haha unless you want it on your clothes...i would wait a little bit. 

This place is family friendly and don't forget to try some of the special rolls that they put out (usually its written on paper and pasted on the walls in the restaurant) 

Happy dining!!!

The host was the manager I'm sure and was the most unaccommodating person ever. Do u want business or not? We had a party of 10 people and we were willing to squish and he was NOT willing to accommodate?! Wtf...

Nigiri comes with a big piece of rice thats hella hard, and we were supposed to eat all of them?! I would have if they cooked it better. and employee kept pushing us to finish the damn rice. Ugh

They gave us 45 min limit for all u can eat but it took them half hour to bring out each order...what?

Mediocre in every aspects.

One of the best sushi experiences of my life.
I started to get adventurous with the menu and the sushi chef offered small tastes of things to me, instead of whole rolls or plates. I was super impressed with this, and I could also say that this was the freshest sushi I ever had...I am not a sushi snob, but its some fine ass sushi. lol
Price is right, we did AYCE. I would be back in a heartbeat.
My husband and I had only seen an udon noodle bowl of soup this amazing looking on the travel channel. Definitely our favorite spot from now on.

This is my favorite sushi joint! It has become a comfort place for me. They should make the dining area bigger since a lot of people come here and the lines are always long. The food is always fresh and yummy!

This is perhaps the worst service I've experienced from any sushi restaurant. I was out to dinner with 2 friends & after reading the reviews this place relieved, it sounded fantastic. After the first round of orders the quality of the service & sushi went down drastically. The server let us sit for 15min after taking our plates from the first order before returning to take our follow up orders. When the 2nd order had been placed, our server returned 10min later & rudely questioned if we could even finish our order. This led to another 10min wait before receiving our food. I understand having to serve & accommodate other orders/customers, but the delivery of our food was a slow & drawn out process, especially when compared to the super quick food drops when we first sat down. Sushi that was supposed to be hot was cold, & the cold sushi was warm as if it had been sitting out. At this point we knew we were no longer wanted. After flagging down our server, we requested dessert along with the bill. The mochi was on point, but the tempura ice cream was presented in a soggy condition, ending our evening at this establishment. All of this & they had the nerve to ask for a 12% percent gratuity on the check. They treated us horribly as customers. We were not loud in anyway,  rude or disrespectful in any manner, or deserving of this horrendous customer service. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. Don't waste your time or money.

The Best all you can eat place!!
i live in LA and i would sometimes drive to vegas with my friend just to go to this place!
The sweet shrimp with the fried head is a must! its SOOO good!
i love their yellowtail, unagi, and their yum yum scallop is also good. \
for dessert, definately try the tempura ice cream! the best thing ever!!
and rememebr to get the stamp card. You can get one free all you can eat if you have 10 stamps!

This is a quality neighborhood sushi joint. The service was very friendly and prompt, the fish fresh, and the $26.99 AYCE for dinner was a great deal. We had several rolls: sexy girl, athena, tiger, and 911 (which was disappointingly un-spicy). For nigiri we opted for uni (limit one per person for ayce), salmon, scallop and tuna.  We also had two orders of their calamari which was great. All in all the food was fresh, service friendly and on point. I am marking one star off because Athena roll was bland and 911 roll was not as spicy as advertised.

I've tried plenty of all you can eat sushi restaurants in Vegas (they seem to be popping up everywhere). Now it's kinda hard to go to a place like Little Buddha and pay $20 for a roll knowing you can go to Sushi Mon and pay about $30 for all you can eat. Usually when I hear all you can eat or buffet, I would say I am not interested because of the quality of the food.

Sushi Mon is def. the best for all you can eat for locals. You get the same thing for lunch, so it would be better to go for lunch if you can and pay less. They have a ton of rolls here-which are all really good-too many to mention. Alot are covered in sauces, but its not overboard like some other sushi restaurants. I also like how you can get a half order of the rolls. 

Sushi seems fresh and the place is reliable. Waitresses are fast and available. I have tried to take out of town visitors here, but if they want some cool Vegas type place I guess this would not be the place to go. You would have to go on the strip, but then you pay for it there and portions are much smaller.

I would like this place even more if they let you get sashimi! I have been to another all you can eat in Vegas that has sashimi on the all  you can eat (Hikari) but this place was dirty inside, old looking, ok I will just do another review haha. 

They also have a good choice of appetizers you can get with the all you can eat.
Everything was delicious!  Def worth the money!  Made to order.  So, it's fresh.

Soooooo good! Got the all you can eat sushi, such a great experience! The all you can eat is $22 and the service was great. They help you out if you're not familiar with the menu and are very patient. I would Definitely come back if I'm back on this side of town. Looking for amazing sushi? Come here!

I used to be a regular at Sushi Mon.  It was always one of our favorite all you can eat spots in town.  For some reason we hadn't been in 3 years and decided to dine there tonight.  I went with a friend and my 3 year old son.  My son does not like anything that is typically offered on a sushi menu so I packed a juice box and a plastic bag with something he would eat.  Our server mentioned that it was their policy not to allow outside food and told us that if my son were to eat or drink what I brought we would be asked to leave.  I tried to order a drink for my son (juice or milk) and was told they only carried soft drinks or lemonade.  I didn't want to cause a scene so between sushi rolls I took my 3 year old outside to eat his meal.  It was tough to explain to my son why he had to eat outside in the 105 degree heat.  The most frustrating part of this evening is when we explained to another employee why we were feeding him outside she said that she had never heard of such a policy.  

I was also disappointed in the service we received.  We tried to flag the waiter down for drink refills multiple times with no luck.  Luckily the hostess had a pitcher of water and could at least keep our waters topped off.  There appeared to be plenty of servers and ours did not look overworked but we were not given much attention

The sushi wasn't bad but not like I remember it.  I know this review won't apply to people without kids but Sushi Mon made it very clear that they have enough of a customer base to be family friendly.

I took two sushi fans here for the first time and we had an amazing experience!  The food and service were outstanding!
We got there right around 11:30am on a weekday, and shortly there after the place started to fill up!
I also recommend the call in and pick-up...they took about 10-15 min to make my rolls!

AYCE sushi! U said the magic words! I'm such a sucker for good sushi!
We came here on the last day of our trip.  It was 20mins away from the strip, located in an Asian strip mall.  Wait time was abt an hour.

Place is small, seats abt 50 at most?
Service was great! we had Hamachi and salmon belly (which both r soooo good) baked muscles, and tons of rolls.  We started to order everything and anything, since we all were pretty hungry.  

it was $22/person.  Which is an awesome price!!! 
Thanks for being a hidden gem!

I had this the weekend I was in Vegas for my birthday. I didn't get the AYCE but their rolls are really good. They aren't super huge but if you get it as AYCE it would be a great way to try em all. They also have strawberry mochi for dessert. All orders came pretty quick.

Love this little all you can eat sushi! !! Best sushi in town, I think.. All the sushi is super fresh,  rolls are amazing. . Don't forget to try the yellow tail collar,  it's one of my favorites also the fried shrimp heads!

I heard a lot good thing about this place so we wanted to try out.  We've been some sushi restaurant but I think this will be our spot.  Nigiri sushi were a lot smaller than another restaurants but it was pretty good!  Just order more.  Lol. Rolls are awesome too.  But I didn't  see any noodle menu like everybody posted thogh.  Overview,I'll recommended to my friends.
Perfect quality of food. Perfect service. Fair prices for lunch and dinner. Good location (please come to San Diego). Highly recommend.

We have 3 all you can eat. The selected nigiri we had were all awesome! We had super white tuna, yellowtail, salmon (the best), albacore, Cajun albacore, halibut, red snapper, mackerel, yum yum scallop, salmon roe, and smelt egg. Plus, everything on the board of daily special fish, spider roll, half hurricane, and green tea ice scream and lychee sorbet. One the other friend is a vegetarian. She had everything that has no meat and she loved it!!!
I dont know what happened to this place... It used to be awesome food for awesome prices. But the quality of the food has dropped. I would recommend other places before this restaurant

I'm a very common sushi eater averaging 4-6 time a month. I know when choosing an all you can eat bar over a pay per plate, you are going to lose some quality but my experience at Sushi Mon was just sad! Total lack of care. Rolls were just thrown together, Unagi Sauce on the menus and table, dirty glasses and plates, and the decor was non existent. When spending $27 there are a lot better options in town! 

The ONE positive thing I will say is, the staff was very friendly and provided great service and that's the only reason they got 2 stars!

One of the best sushi places I've been to. I have been to a few, but this one is definitely one of the favorites. 
I have gone there twice in the past couple of weeks for their all you can eat sushi. Amazing service, and the sushi were just delicious! 
A bit pricey, but totally worth it!

I heard about this place from my parents.  When I had to opportunity to go to Vegas for a convention, I suggested it to my coworkers and we went to try it for dinner.  There was a line when we got there and the wait was about 40 minutes.  We weren't in a rush so we killed time by checking out the surrounding stores.  

When we finally got our seats, we immediately told the waitress we wanted the AYCE sushi (all of us love sushi).  It was about $26 at the time.  The one thing that we didn't know going in was that you only have 1 hour for AYCE.  We ending up coming a second time and ordered a lot of plates at the beginning.  When we had eaten about half of the plates, we would order again.  That way, we could eat more and not get full as fast from waiting if you order one plate at a time.  I tried most of their specialty rolls (dragon, caterpillar, tiger, volcano, athena, etc.).  All delicious.  If they have it in stock, you can order sweet shrimp and salmon collar too.  One order per person though, even if you are doing AYCE.  The tempura ice cream was a nice dish to finish off the meal.  We all got our money's worth for sure (and then some).

If you're ever in Las Vegas and have a craving for sushi, definitely consider coming here.  There's another place called 808 Sushi that's similar to Sushi Mon, but I don't think there's a time limit.  I'll have to check it out the next time I visit.

I've been to Sushi Mon in Sahara Ave location and I liked it. I was hoping it's the same but I didn't like it in this location. I was going to give it 1 star but I'm feeling generous today. if I want to be satisfied eating sushi, I will go to Sushi Neko in spring mountain. Compared to this place, its double the fish & half of the rice..

I gave this place a second chance and instantly regretted it. Walked in and waited five minutes to be sat at the sushi bar. There were only four other people in the restaurant! 
I felt rushed the entire time. I got there at 12:45 and didn't get any sushi until 1:05. Then they told me last call was at 1:30. 
The sushi chef was really rude. He held up his finger like I was an inconvenience when I asked for extra sauce.
The sushi tasted ok but it was room temperature and almost warm.
The best part of my meal was the fried stuff because I was able to eat it without feeling like I might get sick.
I probably won't ever go back and the only reason they got two stars was because the servers were friendly and kept checking on me.

Terrible experience. I drove a long way and arrived 11:25 pm. Closing time is 12:00 am. Not even the smallest attempt to put together a to go order. We litteraly got kicked out. Even though the quality is barely to par, the fact that they are open late made up for that. Not the case anymore. Never going back.
Awesome place.  Went to lunch in March.  Actually went twice.  People nice.  Food fresh and delicious.  Will be back when in Vegas again for sure.
Great sushi.  Hamachi handroll was delicious.  Fish was fresh service was good.  Enjoyed the white tuna.  They had Toro on their special and it was fresh.  Service was good.
this is hands down the best AYCE sushi in town.  we typically go for lunch and the price can't be beat.  they have an array of choices in their menu and the sushi masters are really great.

I took my buddy here for his birthday last week. The food was pretty good. I ordered my normal salmon nigiri and a few of their other rolls. Nothing was amazing but it was good for AYCE. Pricing was typical 25-30 per person. The service was good. We enjoyed ourselves.
Excellent. We did the all you can eat with half orders. Fresh and tasty. Because the sushi and service were great.
Great selection, great pricing on the All You Can Eat.  Would go here 5x a week if it wouldn't make me 800 lbs.

DONT ORDER NOODLES! First NO manager working on Sunday at 5pm. 
I ordered the NABEYAKI UDON (Udon noodle soup with chicken, vegetable & shrimp tempura in hot pot) with the EGG OVER HARD. One and half hour later, after sending it back 3X aaaand starving.
