I got this SH*T on the picture!! First they brought a vegetable noodle with egg over easy. Second again vegetable soup with no egg and soggy shrimp tempura. Third time finally the right noodle but NO EGG and NO shrimp. Then I left. So don't be like me and waste your time with stupidity!

If you like sushi rolls you will love Sushi Mon. This place has a huge selection of rolls that leave you spoiled for choice (make sure to choose at least one that has "yum-yum" sauce). The mochi ice cream is great too.

This place has to be the best "AYCE" spot in vegas...

I am a sushi fiend and nothing satisfies or competes with the selection you get here. Service has never been a let down, but if you do decide to show up with a big party, do expect to wait a little bit. 

Sushi is fresh as it gets, and i cant resist their side dishes either! Grilled yellowtail collars, the best baked green mussels, fried shumai, fried shrimp heads, and dont forget the fried (tempura) ice cream! The list goes on and on!

Hands down the #1 sushi spot!

One Love!
Been cmn here for 11 years and it's getting better and better with the years. Love mike the best chef there. The best all you can eat in vegas!

While visiting Las Vegas I just happen to select that place to eat at and wow was it amazing. The sushi was made fresh when we order it and the rolls were delicious. There was a wild selection of available rolls and nigiri and the lycee and tempura ice cream was amazing. The service was fast and very friendly. Definitely coming back here again.
i love piggin out , me and bae went here and we got STUFFED! so delish!

This is my #1 sushi place. The fish is always fresh, and the staff remember me every time. 

Reading some of the negative reviews on this place, I just have to comment.Too much rice and rolls are too big? Come on people! Its sushi, not sashimi. In Japan, the piece of fish you get is HALF the size they serve us in America. So of course your going to rice with your fish. If you dont like rice order the more expensive plate of sashimi instead. 

With that said, they have an extensive amount of rolls to choose from. The price might be a little high ($27 for dinner) but they also have stamp cards for All You Can Eat. Buy 10 and get the 11th free! 

So with good quality sushi comes price, but its well worth it. They are always busy so that has to mean something.

Everyone can argue which AYCE sushi is best in Sin City but in my sushi-venturing tenure, Mon is the best. (Note: OPINION)

This is the sister franchise of the renowned Goyemon, in which I was disappointed with in terms of service. There is practically no difference other than the infrastructure  because they serve practically the same rolls with maybe some minor differences.

Every visit I've had here, they have been on top of their service. The servers tend to lack personalities but who needs personality when you have great service? I routinely begin my rolls with the Volcano, which can take a bit longer but Mon takes a reasonable 5 minutes max as to Goyemon which took approximately 20 minutes. Why such a discrepancy? No excuse other than terrible service.

My favorites: Volcano, sexy girl, ecstasy, philadelphia, hurricane, 911(warning: very spicy hence, the name), cynthia, & stacy.
All cooked to near perfection and delight. Fresh avocado, fish, rice, etc.

Some tips:
- Order by half rolls unless you have a large party. I'm sure you're here to stuff yourselves but you should take advantage of the diversity of the rolls you can get with an AYCE menu. Diversity over quantity.
- Make your order subsequently to receiving. Start with one roll then once it arrives, order your next so that you don't have to wait long periods of time cause sushi does take some meticulous care to make.
- Chew slowly! Since sushi has rice, it has a lot of carbs. No need to be rapid since you get all you can eat cause the faster you eat, the more carbs you consume which fills up your stomach.
- Get a stamp card! Whether or not you're an out of town visitor, you're destined to come back since it's so good and every 10 stamps is one free AYCE meal. They really do accumulate, especially when you come with big parties. 

Don't forget to leave some room(I doubt it) for dessert! They serve green tea ice cream, mochi ice cream (strawberry & vanilla, lychee, etc. 

Overall, I truly enjoy being a local here. You can never go wrong with an endless selection of sushi.

Group of us came here. First time for me and repeat for them. Good idea to order the "all you can eat" for price, speed and selection.
Ordered several items off the menue for all of us and within minutes it was on the table. 
Good food and presentation along with the attention from the server. All around good time here.
Will come back :)

Came through for AYCE lunch on a Friday. We arrived at 12pm, only 15 minutes after opening, and the place was already buzzing. By 12:15 it was packed, although the lunch crowd had cleared out by 1pm.

The food was great! My favorite was the Exstacy roll. I also like that they put extra sauces right on the menu, and of course they are included in AYCE. The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5, is that they did not have any sashimi on the menu. Some other AYCE places will limit you to one order of sashimi per person, but I appreciate having the option. But, their fish was very fresh so we did get a couple orders of plain sushi.

Best all you can eat sushi! Full menu of appetizers and rolls available, as well as your nigiri. 
Definitely try the poke- or have two, as I did. It's that good! 
All of the fish was super fresh and flavorful, and there are some pretty inventive rolls on the menu- admittedly they're a little heavy on the cream cheese and/or avocado, so more Americanized than some people prefer, but it was awesome and affordable and immediately followed by a trip to the gym in an attempt to minimize the damage.
Also wanted to note that the restaurant was packed most of the time we were there, but service was still speedy and very polite and attentive, as well as clean!
Will be back! :)

Sushi Mon is great! We've been to the Maryland location numerous times and have never had a bad meal. Their AYCE Sushi is a pretty decently priced as well.

I really enjoyed the fact that I could order a half order of an item that I wasn't too sure about. This made it easier to order certain things that I wasn't too sure about. But all turned out delicious and the fish is always fresh. 

The only negatives is the building itself is quite small and the wait times can be horrible. They need a larger building.

Ordered carryout sushi, some nigiri and some rice. Uni was not that fresh, but everything else was good. Only complaints are that they gave me tuna instead of salmon even after I repeated my order twice, and that they don't do udon soup as a carryout menu item.
Still love this place! There is always a wait, even at 9pm on a Monday. Such great customer service and really fresh sushi.
The best Sushi in town we always go there for all you can eat Sushi Lunch $21 Dinner $29/person. Try fried Shrimp head and Calamari.

Never fails when I come here. All you can eat is the way to go. They post their nigiri specials on a blackboard which a lot of sushi joints in vegas don't have. Chefs are nice, friendly and attentive.  Great fish to rice portioning. You can have more than one dessert at the end of your meal. This is my go to AYCE sushi because of the consistent excellent expectations.  So far so gooooood!

Sorry for the lack of stars.. It's only cus i've only been here a few times and that was cus it's the closest to my house. The 2 stars are mainly for this cinco de mayo roll I had. It was a whole green chili pepper. The taste was more pleasant it's looks. And the other star is for actually have PLUM ice cream. Other than that.. The price is too dramatic for my belly. And most of the meat here doesn't seem as fresh. Seriously, my wallet is more in pain than the tightness of my jeans at the waist.

whoa. this all you can eat place has me waving the white flag sometimes.

we stroll in here, a few times now, and they never disappoint.

the fish always taste fresh, the fish to rice ratio is perfect. the service is perfect. I really don't have a bad thing to say on this spot after multiple visits.

between this sushi mon and sushi koma, I am a happy camper!

this spot is just as good as their other location on the west side of town. stopped by here recently while coming back from Henderson and was 99% happy with it.

the food was served very quick, the service was on point, the prices are perfect for all you can eat. the only thing I didn't like was the rice to fish ratio. they do put more rice with the fish then the other location does, smaller fish cuts here for sure, but not really that big a deal.

I'm a fan already so I will for sure be coming back to this place if I am in the area

If you don't like the basic rolls then don't come here, variety sucks, fish has a very fishy taste everything is so bland and the green tea ice cream didn't taste the same as it should. Won't be back here

I've come here twice already and the first time I came here it was extremely busy yet i got all my food fast and the service was EXCELLENT. But today i don't know why things are different? Like seriously it was not busy at all and the guy kept messing up our order and the food was coming out extremely slow and it was irritating me because I had somewhere to go. I expected to be out of there around 5 but now it's 6 and I have work at 7 and I was supposed to go to is sweet ugh irritates me when I can't get my daily sweets  like seriously I ordered baked green mussles first and that was the last thing that I got before paying the check. I think our server was Anthony? Well he kept messing up our orders and I asked for the mussles like 3-4 times before I got them. And I ordered one green salad and a poki tuna but I ended up getting two green salads and no poki tuna I had to remind them twice. Like cmon guys it wasn't even busy. Definitely not coming back here when I have somewhere to be because that just totally took all my time and I'm always on a time crunch

For our last few trips to Vegas, we've included a trip to Sushi Mon.  Located off-strip and in a strip mall, don't let the location fool you.  This hidden gem is open til 2am and when we arrived at 9pm, the place was packed to the gills!  A good vibe of hungry and happy customers enjoying their meal.  

For $26.95 (dinner price), you can get AYCE sushi!  Order anything you want off the menu which includes selections of ice cream for dessert.  Not conveyor belt style like most AYCE sushi places.......everything is made to order!   If you're sitting at the counter, the sushi chefs take your order and get right to work.   If you're seated at a table, all of the waiters are very attentive - they make sure you've got something on your plate at all times!   Good customer service makes the experience complete.  

They have every kind of sushi you can imagine, and then some they've created on their own.  My particular favorite is the Volcano Roll.   Baked California roll with yum yum sauce and scallops.  Delicious!  

Sushi Mon is our favorite sushi place in Vegas.  If you're willing to go off-strip, Sushi Mon is a great choice to indulge your sushi craving.

I've had sushi many other places , I have to say this is the best. They have a huge selection and always have special  side dishes on a chalk board. Only down side to this place is the size of it. If they could expand the seating to outside they would be wise. Other than that this place rocks.

This is more than once now that I've come to this location and the service is terrible and the hosts are ridiculous. The only reason I come here is for all you can eat.... you're better off visiting the sushi places in Anthem. Try I Love Sushi or some of the places near there. Will never come back.

my boyfriend's sister, who's a sin city local raves about this place! so on our last visit we made this our final stop just before heading to the airport. i have to admit we were a bit skeptical at first. we're pretty hardcore sushi eaters and this place just seemed way too good to be true!

the four of us came for the sushi buffet at about $25 per person. we seriously tried just about every roll on the menu and were stuffed but still made room for dessert! who could turn down endless green tea ice cream scoops right? the fish was fresh and the rolls each had it's own sushi mon little twist to it. i forget the names, but i enjoyed their variation of the usual spider roll and garlic tuna. 

this place is a super steal at price, quantity and quality! generally a couple rolls sets the check at about $30 at typical sushi bars. needless to say we boarded our returning flight satisfied and full. sushi mon will definitely be one of our number one hit up spots when visiting vegas from now on.

i like this place and love the taste of the sushi. great quality for being no where near the ocean.  only sucky part is being the person who has to eat the leftovers because some girls have hungry eyes...

Firstly, this place smells like sewage.  It's not a random event, it's every day.  Don't be deterred and expect to wait.  It's worth it.  This is our regular place.  The staff doesn't change and neither does the quality.  Don't expect fancy over the top rolls to delight your Instagram followers.  Do expect lots of sashimi choices.  Get a punch card, you will be back.  Consistency is where it's at here.  Also, lunch is cheaper with mostly all the same items.  Order the Cajun albacore and the baked mussels... you will be glad you did.  Lastly, if it's your first time, order half rolls so you can try everything.  Happy sushi eating.

After eating here for many years, our favorite sushi chef Hiro-san is gone and now a bunch of inexperienced chefs have taken over. For the first time in 25 years, I spent the night throwing up bad sushi. This used to be a very nice restaurant with the freshest Sushi. Not anymore.

I love this place! Its best to come at lunch time to avoid the crazy dinner wait. Some times the wait for dinner can be as long as 2 hours but they are open untill 2am!!!

Sushi is great and the rolls are awesome. My two favorites are OID and Yebisu.  This is always one of my first stops when I arrive in Las Vegas.

New management, with better quality of foods! Even isn't AYCE, a la carte menu is valuable and it's delicious!
Just missed Happy hour of beer and sake, on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday only, so we will try again!
Excellent sushi and the all you can eat package is truly a bargain. I highly recommend this awesome restaurant. The staff is friendly and service is quick. The sushi is amazing.

All you can Eat Sushi. 
My friend was raving about how AWESOME this place is....
And when we got there... even HEEE was like.. o snaps... the quality just went down.

I mean it's all you can eat... so I can't really give anything less than a 3. But the servers were hella mad dawg'n at us (I have no clue as to why) and they were slow at bringing us our food.

The only thing that was fresh was the Tuna that day. Everything else kind of tasted old. Iono... business be hard these days....

3 stars. no more.

OK, my 1st review...here it goes...

Arrived at 8 on a thurs night, they said it would be a 30min wait but it was only like 10-15...so not bad at all.  

If you haven't been before it's like $27 i think it was...for all you can eat sushi, rule is no leftovers, and you have to finish the rice.  If your getting rolls I would also recommend ordering half rolls unless u knw of a specific one you really like and know you'll finish with no problems...

We sat at the bar and service was great.  The sushi guy was always checking to see how we were doing with a smile...

Ok, onto the food!  I think I had to be rolled outta the place, everything was so goowd!  

Starters: Green shell mussels are a MUST!!!  I'm usually not a fan but they were really good!
Dynamite was just ok and a lil oily...
Miso soup, tasty and had good amount of tofu.  You can order it with shrimp heads if you want a seafood miso...I think it's alright but my friend loves it...
Shrimp tempura...gotta love it!  Serves hot and perfectly fried

For the nigiri everything was so fresh!  We had garlic salmon, yellowtail, and mackerel (my favorite...fishy I knw but yum!). Order was done quick and don't be afraid to ask for any sauce or extras like jalapeños like we did...(not that it didn't taste great, I just always add extra!   =)

Onto the rolls!  We had the 911 roll...like a spicy tuna roll on crack!  Doesn't seem hot when you put it in your mouth, but like 3.2 seconds later it hits ya and your looking for high quality H2O!   =p

JJ roll...tempura, avocado, asparagus, cream cheese...tasty!!!

And the Sexy Girl Roll...hard time remembering what's in this one...shrimp, scallions, crab meat, avocado maybe?  Very good!...BUT!  This is why I recommend ordering half rolls till u knw what u really like...it was towards the end and was SO hard finishing, 

I did (somehow!) save enough room for desert which is included...choice between green tea, red bean and tempura ice cream.  And vanilla and strawberry mochi balls.  We had strawberry mochi balls, great way to end meal!  And red bean ice cream!  Yummo!  

Great way to get GOOD sushi!  Much better then strip places in my opinion!  

Ok, that was my 1st review!!!  Hope it wasn't too long n hope it helps!!!    =)
Best AYCE sushi spot in Vegas. Service is quick and the fish is amazing. Definitely with the $27 price

Since it can get packed up in there--ya gotta wonder.  Is it hype?  Is it good?  Is it both?  YES.

Apparently they have managed to use quality fresh fish at low prices to their advantage and hence the place is packed.  As good as I have had for "All Ye Can Scarf" Sushi.  This is definitely all about the All You Can Eat vice the a la carte items.  Just be prepared that if you go during typical dinner-evening rush hour times you might wait a bit.  If you are on a tight time-line you should think twice about coming.

For the price of what you get, it is top value in the sushi world.  I was almost expecting mediocore food due to the amount of people and the constant, intense, back-and-forth sushi retrieval operations going on.  However, for the volume and low price, they maintained a decent presentation and didn't do a hatchet job on the sushi/sashimi.

If you wanna binge on sushi of good quality without getting schwacked in the wallet, you can't beat this place.

Used to come here a few years ago as my go to spot, but the last few times were disappointing. It actually used to be pretty good. Something about their rice makes it too soggy and it falls apart. Had some vegetable tempura that didn't even seem fried all the way and was drenched in grease. I probably won't be coming back to be honest.
Excellent Sashimi!! I always get takeout because it's so busy!! Their all you can eat is awesome as well! Friendly staff!

For the price i paid and the quality of the food it was a great deal. I had more then a buffet. I had a feast! Service was good and the food was decent for the price. I cant complain. The ice cream the sake the sushi the tempura. All very good in my opinion. Def. worth stoping in when im in Vegas. Lots of parking, casual atire and prettty much just bring your apetite with you to make it worth it!

If only I can give 0 star I would. This 1 star is for the service. Specifically a server. His name is JEFFREY. Ate here last night with a group of 10. The host sat us quickly and tried to merge 2 tables together but to try to make it easier for them we said they can leave it separated. We sat down and they came back and said the server wants the table together which was fine we didn't really care. They only gave us 3 menus (mind you there were 6 adults and 4 kids. So we asked for more menus no big deal but come on. I mentioned to the server JEFFREY that we plan to split our bill and he said ok but you can tell he was irritated. JEFFREY took 1 person order on one side of the table cause we weren't ready so the other side of the table decided to order. When he was done taking their order I asked if we can order so he wouldn't have to go back and forth and when walking back to the other side of the table he rolls his eyes and mouths "oh my fucking God".  And that's where I lost it. I'm pretty sure it's your job JEFFREY to take our order so why give us attitude for something that's your job!!! I hope the manager sees this post  because it's UNACCEPTABLE!!! Please talk to your employee to ensure this does not happen again.  And JEFFREY learn proper customer service especially if you plan to stay in the food industry.

This place definitely has a huge AYCE menu. Loved the variety! =)

We came promptly when they opened at 11am on a Monday and the restaurant was already have full!  I came at the recommendation of a coworker and he had suggested that I try the yellowtail collar. Unfortunately they don't serve that at lunch. Three of us  ordered off the AYCE menu and the fourth person ordered ala carte. I'm so glad that Sushi Mon doesn't have that rule that everyone has to order AYCE at the table. It is also really cool too that we can order half rolls so we can try a lot more things on the menu.  

We tried so many different rolls, appetizers, nigiri sushi, I can't even remember them all. What I do remember is that almost everything tasted pretty fresh, some of the rolls were really unique and they have AYCE mochi and ice cream for dessert too. Score! 

We were rushing to make sure that we could eat under the 1 hour time limit at lunch, but after awhile we realized that the waiters were pretty relaxed about it. Food came out relatively fast after we ordered and the servers were pretty prompted about filling water and taking more orders. 

Paid about $27 (including tax and tip) for AYCE lunch. 

Sushi Mon is definitely better then some of the AYCE sushi places in Cali!

another place i've been to twice... 
that being said.. it must be good.

the first time we went though, there was a confrontation with a customer about sharing.. being that it is all you can eat, you pay a flat rate of about 25 bucks and technically can only share with those who also have the "all you can eat" menu.  

anyway, there was a big ass scene.. i don't know what exactly happened, but we were sitting right next to the table and it seemed like the dude was trippin' over the mother sharing something with her toddler son..

idk if i liked that too much..

but, all in all.. it's a good place with good sushi..

being that their seems to be a lot of people that go to this place, a reservation would probably be best if your in a large party... or even if there's only 2 ppl in your party.  it's not a very big place and doesn't seat to many people at once.  

since it is all you can eat,  we tried to order all our sushi at once.. and sometimes they forgot to bring something out... but do manage to bring enough out for you to kinda forget... i stress kind of...

anyway, good place... and they're open late!
Food was old and nasty , poor service don't recommend this sushi place , it's a waist of money

This was one of my favorite sushi spots when I lived in Vegas. Their all you can eat is an amazing deal and it gives you a chance to try new things. If you sit at the Sushi bar, the chefs are really nice and great for recommendations. The list of rolls is a little different than most which is kind of fun but they'll make you anything if you ask!

This is probably the best all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas.  The rolls are made fresh to order, the menu has a great selection, and the service is fast.  The best things on the menu besides the rolls are the baked mussels and Ahi Poki.  Just those two I could eat forever.  I would have given this place 5 stars if I didn't have to wait so long for dinner.  But it was well worth the wait.  Sushi Mon needs to expand so they have more tables.

All you can eat lunch is $21.95 and dinner is 24.95, I think. Time limit for lunch is 45 mins and dinner is 60 mins. Service is okay. Food is good, but I can't say I was blown away. For some reason, I like the AYCE in S Rainbow Blvd better. The ones that stood out to me are baked mussels, and volcano roll.

This is a must-hit if you love sushi and you happen to be in Vegas.  

Recently the hubby and I took a trip to Vegas and it was all about eating!  After reading all the great reviews on Yelp, we were excited to try Sushi Mon and it did not disappoint!  We didn't even check in to our hotel, but went directly to Sushi Mon for dinner.  Nothing that says "Welcom to Las Vegas" better than a good AYCE sushi buffet, you know.

They had a wide variety of cooked and uncooked rolls.  We ordered mostly nigiri rolls and they were fresh and tasty!  You definitely need to ask the chef what their daily fresh fish specials were because they were awesome!  Although there is an hour limit, we went over an hour and they did not make any comments.  Maybe it's because we went on a Thursday night and it wasn't that busy?  I also liked how the dessert is included in the AYCE.  It seems like a better deal to eat dinner there because they give you an hour limit, whereas it's a 45 minute limit and a couple of bucks cheaper for lunch.

We will be back!

Quality is amazing for ayce sushi and it's open late. Service I find is usually subpar and though I tip 20% it's because I feel they have a tough job. Sit at the sushi bar in front of Honda for faster service

Definitely off the beaten path, but so worth the drive and the over an hour wait! My girls and I made this our last stop before heading back home to Cali. 

We ordered salmon belly, yellowtail belly, baked mussels, and various rolls that I can't even remember all their names. We even ordered a baked chicken roll, which was not typical, but was unexpectedly tasty! The salmon, yellowtail and baked mussels were my favorites though. The fish was very fresh. Sometimes it's best to keep it simple, especially when you're eating so much!

We thought we would not have much room for dessert, so we decided to share a scoop of strawberry mochi ice cream, lychee sorbet and green tea ice cream. The lychee sorbet was really good, with real chunks of lychee on the inside, but the real winner was the strawberry mochi ice cream. We loved it so much we ordered two more scoops. 

Service was good, though there was a little misunderstanding with quantity (make sure you know how much is in an order) and you can't beat the lunch price of $22 per person. 

My only wish is that they would serve uni for lunch, but will definitely be back!

Although famed for their AYCE sushi specials of which I did not partake, Sushi Mon has solidly well valued, if not great, Japanese food.  This corner shop is more on the "suburban" outskirts of Las Vegas and is in a shopping plaza.

In short, I got a teriyaki lunch special for 6 bucks and it was quite filling with its large bento box full of servings of chicken, rice, tempura, salmon sashimi, gyoza, and the additional (and obligatory) bowls of salad and miso soup. I guess the only minor gripes I had were that the soup was lukewarm, the salad was drenched in dressing, and the salmon was dry. But for the amount of food I got for the money, there's not much else bad to say.

I live close by & I have been here twice. Once with my husband a year ago, at about 5:00PM & the service was good. I took my 19 yo daughter there last week & it was horrendous beyond belief, without apology & remorse from the staff. My daughter had been here last month with her college friends & warned me of their negative experience. We were neither greeted nor served at our table for 10 minutes. I had to ask for water & menus. They came late with a longer wait for the orders to be taken. The soup & salad came, but we had to endure more than 20 minutes for the main order. My daughter's order came & was finished but mine didn't. The waitress walked pass & never bothered to check on us. I went to the counter & asked the male staff if I should be served or I should leave. He was not apologetic at all. He went to the kitchen & I was served a plate of cold food that was obviously left too long forgotten in the kitchen.

Ridiculous! I called to see how long the wait was since I knew they get busy. The girl said there was no wait so I drove straight here only being 1.5 miles away. As soon as I got here, there was magically 8 people ahead of us and now it's an hour wait to get seated!!

I was looking for an AYCE sushi spot near my house and I found this place! We came around dinner time so it was pretty busy. The restaurant is kind of small and we were seated at the bar so we had to squeeze in next to other people. 

Our sushi chef who took care of us was really nice and the service was quick. I really enjoyed their tuna & garlic tuna nigiri! Can't complain about the fish to rice ratio. 

Dinner price is about $26.95. They also give you a stamp card! Pretty cool since I've never been to a sushi restaurant that offers that. 

The only thing that bothered me was the person sitting next to us at the bar. He was rushing the sushi chef because he "had somewhere to be." If you're in a rush don't eat at a restaurant? Try a drive thru instead.

Just enjoyed a great AYCE meal at Sushi Mon, at the counter. My chef was excellent, had tons of orders, kept mine coming. Food was very good (not excellent, but very fresh), and the garlic edamame was off the chain! Highly recommend this place, food and service excellent, atmosphere busy but worth the wait.

This is my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in Henderson. The prices are reasonable and the sushi is better than most. I order about 75% of my sushi off of the list of daily specials and I primarily order nigiri. I highly recommend the salmon belly, toro, and the yellow tail belly. There fresh scallops and ama ebi are also consistently, very good. The AYCE menu includes a wide array of appetizers. The dynamite, takoyaki, baked mussels, and calamari are outstanding. Be sure to save a little room for dessert because the tempura ice cream is to die for. They of course have a variety of mochi ice cream and sorbets that you can eat to your heart's content.

by far the best AYCE sushi i have tasted in vegas!!! it's not the best sushi place, but best AYCE for sure!!! there has never been  a time that we experience  bad sushi or the service. its great!!! plus, the price is reasonable. also, if you decide to become a fan. be sure to get a stamp card when you ask for  the check. if you get your card stamp in full, I believe your 10th AYCE is free. 

here is some of my favs you must try:

Nigiri : scallops, salmon, garlic tuna, yellowtail, super white.

sushi rolls : ALL OF THEM!!! YOU CAN EVEN ORDER HALF ROLLS!!! & yellowtail hand roll is one of my favs!!!

Great spot on the westside for AYCE or take-out.  

All the nigiri is great.  The difference between some lower quality places in town vs the better places is always the quality of the fish.

This place better watch out, cuz I'm here to get my all-you-can-eat money's worth ($26.95 per person). Came here on a Sunday for an early dinner, no wait to get seated and service was quick. Everything I tried was good...my favs were: ahi poke, tako poke, super white, salmon belly, jason roll and lychee ice cream. I like that you can get half orders on rolls so you can try MORE stuff. Also, there's a good variety on the all you can eat menu, more than most Japanese restaurants  --including different appetizers, desserts, fancier rolls and other special items like kobe beef, sweet shrimp and uni. Recommend sitting at the bar for easy ordering. This is definitely gonna be a regular spot for us whenever we're in town again. Husband kept saying how he'd gonna bring his fat foodie friends here next time they're in Vegas.

The sushi was good but I think the ambiance kills it. I had to wait 30-45 min for me and my husband on a weekday and even though I liked that they served you super fast, I felt like I was rushed so that other people can use our seats. I like to eat sushi in a relaxed kind of place, to be able to have nice conversations with people that I'm with. I might come back though maybe in some off-peak time.

Best place In Las Vegas to eat sushi. Especially on ayce fresh fish. Friendly staff. The extra side dishes are amazing. The dynamite is the bomb. I will eat that all day every day. Super delicious. Been going here for over 7 years now. Won't go anywhere else

Don't believe the hype. 

Drive 6.5 hours to Reno and eat at Sushi Pier!!!

I've been eating sushi since 1984. Way before it was cool. It has always been my favorite food and something I crave regularly. So when I moved to Reno, NV I was excited by AYCE sushi places with reasonable prices and an incredible selection of nigri, maki, and appetizers. 

I came to Vegas for a job interview, which went pretty well I might add, and rewarded myself in a typical fashion, with AYCE sushi. I figured how different could it be?

I scoured Yelp for a while and came across Sushimon and Yama Sushi, the two most reviewed AYCE spots around. I chose Sushimon based on Yama reviews stating that they pre sliced their fish and one person had seen cockroaches. 

I pulled up and the place was pretty full, good sign, so I sat down and ate. The only memorable things were hamachi Kama and tempura sweet shrimp heads, and they were memorable only because they aren't typically available at my sushi spot in Reno.  

As a sushi fanatic, there is a price point at which I would rather enjoy the taste and art of well prepared sushi, than gorge myself on very mediocre stuff. And at $30, this hits that spot!

Bottom line is people from Las Vegas should know what good food is, and this sure ain't it.

2.5 stars for friendly sushi chef, hamachi Kama, sweet shrimp heads, and plum ice cream. They also get points for serving half rolls.

If I could eat sushi everyday for the rest of my life I would. Sushi Mon is a cute lil' sushi restaurant located on Sahara and Cimarron next to Nothing Bundt Cakes. I was being lazy one night and didn't want to dine in, so I got my food to go. Staff was friendly and my order came out quickly. I ordered three rolls:

Sushi Mon Lasagna
Pastel 
Domingo

One thing to note is that the sauces come on the side with to go orders. This is good because it gives me a chance to try the rolls naked. I loved the Domingo roll. It has tuna and avocado with jalapeño salsa on top and ponzu sauce. This roll was super tasty as is, but the addition of ponzu sauce upped the ante for me. I wouldn't hesitate to order this again.

The lasagna was a second favorite. This roll is very decadent. Cream cheese and scallops baked on top of a California roll and smothered in eel sauce. Soooo good and probably a billion calories a piece, but so worth it. I was hesitant the first time I ever tried a lasagna roll. Who knew cream cheese would be so good with fish? Not me. But it is amazing. This is a very rich roll so maybe try half if you have never had it before. 

The pastel was good as well but was my least favorite. It had shrimp and crab wrapped in soy paper, and shrimp and avocado on top. I omitted the cream cheese from this roll but it does come with it. After that lasagna roll I couldn't think about eating more cream cheese. Eel sauce and spicy mayo top this, but I felt like the sauces didn't add much to a pretty plain roll. 

While I sat and waited for my order I was offered water which I declined but thought was nice. Everyone I came across was nice and they even thanked me for waiting. I will be back for the AYCE- Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.

Came in here based on a friend's recommendation for their
all you can eat sushi for $26 buffet option.

They're with a good 10 min. drive off-the Vegas strip so you see only moset of the local they come in.  

We were seated in front of the Sushi Chief who was like Sushi machine that were able to make any sushi/rolls in a min./two upon your request.

The sushi was really fresh & excellent staffs.

Highly recommended it if you have a car to get around LV & try something off-the-strip.

I've been to a lot of sushi restaurants in Vegas, and it got to the point where when asked if I wanted to go to sushi at ____, I would usually say no.
Sushi Mon changed that. Found it out of the blue, and never looked back. They have AYCE and a la carte menus, and handle each with grace. 
My experience?
~ The sushi and rolls are always delicious. They handle special requests easily (i.e. I would like this roll, but with salmon instead of tuna, soy paper instead of Nori, 911 sauce on the side, etc.)
~ They remember us. There is something to be said for staff remembering you, and bringing your drinks (water with extra lemon, hot green tea, etc.) without you even asking.
~ The sushi chefs are personable and fun, and make for a good experience. 
~ The wait staff are super nice, and always make us feel welcome.
~ They have a frequent AYCE card - get stamped every time and the 10th time is free (might be the 11th- I don't eat AYCE, but the other half does, and they don't even hesitate to honor it)
~ It doesn't matter who your waitress is; everyone will help you.
I just went there last night with my other half, and his parents, and we had a great time. The sushi was excellent (tuna melted like butter) and the rolls were excellent.

P.S. The "Love Boat" is an amazing deal. Salmon is tender (it's a filet, and cooked - delicious), california rolls (just ask for the sushi bar to make them right then - they will), edamame, chicken yakitori skewers, salad (their dressing is YUM) with chicken, miso soup, and tempura shrimp and veggies. All for $11.95. Great deal, and comes with a delicious sliced orange dessert too. 

I'm IN!

A "must try" place. The sushi is ALWAYS fresh, the service is ALWAYS fast, the chefs are ALWAYS nice and ready to recommend something.It is a little pricey comparing to other places, but definitely worth your $.
However..this place is SO tiny..and if you got on a Saturday or Friday night..you would have to wait 30minutes at least to get in..but we ALWAYS wait 'cuz we'r good sushi loverz :D

There is a Vietnamese boy at this sushi joint! At first I had the suspicious that he's Vietnamese but kept on thinking he might be Korean or Japanese. He looks kinda like Kim Hyun Joong but Kim Hyun Joong has plastic surgeon and 99-100% of Korean actors have plastic surgeon. He doesn't have plastic surgeon so I kept on thinking he must be Vietnamese. I finally asked if he is and he said yes but he doesn't know how to speak Vietnamese. Mystery solved. He doesn't seem as difficult or strict as the Korean and Japanese. Might be easy going to ask him then the others. Usually I don't dare to ask to much except to eat my food and pay. He's young so will have less experience but I'm Vietnamese I can handle inexperience than strict personality. He looks like he's from Da Lat region. Em trai nhin thay yeu ?uoi, nên uong sua pha voi 
bot calcium cho to con lên! 

As for the food, I live a block away so I have to come here for sushi. Everything is either prudent or bland here. Salad has a prudent ginger soy sauce with sesame oil. Sushi hand cut and all sushi roll have bland taste. Fish taste ok, but from time to time the tuna is brown. I stay away from it multiple times. Dipping sauce is only soy sauce + wasabi and no other sauce available. High fresh quality might be given to Kabotu. I have the suspicious that SushiMon is part of Kabotu, Goyemon, and Monta Ramen. Monta Ramen is the noodle house and Goyemon is the sister sushi house that will capture those that doesn't like or know SushiMon. SushiMon on the westside is for those that are in the west but are a fan of SushiMon. Kabotu is for those that willing to pay for the higher quality fish reserve for its priority. Goyemon might be the sister but both SushiMon locations will always have a better quality of fish. Goyemon might is the 3rd standard, so 1st Kabotu, 2nd SushiMon, and 3rd Goyemon. 

Best dishes for the buck are the Salmon Dinner Special and Sashimi Lunch Special (include rice + miso soup + salad). 3 hand cuts or 2 hand rolls lunch special (include miso soup + salad) for $9 is not bad. Good price. Sushi at Wasabi on Eastern might be a little better but SushiMon's price is the best in this area. Nake Sushi in Summerlin on Rampart x Lake Mead has a similar deal, but it's in the west side. Here in the southeast, SushiMon is the place.

This is an AYCE, so be smart when you order or else wait. Order 4-6 at first then go down. DO NOT order 2 at a time, because that's a long wait. Those that complained about the wait, is because they do not go to AYCE often or have lack of experience with AYCE. It's like the Rio buffet, when it's self serve it's fast that's because you serve yourself, but once you order something special like a sauce the waiter seems to disappear for a very long time.

I never eat in the restaurant but pick up sushi frequently. Every time I have ordered to go, it has been awesome. Good quality sushi and made fresh. Only reason giving 4 stars is because the workers could be a little more friendly.
The best sushi i ever tasted!!! i go almost once a week. Great quality great environment. the mochi is fantastic as well as everything on their menu....

First time coming here, It was Saturday night and it was PACKED! No kidding, you have to call in advance and then have them call you back when there is a table! Its crazy like nothing I've ever been to. Its totally okay tho its almost like making reservations, we called an hour and a half in advanced kinda crazy! The inside is rather small, like literally maybe only 10 tables and a sushi bar. The sushi was delicious, all you can eat for $25.00. Ive also gotten the beef udon soup. The broth of the soup is simply delicious, haven't had better udon soup anywhere else! Prices aren't too bad, they are like any sushi place, pretty much. Service was great our waitress was pretty funny and nice. Again, this definitely isn't a spot that you could just randomly drop into when you want because the wait is far too long! Plan ahead and call in when you are at home and see how long the wait is and you'll be okay (;

I love love love sushi mon, dont really know what the mon stands for, but lemme just say it must be an abbreviated form of monster. Sushi mon is the best, and I mean best all you can eat sushi!!!! Service was awesome, sushi was fresh, and it is so lively in there, conversations galore. I went here a couple of times during my stay at Vegas. O yummy goodness.

I've came to this location a few times in the past whenever I come to Vegas. It's fairly off the strip but it's probably the best local spot that doesn't have the Vegas markup. Personally I rather eat this than a Vegas buffet. It's a small humble location in a plaza. The wait staff were super friendly and quick with their service. They do not skimp on anything. I would probably place this in my top 5 sushi spots.

The nigiri is super duper fresh! How do they even get fresh fish all the way out to Vegas!? The price is very typical but you really get your worth in quality. Dessert, drinks all included. I can't really say anything more.
We love this place. Great service. Great food. Love the fresh sushi rolls made in right of you. Cold saki. And so close to home. Cute little place and great service too.

Great place for AYCE sushi. Usually AYCE sushi restaurants don't give great quality of sushi and slices. Sushi Mon offers good quality cuts for their all you can eat menu. 

I've always been a fan of sushi mon. It became a must go whenever we're in vegas. Told all my friends about them too and most of them feel the same way. It's like a tradition now. If you still have room for desert, the plum ice cream is good too. They usually offer 4 selected special sushi pieces (you only get one order of each) offered at dinner prices, which is about 3-4 dollars more. I highly recommend doing that. Great customer services to boot.

When we drive to Vegas, this is always the first stop before we hit the strip. Sometimes we even make Vegas trips just for Sushi Mon. Great quality cuts for the sushi, which is pretty much the only thing I order here. The service is exceptional too.

Never got the rolls so I can't review them, but going back to the sushi. The salmon cuts are very nice! They usually have 3-4 featured sushi, but it costs a little more, just charges you dinner prices which is about 3 bucks more. If it's available, it's kind of a no brainer for me. 

Love this place, highly recommend it, which I do to all my friends. There's dessert too, but it's up to you. I usually just eat more sushi instead, but the ice cream is great.

The basics:
-All you can eat of the full menu
-45 minute time period to order your unlimited sushi and appetizers (I don't think they really keep track of this)
-the unlimited sushi includes the special rolls on the back page
-there's a charge if you have any leftover food
-The tempura ice cream was really soggy. The lychee sorbet was much better.

This place was recommended by an employee from the M casino due to its popularity and proximity to the hotel. It is located in a Plaza with ample parking.  We went here for lunch and the place was not busy. We were seated right away and our server got our order. My friend got the deluxe combination which wad a few pieces of sashimi, 4 piece California rolls, tempura, rice, salad and miso soup. I got the combination of chicken katsu with rice, miso soup, 4 piece California rolls and salad. We also ordered fried oysters and baked mussels on the side. The service was good. They had a lot of staff there that kept checking on you. The food was good for me. But he didn't like it that much. Their sushi was not that good. Maybe we should have tried one of their special sushis. The price was reasonable. Just not sure if it's something that we will go back for.

This place always has great quality sushi and they are quick! The only thing I noticed recently was that the last couple times we placed orders for appetizers in all u can eat and nobody brought them to us. We even ordered twice just to be sure but nothing but normally the service is good and if it wasn't for that happening on occasion I'd give it 5 stars

The service here, from the manager to servers, make you feel like you are not really wanted here.  Their friends on the other hand get treated quite well, it's understandable but ....  Order second round and the rice is packed like hell and the fish noticeably thinner, eel was so pathetic on the second round we had to laugh.  Enough is enough, wonder how long there guys will last on their past laurels.

I was partial to a different Sushi place before my boyfriend took me to sushi mon now its the only place we go! They have a variety of dfferent rolls and you can order a half order as well which is great for me! Everything from the simple house salad to there fanciest rolls are worth trying its all good.
One of my first all you can eat sushi joint I use to go to all the time. Now and days I go to other places. Wondering if their still good?

Yum yum. 4.5 AYCE.  Sushi restaurant with actual Japanese sushi chefs! It's so rare nowadays! 

I can't come to Vegas without getting my sushi fix at Sushi Mon.  

Always a wait, always worth it, but always a wait. 

Fish is fresh, the cuts are quality, and the rice is nice and warm.
...... still my favorite sushi restaurant ever.   Amazing ayce dinner!   Fresh fish and a lot of varieties ......  so good they already saw me twice this week.

I love this place! The service is amazing...... The chefs already know what I like to eat. I've been coming  here for the past 4 yrs and I have no complaints. They always have a variety of fish and it's always fresh.   You guys rock!!!!

Came here for dinner on a Thursday night in a party of 7. Their $26 AYCE sushi was great value considering the quality of the fish we were served. Their specials included multiple nigiris that I haven't had before at AYCE spots including mackerel. They were very timely with service, providing water whenever we were low and coming around to clean up finished dishes very quickly. Of course the total bill was enormous with the beer and sake we ordered in conjunction, but with the fun atmosphere (we caught the end of a Packers-Bears game on the TV at the bar) that allowed us to sake bomb at the table, I will definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Here's the place where I first fell in love with Uni. They limit 2 plates of Uni per person, I think, but the quality of their seafood is really fresh. They have all you can eat sushi, but the awesome part is, it is NOT BUFFET style. They make it upon order, so the rolls always come out hot and fresh. The tempura is actually still crispy when they serve it! It's quite a drive from the Strip and at night, I don't even know if you can get a cab to go down there to pick you up and bring you back to the Strip.

Came here for their AYCE lunch and had a great time. This was one of the better AYCE sushi joints around henderson. With their reasonable menu prices at 21.95 per person for lunch and 26.95 at dinner time, you can't really go wrong. This place gets really busy so be ready for a wait.

Their sushi was well made with great fish to rice ratios. The food was so good I couldn't really get a good picture we were eating it too fast!

We left here stuffed and got here early enough we beat the crowds. Our waitress was very kind and kept our cups full and orders rolling. I would recommend coming here if you don't mind waiting to eat.

I usually don't go to sushi places, but I did not decide tonight.  My friend craved for sushi.  

I was uneasy since there was a wait and was told at first that it would be 30+mins..  We waited and was seated in less than 20.  We got a nice seating in the bar area.  After being seated, I was ready to eat.  I was amused by the ayce rules.  60 mins. I was curious what would happen if I went over by 5 mins?  I absolutely loved how great the ayce menu was.  Side dishes and dessert?? dang!  I am sold.

Nice because I felt like i had my own sushi chef.  We told him different items to prepare for us.  Very nicely presented and the fish felt fresh.  I like that because I have had poor experience at other places.  For an ayce, I see why there's a line outside.  I enjoyed the 624, baked sushi which I haven't had before.  Very unique and hot!  The snow crab was a little dry.  I didn't like it.  Friend was craving for salmon and we over ordered.  Regardless, it was very delightful.  I usually have a hard time with rare fish, but it wasn't an issue tonight.  House was very efficient  on getting our side dishes.  We had very awkward request.  We had ice cream in the middle of our meal.  Sushi chef thought we were done.  I tried some lychee sorbet, very tasty but not for me.  I did enjoy the special mochi mango ice cream.  Friend was full, but I told her it was amazing.  She managed to intake half of it.  

Service was nice, Sushi Chef was friendly and chatty.  Overrall, a great atmosphere.  Not made for large groups.
Not that good at all. All the rolls tasted the Same and nothing out of the norm. Quality of fish is not that fresh.Service is okay.

Love this place!!

AYCE fresh sushi & rolls.  The great thing about it is that you can order half rolls (4 pieces), that way, you can order more types of rolls.  Always get the special.  The last time I was here, they had one with mango on top!  YUMS!

The plum ice cream is sooo good, included in the AYCE too!!
What happened!!! I came here 3 times within 2 months. Bad service, the food took a very long time. It was not as fresh as it used to be and the service...again! Pfft!

Hait! We're supposed to be in Vegas but end-up in Japan. We are the couple that must find at least one best Japanese restaurant anywhere we go because hubby was an ex-sensei and I'm a forever sashimi-eater. So here we are. We came to Sushi Mon for dinner with hubby's family (the Vegas residence) before, but this time we came for lunch with his nephew. We had a great lunch. They ordered "all you can eat" and I ordered chirashi bowl. So I cannot eat all that I can because "all you can eat" cannot be shared but I was happy with my order. Who needs to eat it all? Most sushi place in Vegas have this type of promotion, all you can eat, surprise that everyone seems to be able to follow this "all you can eat" trend. The servers are Japanese but the four sushi chefs are mixed, could be Japanese and Chinese but I saw one was teaching the other, one was focusing on filleting, one was on a cell phone (kidding!). Of course no one's on a cell phone here, hello! Anyway, the lunch was great and we would come back here, for sure. Someday I'll try that "all you can eat" thing and see whether it's true that I could eat it all! Enjoyed it, thanks! Recommended.

I don't come here often as it is usually not in the normal price range but for random occasions and meeting up with friends it's great!

Every single time I have come here I have ordered AYCE -- my fiancé has too -- and we both feel like we always get our money's worth without eating ourselves sick (hah!).  He is not nearly as in love with sushi as I am but he can eat yakitori, tempura shrimp, edamame, and green tea ice cream like nobody's business.  He is also willing to try what the table orders sometimes, so it works out.

Service here is above average and I have always had a decent experience.  Everyone is friendly.  Be forewarned:  This places is POPULAR and SMALL so it can get crowded and service can get bogged down during busy times.

I really like how AYCE allows you to order half-rolls.  I know several places do that but this was my first experience with one...hee.

What to order: Dragon Roll (I'm biased), Aloha Roll, Moon Roll, umm... just look at the menu and dive in.  And dessert is good, too!  I am IN LOVE with tempura fried ice cream, and this does not disappoint.  Next time I am gonna see if I can get green tea ice cream up in that tempura shell... mmm.

This is one of two of my go to sushi spots for AYCE with the other being Island Sushi.  This place is great despite the wait that usually accompanies coming here.  The restaurant is very bright due to all of the windows which is really nice and the staff are always happy and attentive.  The food is great and always comes pretty quickly!  I usually come here about once a month with my friends going about twice a month lol.

bleh...

the restaurant is pretty small so large groups beware...my group took up half the restaurant

ayce but i felt like i was eating all you can eat rice...yea i love my rice but not that much!

service was okay...we had a waiter and a waitress poor girl was doing all the work..so we snuck in extra tip just for her...cause u know it's one of those all servers share tips kind of shit. 

baked mussel was bomb! i normally never eat those cause it's soo creamy and heavily mayo but here it was the perfect ratio

dont think i'll be coming back
The sushi was okay, not much in selection. Don't come here unless you LOVE cucumber in your rolls as well, seeing as they are in almost every single roll

A VERY GOOD AYCE SUSHI PLACE ON THE WEST SIDE
Sushi Mon is on of a myriad All You Can Eat (AYCE) Sushi restaurants throughout Las Vegas. For the most part, I have had favorable experiences at the AYCE places in Vegas. In the old days, AYCE meant Buffet Style like Makino. Makino was fine, but sushi lovers knew that the price you had to pay for AYCE was that it was not as good as Made To Order. But a few years ago the AYCE trend caught on at many of the good sushi places that were only set up for Made To Order and that is when AYCE Sushi really took off. Really, there are so many AYCE Made To Order places in Vegas I don't know how the places that don't have AYCE stay in business.

In November 2009, AYCE Made To Order Sushi in Las Vegas is going for between $24 and $28. My eleven year old son, Tristan, can eat $28 of sushi in about 15 minutes, so we make out way ahead, dollars wise. What would normally be a $150-$200 bill ends up being just under $100 for three people (with drinks and tax).

In Henderson, my favorite place is The Ka (Warm Springs & Green Valley). The sushi is top-notch for AYCE and the atmosphere is actually very good for a sushi place. Most sushi places that put any effort into their atmosphere tend to charge much more than the other sushi places, but not The Ka. Additionally, the sushi chefs at The Ka have quite a bit of personality (which makes up for their challenged English... hey, I can barely speak any Japanese, if THAT is what they are speaking, so they're doing much better than me on the bilingual thing.)

Now that we're living on the "West Side" we have to find a place to get our sushi fix. My girlfriend lived over here recently anyways and Sushi Mon was "her place." We actually went to Sushi Mon for our first date although neither of us were really paying much attention to what was going into our mouths in the restaurant that day.

The quality and selection of the sushi is very good. I like to gage my sushi places by the quality of the salmon (aka "sake") and I was not disappointed. It was very soft, smooth, and very tasty. My girlfriend likes to use the Yellowtail as her gage and it certainly passes muster with her as with me. We had a variety of the typical rolls you can get in Vegas and each one of them was good to great.

The atmosphere is typical for Las Vegas sushi restaurants, at least the non-casino places. It always seems to be busy here and it seems they would be able to fill a few more tables if they had the room for it. Not much for decoration but there's nothing disconcerting about it either. The most important part is that it is clean, which it is. The sushi chefs were very good and surprisingly fast (in spite of a packed place). I wish they had a little more personality but I probably need to go back a few more times and start some kind of rapport with them and they'd probably be just fine.

Here's a kicker for me: THEY HAVE A STAMP CARD. Your 10th AYCE is free, which is like getting $2.80 off each meal. Not all places do this in Las Vegas and if you're looking for a new "favorite place," this certainly helps tip things in favor of a place who does have a stamp card.

If you're looking for All You Can Eat Made To Order Sushi on the West Side of Las Vegas I would recommend that you check this place out. I'm sure there are other good places in the area, but this one is good for me.
Best sushi you can get for an all-you-can-eat! food is always fresh and cant complain about the prices. Only downside, the restaurant is a little small.

Hm went here with my friends and the sushi was okay. We sat at the sushi bar and the presentation of one of the rolls I got was just awful. Don't get the Domingo roll. It looked like something they scraped off the kitchen floor! But I also got the royal California which was deep fried California rolls for only $6.50! Everything was pretty affordable even though I didn't do AYCE. My friends were really happy and overall we had a great time!
I might come back if my friends want to go again. Nothing really stood out to me, but still a good sushi place.

Definitely my favorite All You Can Eat sushi spot in the area! For lunch, the price is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. Definitely worth it! The quality of fish is good for all you can eat, the nigiri is nice with little rice so you can eat more . 
The wait can be busy between 6-8pm. Service is quick and on point! Definitely recommend coming by if you're looking for a solid sushi spot and not spend too much money. Enjoy!

We ordered takeout and really had high hopes for the food here because of the reviews!  We ordered two 2 roll specials (which include miso soup and a salad), three specialty rolls and a side order of gyoza.  When we received our order, we discovered the combo rolls were packed incorrectly which was inconvenient since each order belonged to someone different.  The special sauce for one of my husbands rolls was packed in the gyoza box which gave me a surprisingly extra spicy surprise when I tried dipping my food in it.  The rolls were dry and did not taste fresh at all.  My friend said that the breadcrumbs on top of her roll tasted really stale and my husband at all of 3 pieces total because he said the taste was not good at all.  The miso soup was quite tasty and the gyoza was up to par.  I don't think I will return though as I have experienced much better tasting sushi around town.

This is about the 8th or 9th time I have eaten hear over the last 3 years and I've seen this place fall quite a bit in quality and service. We ordered the all you can eat. We both ordered rolls we had before and were surprised at both how bland they tasted but also on how a couple of them have changed. Their 9-1-1 roll, a past favorite, tasted like nothing but crappy habanero hot sauce. The staff was good and friendly until we were ready to leave. We wondered why they had not come by with the check and when we asked, they told us we had a single piece of sushi left out of the 6 rolls we ate and we were told unless we ate the last bite, they would charge us.  I've seen this policy before on many places but have never seen it implemented in such an unfriendly way. Suffice to say, we will no longer be eating here. 2 of the 6 rolls were good and the rest were meh to bad.

Been to this place a few times with friends. It's good just nothing extraordinary. They offer all-you-can-eat which is a great option for when you're hungry. There really isn't much more to say other than you'll find all of your typical sushi offerings here and it's good enough to satisfy a sushi craving, but don't expect anything exceptional.

I have been eating here for over ten years.  It is by far the best sushi bar I have ever been to. Not only in Vegas,  but better than anywhere I have eaten in Cali too! Everything is superb from the minute you walk in the door until you leave,  full and satisfied. Amazing side dishes and creative delicious rolls make for a super combo your taste buds will thank you for! My favorite is called "crispy rice". I will always be a fan.  Thank you sushi mon

This place is one of the better ayce in Vegas.
It's always SUPER busy, especially at night, so make a reservation.

The service is always pretty solid. I can't really think of any complaints there.

The apps are super good. Seaweed salad, poke, gyoza, everything super fresh and tasty. Miso soup is pretty solid. The mussels are amazing. Not too much globby cheese and sauce. The poke is also very fresh and not overloaded with onions like some other places do. The Cajun albacore here is still my favorite. The perfect amount of spice. Nigiri cuts are always pretty thick. The ecstacy roll and the lemon roll are my favorites. They do half rolls here, too. Which is awesome. 

I love that you can also get more than one mango mochi for the all you can eat. A lot of places don't do that and I'm obsessed with mango mochi.

They make the best avocado rolls which is the only thing I eat at sushi places
Sushi mon and Kabuki!

Used to come here EVERY TIME we went to vegas but it's come down a little in my opinion over the years as more people have found about it and frequent this place..  and since they don't take reservations the wait can be long, but usually worth it.  
Its all you can eat for around $30, and that includes almost the whole menu.. appetizers, nigiri, rolls, dessert... thats what makes it so great its not just the sushi..
 
The kicker here is you get 1 order each of Uni, Toro and Ama Ebi, (provided they have it) i always give away my Uni and ama ebi to whoever im with.. not my thing.. 

there are 2 schools of sushi, THE NEW: rolls with fancy names and this inside and that on top; and THE OLDl: traditional nigiri, rice with fish on top.  

if you like rolls this is definitely the place for you, many different types of rolls and you can ask for this, instead of that on top, they don't mind. (just leave a little more tip would ya?)  

But if you are a nigiri person, heres the scoop.. Seems like you are only allowed so many servings of the good stuff per person (maybe 3 or 4) then you get the second rate stuff.. heres what i mean.. say you have 2 people.. you order 6 orders of  hamachi.. they come out nice, fresh, white belly part.. yum so good.. you want more?.." 6 more please,," what you will get will not be even close to what you got the first time!  you might get the redder part of the fish or older and kinda dried out.  nothing like the first batch..  So heres what you gotta do.. order 8 or 10 orders the first time.. then move on to the next fish and never return to one that you've already ordered.. the best thing is to take people who order rolls, that way you get to have their portion of the "fresh stuff" while they dine on the rolls!!  bonus!!  (this rule dosent apply to rolls only nigiri, the rolls are always consistent i think)

There are specials too, they are unlimited (not part of the holy trinity of "1 each", uni, toro and ama ebi) there is also a supposed 1 hour time limit but its not strictly enforced (i just leave a bigger tip when i stay longer)

The next question, how does it stack up to Hikari?  The fresh stuff is much better than Hikari, the 2nd round stuff is not.  You can't order just sashimi (no rice) here only nigiri.

Pros: Freshest AYCE made to order sushi "first round only"

Cons: Uni, Ama ebi, and toro, 1 order only, 2nd round of nigiri is lacking (but understandable why they have to do it to get rid of product and not be cleaned out) 

The fine print: you have to eat every thing that you order, or you have to pay for what you don't eat on top of your AYCE price.. 

Tips: Get there before opening to avoid long wait times.  check specials board on the back wall.. if they have Moi (pacific thread fin) get it!!  that is the bomb!!  if you order Ama Ebi, ask them to fry the heads for you.. its like eating a potato chip but shrimp flavored.. to get the most for you money.. avoid fillers and fried stuff in the beginning they fill you up faster save them for the final rounds.  avoid the tako poke, its not sliced tako its idakko (whole small tako), more rubbery and chewy, nothing like Hawaiian style tako poke. 

Verdict: it teeters at 3 1/2 stars but if you follow the 10 step nigiri program i've laid out it could be a 4 star deal.

Ordered seafood combo for 2, enjoy the food, good size and decent quility.
Employees are friendly and hrlpful. The only complain will be the quility of the tuna sashimi. It wasnt a good part of the fish, very chewy.

I used to be a big fan of this place but the last 7 or 8 visits have not been so great. The main problem I've experienced is that I sit and wait for 15 minutes to get a sushi order at the bar. This is happening when I am paying for all you can eat. Today in 40 minutes I received 2 orders of sushi and 2 rolls. I actually decided to leave still hungry. When I got home I checked to see if recent reviews were similar to my experience and it appears they are. The worst part seems to be that the restaurant recently received multiple health code violations. I think I am going to spend my hard earned money elsewhere.

We had high hopes for this place but that was not the case . Our server was hard to understand. The appetizers were over cooked & shrimp tempura was not crunchy it was soggy . The chicken teriyaki was to dry . The 2 pcs of fish wit salmon had too much rice & salmon was not fresh it was chewy . There tuna was ok & yellow tail was ok. The scallops were hard to chew. The server said that our 1 hour ion all you can eat is about to be over & if we want desert , I feel like we were rushed to eat go very uncomfortable. The desert was ok I fished . My sister & I won't be back.

best all you can eat sushi! 

my favorite thing about this place is that you can order HALF portions of the rolls. so you can actually try a lot of different rolls on their menu! 

the fish tastes fresh and I've gotten almost all the rolls on the menu except the deep fried ones, and I can say they're pretty awesome! 

another plus about this place is that appetizers and desserts are included in all you can eat. I like the baked green mussels and edamame and miso soup. and then lychee sorbet green tea ice cream tempura ice cream and mochi! have to save room for them all. 

the OID baked roll is good!

Sushi Mon has great all you can eat sushi.. for an rather affordable price...

Ask to sit in Fredo's section at the sushi bar!!!

Great selection of fresh fish.. (which is always a positive when eating sushi)

Ask for Fredo!!!

Lots of rolls to choose from, as well as sushi choices, and they don't use too much rice to fill you up!

Fredo suggested the salmon collar (which im surprised that ive never had before, being that we eat sushi about 1 to 2 times a week) it was delicious.. try it!! :) 

and ask for Fredo.. he's from Hawaii and makes some awesome sushi and is just an all around great, funny guy!!! 

Also, you get apps and dessert included in your AYCE price, that is if you still have room for dessert after all the sushi you consume...

Dont forget to ask for a punch card, (and Fredo, hey im just trying to give you a great experience here) once you get 10 punches you get a free all you can eat!!!! well WoRtH IT!!!!

Open late..... and Fredo is there Tuesday thru Saturday, 4pm till close.....  Its hit or miss as to it being busy, you can get right in or there could be an 30 min to 1 hour wait.. so cross your fingers you go at the right time!

For all you can eat, you cant beat it with a stick!!
Can't beat the quality and price.  If eating AYCE sushi is your passion, then this is a must try.  When friends are in town, they always ask to revisit.  Glad it's only down the street.

Yay for $13 pitchers of Sapporo! 

The place was mobbed when we arrived and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. The fish we had was fresh, though the cuts weren't as nice as what we get at Bluefin.  

I also liked that they had various daily specials, so that you could get a small sampling of other higher-ticket  items. We were lucky and the specials were for super white tuna, fresh scallops and white clam. 

We tried the tuna and scallops and they were both tasty. I loved the scallops, they were big fresh pieces and very supple. 

The amaebi was a bigger portion and pretty nice. Sweet, juicy with that distinct raw-shrimp mouth-feel. Yum!  

The home smoked salmon was interesting! It had bits of dill flecked on it and was smooth, subtly cooked and with a mild creamy flavor. Not as strong a flavor as in commercial smoked salmon, which could be a positive or negative depending on your preference. I liked it but wouldn't buy a large package of it. 

I had masago with quail egg. The masago was was briny and sweet with nice pop and a generous portion. The egg seemed a little less fresh. The overall effect was still pleasant.  

The uni was NOT as fresh as what I've had at other restaurants. There were odd discoloration marks on it, which I haven't seen anywhere else.

We got a half order of the volcano roll on a friend's recommendation and neither of us liked it. It had a lot of krab in it, which is a turn off.

An order of gyoza meant 2 little bitty pieces. The boy had those and found them unremarkable. He also had the yakitori, which came in a super heavy sauce. Not something he'd go out of his way to have again, and though the portion was small he tried to enlist my assistance in demolishing it.  

I also had the miso soup with fried amaebi heads. The batter got soggy because the heads were totally submerged in the scalding-hot broth, which was disappointing. Also, the fact that the broth was a few degrees shy of boiling- miso is NOT meant to be boiled because it ruins the integrity and health benefits of the miso. The soup utilized white miso and was still flavorful once it cooled down enough to be edible without the risk of 3rd degree burns. 

The ahi poke salad was very mild in flavor impact. I liked the combination of seaweeds/seaplants in it but otherwise it was forgettable. 

The lychee sorbet was a refreshing option. I liked the little bits of what seemed like candied/dry lychee that I'd occasionally discover.

Overall, it was fun and we enjoyed our beer but we won't venture out of our way when we've had better luck with sushi spots closer to home.

Really good place with good services. 
I like this place, I don't think it has the freshest fish but it wasn't the worst fish I've ever had. Lol 
My friends and I went there for Lunch AYCE, it was like $24 including tax. 
We had half orders on a lot of the rolls because that way we can try a little bit of everything. 
I do have to warn you on the 911, we are not kidding. I eat a lot of spicy food but I could barely handle the 911. They straight up use ghost peppers for it because I know what ghost peppers taste like. 
LOVE their nigiri because they don't give you too much rice like other places which is super great. I love it. 
Would definitely come back to this place. 
And I definitely recommend everyone to go there and try the food themselves because it's not bad at all.

So I ate here at 9 on a Sunday night and it was super busy. We had to wait 15 minutes to sit anywhere and there were empty tables they would not let us sit at because they said there were other people on the list that we're going to be seated there. For a party of 2, waiting for that long to then finally be sat at the bar where I originally asked to be seated at was annoying. 
Best part: sushi is awesome and the garlic edamame is delicious. You can get half rolls which is nice for all you can eat.
Bad part: long wait, hostess service sucks, waitress was ok and made it very clear we had to eat all of our sushi or we would be charged extra. There are so many rules and I was scared that if I didn't eat every single grain of my rice they would charge me.

Honestly I prefer other places that are more lenient and don't stalk your leftovers.

The shrimp tempura almost didn't even have shrimp in it and it was extremely over cooked and greasy. The waiter was ignoring us and I had to call out for someone to come bring us the bill. The food was just okay, it just so happens to be near my house, however I don't think I will come back. It just wasn't anything special. The presentation was nice though, the rolls looked pretty.

cold unsalted edamame- bleh
incessant wait staff who wouldnt layy off us while we perused the menu.
uncomfy seating
loud.. maybe i meant to say boisterous. 
I'd never go again, we fought to walk out the entire time.

I like the night shift chefs and servers. They served me sushi with very little rice throughout my meal. Very good cuts as well. The chef accomodated my food allergy very well. Sometimes I have to wait but the chef would always apologize and explain though I can see that they are preparing for someone else's order (which I understand). But when they are not busy, the chef always goes to my side whenever I'm almost done, to see if I want to order more. One time I ordered sake nigiri and the chef asked if I want belly (not on menu) instead. Yes pls! Very satisfied. 5 stars. Left $10 tip. 

I went back for late lunch with a friend. Only got one tray of wasabi and ginger (good my friend doesn't like them so I took that 1 tray for myself). Rice was very little on my first order then they put more rice after that  (even my friend commented on the significant increase of rice on my nigiris). The cuts (small and not properly cut) are also worse on my next orders--I can tell they are skimping fish on me. The chef did not want to accomodate my food allergy so I wasn't able to get one of the sushi that I want. 1st server ignored us even when he see me looking at him(he's doing his best not to make eye contact) and the other server heard us talking about it while looking at the 1st server, 2nd server went straight to the table beside us (which was already asked by the 1st server) then she proceeded to serve other tables before we were able to make her feel pity on us. Our water wasn't filled right right away and had to flag the 3rd server to get water. 0 stars. Left $1.24 tip.

Very disappointed, I keep bragging to my friend how good I was taken care of from my prior visit. Tip: go late at night or maybe give lunch servers their tip in advance MAYBE they will take care of you. Or NOT to request anything if you're going on lunch or early dinner time if you can't go late at night. And yes, I was friendly to them until they keep ignoring us.

What's unique about Sushi-Mon?
1.  1/2 orders are ok with them -sharing IS caring, good to share with friends and try different rolls
2.  their AYCE menu includes appetizers and dessert (hard to find elsewhere)
3. Lychee Sherbet is a must try ( finally! I found it at Nijiya http://www.yelp.com/biz/nijiya-market-san-jose#hrid:E43VdZqPGTwG0IyS1xDVtQ)
4. Open late until 2 a.m.

They have a good variety of rolls and everything is pretty fresh.  The place is always full with a line out the door and a waiting list so you know it's good! The specialty rolls are great, and I recommend the Pixie, Mingus, and the Spider.

Just wish their poki salad was a tad less salty.

I can't eat as much as I used to but want to get my money's worth.

This has been my favorite spot for sushi going on a few years now. Just made another visit yesterday and had excellent service for lunch. I recommend the ecstasy roll..it is my favorite!! I also brought a friend with me and it was his first time eating sushi, which he loved!  If you want fresh food, come here!

Nothing spectacular and feels obviously like a chain. It's a decent option but I'd rather drive a little further for something better. Did have a very negative experience once with one of the chefs while sitting at the bar.  Took forever for any of them to take notice that we needed to put in an order. When we asked for another volcano... He shot us this look and said again??  Obviously this was an inconvenience to make.  Seemed like he tried to be a little more friendly toward the end because he realized his own reaction but it was too late and really spoiled the experience.  Haven't been back since.

Over all we liked this place.
AYCE but still quality is good (some are not excellent but still good).
I want to come back again.

Let's face a fact: AYCE and excellent sushi were never meant to go hand in hand.

That is, unless you consider California roll to be sushi, in which case you'd need some sushi education.

This place serves higher than the average buffet quality of sushi, many popular side items, and rolls, all at a low price of $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. I can safely say that the quality is much better than every other AYCE sushi bar that I've eaten at by a long shot, but that's not to imply that the other places were overwhelmingly difficult to beat.

Pros:
- Price. If you don't order like an idiot ("let's order rolls") you will definitely get more than what you pay for.
- On their AYCE, with the exception of sea urchin nigiri, sweet shrimp nigiri, sashimi salad, and yellowtail collar (maximum one order each, per customer) everything else can be ordered as many times as you want.
- Their miso soup is delicious! It comes with a sweet shrimp head in it.

Cons:
- Inconveniently located away from the Las Vegas strip.
