- This place is always busy. Good luck on weekend nights.
- Good service is something of a rarity.

Update: had a pretty awesome AYCE meal here last weekend. Sat in front of the friendly Kazu-san and had a good time. Incredibly tender unagi. Nice salmon belly and yellowtail belly. Very buttery toro. Sushi rice in the nigiri was on the warm side, and loosely packed - and I appreciated that. All of the nigiri was prepared like this. Kazu-san's got skills!

I was also served a perfectly broiled Yellowtail Collar - medium rare. Delicious. The scallop sushi was very firm and fresh - the closest to live I've had in nigiri form. (Sushi Koma's scallop sushi is rather slimy+fishy in comparison.)

My new hand roll rule: Only order hand rolls one-at-a-time at the sushi bar *only* (to maintain a crispy nori cone). Makes all the difference. Your hand roll nori will become a soggy latex funnel if you let it sit for more than 20 seconds. Gobble it up as soon as it is made!

I am again a big fan of the 'new' Sushi Mon. Great service, little or no wait time, and a convenient location for West-siders. I *do* enjoy the kitchen food at Sushi Koma a little more (e.g. their Tostada, their gyoza) but as far as straight-up sushi goes, Sushi Mon is fantastic.
AYCE sushi here is amazing! My number 1 spot when I'm craving sushi. Good service and worth the wait.

Two locations not the same owner...
Some of the rolls are good enough but the lactation on Maryland Pkwy are much better. Aside from the food the service was very good, all of the servers were on top of things and my glass was always full.

We use to eat here all the time when it first opened and it being only 3 mins away from home. My wife is Japanese and according to her the quality of their sushi dropped significantly, even my teenage son says their fish was bloody. We no longer go there.

OMG? talk about all you can eat sushi. 

One of the best thing about Las Vegas. The service and food was great. The chef was very friendly and offered us some really sushi. Definitely one of the best experience in town. He is from Hawaii which made the conversation more comfortable. Although you can only have ama ebi, you can have all your can each ama ebi shrimp heads (which is my favorite). The salmon special was good and huge. Everything else was so delicious, I can't wait to go back.
I haven't been there in quite a while. My friend's and I were pleasantly surprised that the service, quality of the food and price were good. We had a great time.

I have mixed feelings about this place. I don't know where some of these 'amazing' reviews are coming from. I ordered AYCE and they offer a wide range of selection. The food is good, everything is seasoned well and it tastes great. But the reason why I will not be returning is because there is JUST WAY TOO MUCH RICE and the fish is too thin. When i put the sushi in my mouth, 1/3 of the time I can taste the rice and fish evenly. But for the remaining 2/3 all I am chewing on is rice. It felt like I was downing a bowl of rice with fish flavoring. At my go-to AYCE sushi back home (sake2me-tustin), the size of the fish is 2x the size and rice is 1/2 that of Sushi Mon. I didn't expect it to be at that standard, because that's just how you do ayce sushi business (so the customers don't eat alot), but I thought the amount of rice:fish was ridiculous. I think I ate 1/2 of what I normally eat at an AYCE sushi because I was so full on rice. I glanced over at the next table and saw the rolls. I was glad I didn't order one.. lol
I saw the great reviews on here and was excited for it, but I will not be returning... The waitress was really helpful and nice though.

this place sucks everthing tasted like sandpaper and terrible guest service.
i work at outbacksteak house. stick with steak people. its fabby

I have to give Sushi Mon * * * * * five stars. 

It's one of the best deals in Vegas.  High quality food, great service, and nice fair prices.

It's an AYCE all you can eat, Sushi restaurant that also has non-sushi items on the menu that counts towards AYCE, so you can have a variety of foods and flavors.

It's much better than buying sushi a la carte, by the order, if you can eat more than 10 pairs of sushi, then you're going to really get your money's worth here.

I'd come here again.  If you're from the Los Angeles area, and know the place "Midori" in the Valley, this is similar to that in format and quality.  And inversely, if you like Sushi Mon in Vegas and are ever in the LA area, check out Midori.

Parking was easy, in the hot, outdoor lot shared with other retailers.

Go to Island Sushi & Grill, on Eastern & Serene streets. It's way better food, for non sushi eaters & sushi eaters. They have ALL YOU CAN EAT, lunch for $21.95 & dinner for $26.95. Kids under 10 are half off, for lunch & Kids under 10 are half off, for dinner, as well.

NOT worth the wait! I've tasted better food at other Japanese restaurants & I've had excellent customer service at other restaurants, in general. The GOOD, the servers seem friendly & seem to move fast waiting on their customers. The BAD, crowded restaurant & it's loud, the extended wait time to get a table or a seat at the bar. Customers see employees gathered around the host / hostess area chit chatting with each other & not paying attention to their customers. The manager doesn't smile, moves slow, not professional, not friendly, lacks skills to be a manager & does not resolve matters for customers. They should get rid of him & get a experienced manager. Do they have an assistant manager? Doesn't seem like it. It's not a kid friendly restaurant & they don't have a kid's menu. Seriously time to BOYCOTT Sushi Mon...
The best Sushi AYCE place ever ! Fresh food, awesome service, a must go place for me every time I come visit Vegas.

The hostess greeted me and I immediately thought his place was gonna have great service. My friend and I were sat very quickly at the sushi bar where we were greeted by our sushi chef who's name I don't remember, but he had these light green eyes you can't miss. He was awesome. The real trouble began after he informed us he was going on break and had a different guy take over. My friend asks for another roll, as the chef begins to make this, the server drops off our checks, right in the middle of our meal. Now I wouldn't be so irritated by that if we were almost finished, but it felt as if we were being rushed to finish. Also my friend was supposed to pay for this meal, somehow they gave us each separate checks, one AYCE and one ale cart. We told them we were BOTH doing AYCE and that it would be ONE check. I was a little annoyed but figured hey must've forgotten or something might have happened, so I brushed it off. The final straw however, was when the checks were dropped off the chef stopped making our rolls and looked at the bills. He then asked us why the checks had been dropped off, and if we were done. When we told him we weren't finished eating and to continue making the roll, he still continued to question us as to if we were finished, asking if we were gonna pay for the rolls he was making, saying "I don't know what's going on." Only after we flagged down a server to change both bills to AYCE, did he continue to make our rolls. The first sushi chef we had was amazing, I'm really sad he had to go on break before we finished our meal. I'm sure this review would've been much better if the second chef hadn't been so rude. I won't be back, but for everyone else who goes and sits at the sushi bar, look for the Hispanic man with the green eyes, like I said he's AWESOME.
This is our go to place for sushi for my husband and I. Great service, decently priced menu and best of all, ayce!

I used to eat here all the time.. Seems like their service has gone down. We have been waiting for our rolls for at least 10 mins per roll. We mass ordered about 5 rolls to get us going since they are kind of busy. However, they ended up bringing us 1 by 1. You have a 1 hour limit to eat and order so I hope they will not kick us out since we have been waiting. 

The food, food is ok. Rolls are loosely rolled. Some places tend to tightly roll their sushi so that's what we enjoy. It's decently fresh.

My recommendation is to eat at the bar. Do not request a booth unless you want to wait on your food for a long time.

we love sushi; but usually stay far away from all you can eat places.  however, we decided to give this place a try based on yelp reviews and friends' recommendations.  for all you can eat, it's awesome.  definitely the best all you can eat sushi place we've tried.  just stay away from the sea urchin, but that's just a personal opinion!

Favorite sushi place in town! I always go for all you can eat, but also enjoy their bento lunches. Price is average compared to other sushi joints. Fish is fresh and tasty. The only bummer is that they don't offer as many good baked scallop roll options as Osaka, but that has never stopped me from coming here for either an excellent lunch or late-night food option. Also right next to the Japanese/Tokyo store; a great location!

Nearly $30 for all you can eat at Sushi Mon is a bit of a rip off.  The nigiri fish is not very fresh. You can tell when ponzu sauce is added with the white tuna, red snapper etc.. You cannot savor the freshness of the fish when drenched with sauce. I could tell just by the hamachi which was served without ponzu sauce, it was not as fresh as from other places. 

And for $30 of AYCE with a 2 sided menu is just not as good of a selection. Everyone is probably sick of me comparing all AYCE to Xtreme Sushi but I really do prefer Xtreme. Everything on the menu is AYCE and for sushi mon, the 2 sided menu with a short list of appetizer list is just not enough value for $30.  In addition, way too much rice and I was displeased of the uni...it definitely lacked freshness. 

I did like the salmon skin handroll and the lasagna roll.  All of the concoction masked the taste but rolls were synthetically yummy.

I'm not a Vegas local, A friend and I are here on vacation from Reno, so I'm used to different sushi joints. When we got there we were seated at the bar and ordered our rolls. We tried ordering appetizers but he said he's doesn't do that. We had to wait for the waitress to come by and ask for drinks. The roll pieces were really big and thick, so that being said I was filled up fast and didn't eat half of the roll. When she came by she asked why I didn't eat it, which was weird. But I told her. 
Another thing is I didn't get my edamame until a little before the check.
Overall it was an okay experience.... I don't think I'd eat here though.

I visited twice.  Dine in and take out.  This restaurant is convenient because of walking distance from my house.  I moved from CA last year and Sushi "neta" (fish) is better than restaurants in San Jose, but they must improve the way to prepare their rice.  Shari was very dry.  Particularly, Maki sushi I took out collapsed its shape when I picked up by chopsticks.  Also, I felt their rice is missing "Umami".

AYCE. Be patient with the service. They are so nice here. I hate when patrons are rude when it's busy. Often has a wait. Quality is not the best, but it's good none the less. Great variety. Also good for lunch take-out. Seating is tight. If your food companion eats sushi they have probably been here and likely like it.
This is one of my favorite sushi places! Some of the best in town for sure. The only downfall is the restaurant is small & a little uncomfortable.

We haven't been to this spot in years and it is great to know they are still the best.  Friendly service and fresh delicious food. The specialty rolls are the best and there are so many of them.  We even had our little one with us and she was well looked after.

Sushi and service here are great! 

We always get the all-you-can-eat here and love it! The appetizers are good and they have a large variety of hand/cut rolls to choose from.

Two thumbs up! Will come back again soon!

I've been going to sushi mon (both locations) for at least 5 or 6 years and for the price I doesn't get much better when it comes to AYCE. No, it's not the best in quality but that's not what you're paying for. If you want average sushi with good service this is the place for you. Our favorites are the pastel roll as well as seared tuna, red snapper, salmon and baked muscles. Can't go wrong with the poki either. The longest I've ever waited is an hour and now they can text you when the table is ready. You can get better sushi for 5 times the price just depends on what you're looking for.

Been here many times. Always good service, a smile and great food!
 If you can't be seated right away at a table try the bar. Kinda cool to watch them make the roll in front of you.

I just called five minutes ago the gentleman on the phone said he could not take a pick up order as they are closing in five minutes I live two minutes from there. Please fix your yelp says you're open until 2 AM. 
I heard this place was great. I was trying to feed some nurses at Saint Rose Hospital.

Came with my boyfriend around dinner time and it was packed. It's rather a small sushi place compared to others, so we were waiting in line. Once we got in, we chose to sit at the booths which wasn't bad because we got personally served with one of the chefs who was sweet. We did AYCE and ordered several of rolls, seaweed salad and mussles. Food was delicious and service was great, the waiter was always checking up on us. 

Unlimited servings of desserts and the green tea ice cream was delicious! 

Would love to come back here again!

okay. im a sushi whore. and i know it.

and there's no where better to whore it up, than at Sushimon's All You Can Eat sushi. basically, one flat fee to keep eating sushi nigiri, rolls, and food from the kitchen for an hour. 

sushi - is good. really can't F'up the nigiri - its fish on rice. nothing fancy - rule is tho you must eat the rice. the rolls are the stars, as they are usually custom and made to order - i love the jaelin roll, tiger roll and super caterpiller roll. its good stuff - and whats cool is they'll let you order half rolls to really change it up.

hot food - is good too. mostly side dishes and apps - but i like the curry rice, yellowtail collar, fried gyoza and miso soup.

dessert - fried ice cream or mochi - the ultimate is the super sweet and exotic lychee sherbert - yum.

ALWAYS a stop when im back in vegas, i suggest the same for you.

All you can eat sushi!!!

I came here to eat with three of my guy friends when we were in Las Vegas for vacation. We're all from Hawaii and 3 of my friends work at a sushi restaurant, so we know what we wanted and knew what sushi is supposed to taste like. I'm going to admit, I was satisfied. Sushi in the desert, who would've thought this place would be genuinely great!

All you can eat everything! Maguro, salmon, spicy tuna, tobiko, ikura, ebi, etc. They also have a wide selection of rolls to eat from. Funny story, we were half way through our eating frenzy when one of my friends orders the 911 roll. It's one of the hottest, if not the hottest roll on the menu. It wasn't a tasty hot, like sriacha sauce or like a tobasco. It was a burn a hole through my stomach hot! I'm so glad I had eaten sushi before I tried the roll because for the rest of the night my tongue was fried and all I ate was ice cream :(

Great selection of sushi for an all you can eat restaurant, puts all the Hawaii sushi joints to shame. Great place to bring sushi lovers and non-Vegas peeps.

If you are looking for a fresh and delicious sushi you found the right place. I have been going there with my family for over three years and always enjoy. If you are going on the weekend you might have to wait more than thirty minutes but it's worth it.

You lost my business! I understand two people at a six top can potentially cost you money, but you lost the revenue from our lunch and any future visits. We came in and the only table available was the six top by the door. We were told we couldn't have that table because a larger group MIGHT come in. We were then told we could wait 15 minutes or so to see if something else opened up. I understand it is a small place. Why not capture as much business as possible? We will find another sushi place, due to your HORRIBLE customer service.

After going to this location for a year my wife and I had to leave.  Chefs are inconsistent, as soon as you form a bond with a chef he is gone the next day.  The staff is pretty cool, never an issue, but the chefs will mess up your order and blame it on you.  The hostess or host is usually so over whelmed they can care less of they give you great service.  I left this one and now go to the Sahara location.

Good service, very crowded at night. But overall the food is amazing and you are served very quickly. The garlic tuna, super white tuna, and yellowtail some of the best in town! Lemon roll and pastel roll are also very appetizing for specialty rolls. Overall can't go wrong with all you can eat, but they offer a variety of lunch specials as well!

Been going at this place for years every time I take my family in Vegas.. My Fam grew & now had a 2yr old daughter.. We walked in wit my daughter eating her yogurt, drinking her apple juice & was told by the waitress that outside food is not allowed.. thought they would give it a consideration since my daughter is 2years of age & doesn't eat rice at all.. It's not the waitress fault, she's just doing her job.. Management should make a better judgement & I think exceptions can be made..

how could i NOT have written a review for this place? I used to go here at least twice a month!

sit at the bar - ask to sit in Fredo's section.

especially if you from Hawaii - he'll hook you up!

i love the baked mussels. but Fredo just keeps stuff comin - we don't even need to order!

Pricey: a little. But for the food and quantity - worth it. 

GO!

Sushi, sushi, sushi. The secret is to literally starve the whole day if you are gonna eat some afterwork with friends so you can get the full benefit of all you can eat.  The trick is the rice that fills you up quick.  This place is excellent for your sushi cravinigs.  The wait between orders of sushi is a little long but it's worth it and understandable when the place is busy.  The sushi rolls aren't just rice with minimalist fill. It's appropriate to what you order.  All you can eat sushi is incomplete without edemame, wasabi, and soy sauce on the side.  You have to have miso soup to wrap it all up toward the end of your sushi session.  It's a nice cozy joint and the staff are friendly.  Recommend: Spicy Tuna roll, ahi poke, 911 roll, 007 roll, miso soup, teriyaki bowl, unagi, and screaming orgasm.

It's 10:30pm on a Tuesday night, and it hits me that I'm hungry... Really hungry!  I remembered driving by this place, and it looking fairly crowded before.  I yelped it, and it looked try worthy.

This place is not bad at all.  You can't beat the price for all you can eat sushi in Vegas.  I was seated at the bar and was given a brief explanation of how the all you can eat works.  The waitress suggested that I order small because whatever I don't eat, I will have to pay for in addition to the all you can eat price.  Also, you have to eat the rice and the fish (sounds obvious, but I do know of people who would hide the rice and just eat the fish).  Also, you can order half rolls (4 pieces instead of 8), so you can eat more of a variety.  There is also a 1 hour time limit... so no pulling Man v. Food all day here.  

I ordered and ordered because I was determined to get my money's worth.  I had the sweet shrimp (only 1 order per person), snow crab hand rolls, crab sticks, garlic tuna (my least favorite), halibut, some kind of variation on the a shrimp roll with avocado, more snow crab, the hottest 911 roll I have ever had (I couldn't feel my tongue-- it was awesome), and more halibut.  I was stuffed, but determined to finish my last hand roll when I was asked by Jun (one of the sushi chefs) if I wanted anything else.  I told him I was tapping out.  I had fought the good fight... then he offers dessert.  I'm not one to turn down sugar, but I don't think I could have looked at more food much less ate it.  

My bill was about $30 with my plum wine.  The only reason I couldn't give this place 5 starts is because I've had fresher fish elsewhere at an all you can eat.  Of course, this was in Cali.
Pretty good all you can eat Mexican sushi.   They restrict the good stuff, but overall a decent meal.

A strong 3 Stars IMHO...

I saw a tip recently that they do a great California Roll here...lol...well they do more than that.  There are only a few incredible things I find here these days (under the "new" owner and staff,) but there is still a lot they are doing right here.

As I see it, there are two reasons to come here: Uni & AYCE.  They don't serve any disappointments here.  Just about everything is a little above average, so with AYCE you get a lot of good food at a solid price $26/$27 I think.  But outside of the Uni there is nothing here worth calling out specifically in my book.  One of the better spots in the immediate area, but not a place I go out of my to get to.

Fresh and lots to choose from. My favorite rolls were the Ecstacy Roll and Sexy Girl. The seared tuna and salmon nigiri was also great. For dessert I would recommend the lychee and green tea ice cream.
Great place! Loved the atmosphere, our server was really good, really fast and attentive! Would def come back! The blue fin tuna was amazing!!!!

I'd give it a zero if I could. My daughter and her 3 friends went there today and all but one had the all you can eat buffet for $23 each. She called me to pick her up because she really felt sick after eating. She had big stomach aches. When we came home she said that the other 2 girls had to throw up and had stomach aches as well. We called the restaurant and the manager said to go to the doctor and have the doctor prove that it was their food which made her sick. Really? And how do I do that? Besides waffles this morning she had nothing else to eat, and the fact that her other friends got sick also should speak for itself. I just found out that one of the others called as well and the manager said she wasn't sorry that they got sick! How absolutely pathetic. We didn't want a free meal, we more wanted the money back, but the manager flat out said no money back. Don't ever go there please and eat the buffet.

I gave it couple tries and was never happy with this place.. The sushi is good but not great and I just didn't feel like I was eating something different with every roll they brought to us. Will not be going back.

Once again Sushi Mon has exceeded my expectations.  This is now our second time here and had the best service from the staff and our Sushi chef Tomo. 

If you come to the location on Maryland be sure and ask for Tomo you will not be disappointed.

This place was the best in town for years. It had two amazing qualities. Value and quality. Now you get better value out of grocery store sushi with the small serving sizes. Secondly the quality of the fish has gone down greatly. Not nearly as fresh now. I am assuming because less people are coming so they must be saving the fish. 
Save your money and go somewhere else.

Awesome. There will be a wait, especially if you have a group of more than two. And the wait can be very very long because the place is small. But it's worth it. Just go to the Starbucks a couple stores down and relax until your table is ready.

I've been going to this place since it opened! They have so much sushi rolls it's ridiculous! 

If you are going to come here make sure you get the all you can eat! I guarantee you want to try everything on their menu! 

The fish is super fresh! It taste as if they had the ocean in their back yard.  So awesome! 

The hamachi kama is my favorite and the baked mussels is a must! If you are hungry this is the sushi place to visit! 

It can get extremely busy at times and their can be a wait as longs as 45 mins- 1 hr.  If you have the patience your wait will be worth your while!
Excellent service, fast service, more fish than rice, caviar is the bomb, love this place!
Love this place very quite place to eat with the famiily employees are great!! Keep up the good work

Every time I came to Vegas, this is the first restaurant I will go to immediately. Generally I order the all you can eat, most of them I like are appetizers. My favorite Japanese restaurant. The only thing I really dislike is that we have to wait for at least 40 minutes for dinner. No reservation.

I would say that this is a step down from the other location in Vegas. However, it's still pretty good. The price is good, the variety is good, and they seem to have pretty fresh fish. It just depends on what you order. Unfortunately, they missed on a couple of dishes:

* Snow Crab - stuff was NASTY
* Yellowtail Collar - Super dry. Texture of dried chicken with the taste of fish.

Now onto the good stuff:

* You can order rolls by half order so you can try more things
* Their hamachi, tuna, and salmon were all pretty good quality
* They have two price points so you can save money if you don't need some of the pricier fish (uni, salmon/yellowtail collar, snow crab, etc)
* They have really delicious smoothies (does not come with AYCE)
* The rolls are creative and give you a lot of variety in preparation and ingredients.
* They have natto (that gives them an extra star)

All in all, the lunch was a good experience. It's just too bad they weren't as consistent as the other location.

Cheers!

This is not the best sushi I've ever had.  However, it is the best AYCE sushi I've ever had.  And it's considerably better than some regular sit down sushi places I have been as well.  The fish is pretty fresh, they don't overdo it on the rice when you order nigiri sushi, the rolls are creative and very tasty and the coup de grace: they have natto!!!  I had four natto hand rolls on top of everything else I ordered when I ate there.

Just a very well done AYCE sushi experience.  Kudos Sushi Mon!

Cheers!

this place used to be the bomb, great service great food, and a ridiculously long wait during peak hours. I really liked the waiting system where they text you and let you know how long your wait is and when your table is ready that way you can go hang out at starbucks nextdoor or run some errands. The last time I was there with the husband, there was no more waitlist texting system and we waited 3 hours for a party of 2 when the hostess originally said only 45 minutes and they would call us when our table was ready. Came back after 2 hours as we waited in the car because it was so cold and windy outside and the outdoor heaters were broken or turned off. I thought they had the wrong number to contact me, but nope. I told the hostess that they weren't on, she just said, "oh, ok." anyways, after a 2 hr wait in the car in the cold, the hostess told us it would be only another 45 minutes. Waited another hour and finally left and went to Sushi Koma. It has been 3 weeks and I am still waiting for a phone call to tell us our table is ready at Sushi Mon. 

I had also gone to Goyemon (a sushi mon related joint) about a week ago and they still had the texting waitlist system which worked perfectly. Not sure what is happening at sushi mon on maryland.

Pretty decent all-you-can-eat sushi bar, which is harder to find in Las Vegas these days.  My favorite used to be Hamada, but they stopped doing it a year or so ago.

They have some rules, which seem fair.  They state that you must eat everything (including rice) in order to avoid getting charged, but they didn't seem to enforce that rule, grabbing plates away before we had a chance to eat every crumb.  I think as long as you don't abuse the all-you-can-eat, they are totally cool about it.

The place is nothing special, located in a shopping strip mall.  However, they are open late, which is a real plus in my book.  We went late, and there were quite a few people coming and going.

The hamachi and maguro nigiri were actually very good.  The miso soup was not (too watery and not much tofu).  The sunomono salad was also very tasty and fresh.  The rolls are big, so order conservatively until you see what I am talking about.  The 9-1-1 roll was scorching HOT!  We loved it, but unless you want to sweat, don't order it.  The menu warns you in case you don't listen to me.  Keep in mind the rule if you don't eat everything.

Overall, I give it a thumbs up.  I would go back if I was looking a late night sushi spot for sure.  The total bill for 3 people was $95.78 and that included 3 all-you-can-eat orders and 1 large Sapporo.  Tip was extra.
Always hits the spot! Very affordable for AYCE Sushi especially for lunch! Staff always have a smile on their face and very friendly. Sushi Chef's at the Sushi Bar are also very attentive.

The sushi chefs are great.  The food was great but haven't returned since 2014 for one reason even though it was one of my favorite spots to go to.  I will never return just because the waitress/ female server scolded me for having leftovers.  I was extremely stuffed and couldn't take another bite.  She said that "next time, don't leave leftovers. I said, maybe there won't be a next time.  There will never be a next time.

Two stars for service only. The food is very mediocre at best. My sushi items did not arrive cold, just "cool." Didn't feel well the next day. Price is one thing, but truly there is very little quality here. If you must go, I would recommend cooked items only.

I ALWAYS go to sushimon whenever I'm in Vegas...always loved their food and service.

But this time..i was very disappointed with their service. well I should say the MANAGER!!

we had party of 10 so we had to wait until all the tables opened up. We put our name down and waited inside since it was cold outside. The manager told us to wait outside so other guests can sign in. Then, we asked him how goyemon was (the same owner) and we talked among ourselves if we should try goyemon instead.  We decided to stay and continued to wait outside for our table. 

After 40minutes of waiting, the manager comes out and goes " Oh, I gave your table away because I thought you guys weren't eating here." 

UHHHHH WHY DO YOU THINK WE WERE WAITING OUTSIDE!!!???

No sorry or nothing...Very disappointed...

The service was wonderful - 4 stars.

The quality of the food was 2 stars. 

There were 4-5 sushi chefs working and I think the least experience chef prepared our sushi rolls and sushi cuts. What we should have done was asked for our food remade by a different chef.  You live, you learn...

Was so disappointed with the quality and presentation of the food we received that I asked for a call back from the manager.  Have not heard back from the manager. 

Parking: plenty of parking spots available in the plaza.

This place seems to be super packed all the time- which means the service is rushed with everyone snappy and out of breath. Sushi is good. Once, there was a hair in one roll and after informing our waitress, she apologized and brought back a bowl of tempura ice cream after the bill...which was cool. Because it's super packed, you are jam packed with other people like a can of sardines so it tends to get noisy.

Good selection of sushi. Good service.

Small restaurant.

You mark a list and they bring food to you.

Not on the strip, so plan it on the way to or back from Vegas.

Ice cream tempura hits the spot.

Bottom line: Not anything different or special, but a good place to eat sushi in Vegas if you crave it!

One of the best All You Can Eat Sushi Restaurants in town.  Been coming to this place for the past nine years.  Awesome Sushi - Cajun Albacore, Salmon, White Tuna, Garlic Tuna, Tako and Yellowtail are excellent.  911 roll is a challenge, but if you like to drink a lot of ice and water, this is the roll for you.  Orion Roll is one of the best, also, Supreme Salmon Roll is awesome.  So many rolls and different type of items on the menu to try...worth the all you can eat price.  Just be prepared to wait for over twenty-forty minutes during the busy dinner times.
I eat here once a month. Love it !!! I personally think they should allow children to bring in their own food because not all kids eat sushi. But that's there rules!

Went here with a group of 12 of us during our trip to Vegas.  Friend in the group had been here several times and recommended the place.  We called ahead to make rsvp and they were able to accommodate us with such a big group...so that was awesome.  
The place is kinda small and our group took over almost of the restaurant.  The service was great and the waitress were nice.  Some of us decided to try the AYCE and the other group did the a la carte.  I went for the AYCE and it the sushi was pretty good.   I would definitely come back and do the AYCE again but this time come with an emptier stomach!

It took 1.5 hours for my squad to be seated on a Saturday, so we went to Sitara to kill time. Once seated at SushiMon, the waitress was very patient with us & personable while we took a gander at the menu. She recommended items based on what we liked. All of the rolls came out soon after we placed our orders. Everything was good and tasted fresh, but hardly stuck out to me from their competitors. The notable rolls: Lemon Roll, Chubby, Hurricane, & Sexy Girl. I was starved from the long ass wait that I did not take a single food pic. I also liked the octopus seaweed salad. They have lychee sorbet as a dessert item, with lychee chunks! Reminded me of home (Hawaii). Fyi Goyemon on Decatur is its sister property & has the same exact menu.

Great attentive friendly service. AYCE sushi. Take note that sashimi not included. Read the house rules before you order or else you might be charge more. Came here for lunch for the all you can eat for $ 23 tax included without gratuity. Had the tako salad which was a bit salty. The sushi were fresh and generous amount of fish on top of the rice. The rolls come in half orders just tell the sushi chef. Overall it was a pleasant and refreshing experience to dine here.

Came with three people and we all got the "all you can eat" for $22 during lunch. Dinner isn't much more than that.

Started things off with the sexy girl roll, the most expensive item on the menu. A pretty tasty shrimp tempura roll. It contained shrimp tempura, cucumber, scallop, spicy tuna. Blended with spicy garlic sauce and eel sauce.

For the nigiri, we had the yellow tail, salmon, and tuna rolls. My favorite was the salmon nigiri.
We followed things up with the cajun albacore. Loved the unique cajun seasoning on the albacore. Brings out a new flavor to sushi.

Other Orders...

Volcano roll came out nice and warm with quite interesting flavors. Overall, pretty okay.
Scallop yum yum roll with orgasm sauce was the best!
Pixie roll contained crab, shrimp, cucumber, avocado, smelt eggs, and eel sauce all wrapped in soy paper. An unusually large roll. Also an unfavorable ending to my stomach considering the amount of sushi we already had. 

Finished things off with a tempura ice cream. Unfortunately, it was a bit disappointing. The tempura was just too soft and soggy.

I never had bad service from here and sadly i did last night. Never once a 5 stars from me dropped to a 1 star. I work in the food industry also so i know how it works. The only way to keep customer coming back is having good food quality and providing excellent experiences for them.
We waited almost 10 mins to have anyone to noticed us and sit us. 
Only time the server check on us is when he asked for our drinks. Asked for one iced tea and 1 water with lemons came out 2 water with lemons. Hey thats ok. People make mistake. 
What upsets me the most is that if we seated at the bar, the reason to sit there is to be served directly from the chef. 
We sat there exactly for 10 mins. And no one even acknowledge if us were there. NO HI NO HELLO NO WELCOME but a glare from a mexican chef with his unhappy face. We get it youre busy. But it takes 30 secs to remind customers that you know they are there, and will be right there to help. I wouldnt mind waiting so much.  I wanted to walk out so bad but the bf told me not to since we ordered side dishes already.
10 mins passed, still no help so i had to get the server attention if we could order and he took our orders. 
Was going to do all you can eat but we felt so uncomfortable with the place were being so loud, no one seems to want to come check on us or even help us. Also the mexican guy kept glaring and rolling his eyes at us. So we switched it to ala carte and hurried to leave. The Experience werent great at all.

We've eaten here years ago. Never thought about coming back because We have our favorite Sushi joints and there are just tons to choose from in the city. My in laws invited us to eat here with them one night so we happily obliged.

We got the AYCE dinner. Kids don't have reduced AYCE price, one star off for that. My kids don't eat much but I like that if they want more, they can just order. But since they didn't have kids AYCE price, we ordered a la carte for them. 

We started with half Roll orders. I ordered a tiger roll and another one (I forget the exact name). All were bland and bla. Poké and nigiri were good. I was turned off by some of the food my kids ordered and by the rolls we all ordered. No umph in looks or taste at all!! 

Even though my palate and stomach were satiated by the nigiri (because after a taste of the other food, they were my only options), I felt a bit robbed. After I ordered my dessert, I turn around to the sushi bar (because my dessert took a good loooong 10 min or so (ice cream scoop), and I notice a chalkboard in the back with "specials".

I was so annoyed because our waiter didn't tell us that our AYCE dinner included all that is listed on the chalkboard. Why was I so irked??? Because one of my favorite things to order at Japanese restaurants were up there and not on my menu at the table -- hamachi kama and sake Kama. I told the waiter I was upset because he didn't mention the specials to us. He did apologize but that did not remove the bad taste the whole place left in my mouth. Pun intended!

Love this place! A Vegas trip would not be complete without stopping by and getting me some AYCE sushi. The food is authentic and the waiters are friendly. The cost is about $25ish. Definitely would not suggest bringing a big group, unless you don't mind the wait. There's a 90minute time limit to their AYCE, but of all the times I have been there, they have yet to enforce it. Try the Dynamite. It's delici-o-so! Be sure to pick up a stamp card before you leave because you'll be coming back here again and again!

Can't beat these place with AYCE Sushi.  I've probably been here for 6-7 years now.  Yes portion has decreased somewhat, but it is still good..  It's almost like a mom and pop shop.  They always have some sorts of fish belly.

A few people had recommended this place for all you can eat sushi, so I was looking forward to it. This was the fourth all you can eat sushi place I have tried in Vegas. Honestly, I was really disappointed. The tables are almost stacked on top of each other when you are seated. I could have rubbed elbows with the table next to me. The fish was not fresh when I was there, which was a big bummer. I'm not sure why everyone is raving about the menu selection, because this place had the smallest selection of the 4 I have been to. They are quick to get the rolls out to you, but quick isn't always good. The quality definitely wasn't there. I think most people like this place because it's convenient, but outside of that you should go elsewhere.
The host was really unfriendly when we tried to get a table. Didn't get the phone number correctly and told us to get out of the restaurant to wait...so we went somewhere else.

I'm not a huge sushi fan.

SACRILEGE!

I'm just not.  I have this weird fear of fish, live ones, and sashimi still scares me a bit because it's a little too close to the live fish state.  It's an irrational fear and I can't explain it, but it exists.  I like a lot of rolls, but I have a problem with nori, too.  So when all my friends go to Sushi Mon for the All You Can Eat special, I totally get teriyaki chicken and shrimp and veggie tempura and it is GOOD.  I'm pretty picky about my tempura, and theirs was great.

My friends always finish amazing amounts of sushi, and they bring it out pretty quickly.  It tends to get really crowded and the tables feel a bit cramped, but that could just be your ever expanding waistline as you consume mass amounts of food.

Try it out.  It ain't bad at all.
First time here....it was good. My second time, oh man. The rice was hard and fell apart. Tempura was flavorless. And the fish was so bland. We were so disappointed.
Hands down the best sushi in town. Even if you don't do raw, you will love it. tempura ice cream is a must!

All you can eat- Yes please!

They say you have 45 min to eat all you want but I have never been kicked out but I do think I am always full by the 45 min marker.  

The fish is good and fresh. They get you in and out in a good time without being pushy. The rolls are always coming on strong there.  

They do not take reservations which can mean that you are and WILL be waiting in a long line to get in.  IF you are two people then it is easy to shimmy up to the bar.  Tables can be a wait. Do not come starving during the lunch hour.

Ate here today with my two friends. It's a pretty small place and it's popular so there was a 45 minute wait for a table at 8ish, which is to be expected. We just wandered around while we waited. 

Once we got seated they got us drinks pretty fast and we sat at the bar so we were able to tell them right away that we were doing ayce and start ordering. 

I wasn't a fan of their cucumber salad. I think they should have it chopped differently. I also wasn't a fan of the naked mussels or tempura. 

The red snapper was delicious as was the garlic tuna. 

The wait staff was terribly unattentive. It made their 60 minute rule for ayce seem unfair. They checked on us maybe twice.

All in all it's ok but I prefer going elsewhere

Soo soo good. Everything is fresh! Everything is delicious. The Service is great. the baked green mussels! To die for! Oh how I love this place. I could eat sushi here all day everyday. The all you can eat is so worth it. Maybe I'm just a fatty, but I love this place and I could eat there alll day long. YUUUUM!

My sister and I have been coming to Sushi Mon for more than a year and we always leave satisfied! The servers are always super nice and coming around to take more sushi orders and refill the drinks. And I love that they offer half rolls so we can try more of the menu and not fill up on was one or two rolls. I love the garlic edamame and the ecstasy roll! I always start and finish with it! Oh and they even have a punch card! We've already gone through two!!

New management in this location. No Uni and no substitute! No fried shrimp head in my miso soup! WTF! From the waiter, the new management limit the food to save costs! Sorry to see one of the best sushi places go down like this. We come here for over 15 years and always order fried shrimp head in miso soup. Now they stop doing that to save food cost, why don't they close the business to save the rent!! Time for searching a new sushi place, IMO

By far the best sushi in the US we have had so far!

Every time we come to Vegas we rent a car and make the trip to Sushi Mon.  We get the All-U-Can-Eat and we take full advantage of it.  Everything we had was delicious, fresh, and wonderful!

I wish I could be more specific but we had so much that we can't remember it all.  Be sure to get there early in the day to make a reservation, the AYCE availability fills up fast at night.

The sushi chefs are very nice and the wait staff is great too!  Be sure to order half orders (4 pieces) so you can try a lot of different rolls.

Remember people, you have to eat the rice too!  Don't get all you can eat and pick the fish off!  And don't complain when they tell you that you have to eat the rice.  If you don't like it then just order sashimi a la carte.

Nice out of the way all you can eat sushi place.  I usually eat enough nigiri to make the trip and price worth while but as a discerning certified asian, I eat muuuuch more than I can handle.  I can eat way more fish than the $25.95 all you can eat price.

Only restriction is one uni and amaebi dish per person (and one toro when they have it).  The tempura here is very well done and somehow, in the middle of a desert, the fish is quite fresh.  Definitely a place I'd go back to when I'm in town.

My fiancé and I always come here when we're craving sushi. It's our go to sushi place! 

The service is delightful! The waiters/waitress are very polite and quick. They filled up our glasses as needed, cleaned our dishes as often as possible. (We ordered a lot at a time for a very little table, them taking our dishes away constantly helped a lot!) 

As for the food, 11/10 highly recommend! The baked mussels here are my favorite. We always do AYCE when we come here. The sushi is never dry, it's refreshing. The sushi here is never overloaded by rice like some places. It's the right amount of rice to compliment the fish.

The experience I had here was amazing. This will always be my go to spot for sushi!

What a shame? New ownership. Used to come once a week. Was very friendly relaxed atmosphere. Maybe it's changed in the last 4-5 months, but after the changeover it became very uncomfortable. Large slices of fish became thin. Included items became additional charges. I have a son, 2 years old. As a regular, I think you let people get away with things (I say this as a restaurant owner who let's my regular customers have things all the time). I have to admit, I was annoyed when they charged my son who eats two pieces of a roll and plays with a third piece. I'm not cheap and I don't mind paying for him, but we were good for at least once a week. . . Let it slide. 

Then flavors from the kitchen changed too. Take it or leave it. I bought my restaurant as an existing business as well. Your customers liked what they received. You may think you're improving something, but in reality you are changing something that people like. It was good before. Now we're regulars at sushi koma. Very happy, but miss the old crew.

Boy was I disappointed. Had all the run of the mill sushi that you expect an All you can eat place to have, however past the basics, there wasn't much. 

Food was decently priced.

Service was scarce at best.

Overall, the quality just seemed lacking. I love sushi and this place did not rub me the right way.
Still and always will be my favorite sushi place. Fresh fish, great service! I am never disappointed at SushiMon!
Great place! Nice staffs! Love the screaming orgasm so much! As it was recommended by the chef when i explained what i was craving for.

This place has an all-you-can-eat sushi thing, but the thing is you can't share. It also says there is a time limit, but they don't care, so eat to your limit! I sometimes eat the all-you-can-eat sushi, but I also like the donkatsu which you order separately apart from the all-you-can-eat. As a finale, I always enjoy the strawberry mochi ice cream, my favorite. Don't worry for all you all-you-can-eat peeps, dessert is also all-you-can-eat!

I go to Sushi Mon on Sahara several times per month. The employees are friendly and attentive (unlike their partner Goya Mon on Trop where they make you feel like you are imposing every time you order something). The food is amazing - the sushi is fresh and they offer some favorites like garlic edamame, baked mussels, and  sashimi salad on the all you can eat . I would recommend this sushi place to anyone who is looking to stuff themselves on great food.

Sushi mon was A-OK. We were pressed for time so we just wanted something quick, easy and that would fill us up. 

We tried 3 different rolls: 

Spider roll - (5pcs) Deep fried soft shell crab, crab meat, cucumber and avocado wrapped in soy paper with eel sauce $9.95- The soy paper was green so it looked interesting. The fried crab flavor was faint and almost tasted like shrimp tempura. I wouldn't say it's the best roll I've ever ate, it was basic and not memorable.

Volcano roll - (8pcs) California roll with yum yum sauce & scallop  $8.95 - it was smothered in yum yum mayo/eel sauce. I'm not complaining since I love that decadent stuff. 

Caterpillar roll - (8pcs) Eel and cucumber wrapped with sliced avocado & eel sauce $9.95 - one of the classics! It was good, the eel was fatty and I enjoyed it. But $10 is pretty pricy in my opinion. 

I think that they are overpriced for their presentation and what was offered to us. But businesses have to make their money somehow!

This place has been here as long as I've been living in the area. It is located on Sahara just east of Durango inside a shopping complex. Had no issues parking and came at 1pm just a few hours after opening. 

After the disappointment at 808 tapas I've been craving some good sushi, especially an AYCE spot. In comes Sushi Mon, their AYCE is $21.95 and they give you 45 minutes to eat. 45 minutes may not seem like a lot but at the speed they make them in and how much you can order its more than enough time. 

I ordered some nigiri, salmon, squid, and cajun albacore along with 007 roll, JJ roll, pastel, and alaskan roll. It was all very delicious, service was super fast and very efficient. I was completely stuffed when I walked out and more than satisfied. 

Whats great about this place is if you really want to try something but don't want the 8 pieces, they let you get a half order's with 4 pieces, so you can really try a diverse selection rather than get stuffed on a few items. Remember anything you don't finish they charge you for so make sure your eyes aren't bigger than your stomach.

Get their frequent dining card, after the 10th AYCE you get one free, whats great is if your with someone and they get the AYCE it counts as two on your card so if you go with people that don't go often get credit for their meal. All in all I enjoyed my lunch, at dinner its 3 dollars more for their AYCE and they give you 15 more minutes for a total of 1 hour.

Sushi Mon you dropped a  on me. Veggie tempura was fantastical! Domingo roll exxxtra exxxtra good Royal california YES! The Royal led us to the Crispy and MG! dessert perfect Lychee sorbet  thank you so much to our server George who was very attentive and made our experience extra special. Thank you to all orher staff for being so friendly and helpful. Sushi chegs you Rock! Will be back!

I always love coming into this sushi spot. Ben & Tony are awesome and knowledgeable about the fish your eatting. I would say go into Sushi Mon and enjoy their great sushi. I have to say the only disappointment is they stopped free saki in certain days.
Sushimon is one of my favorite go to spots when I don't feel like risking a new spot. It's not the best spot I've been to but is consistent and reliable. Same with their sister property goymon.

pleasant surprise.  I'm usually disappointed with the all you can eat sushi places.  I've never been happy with a sushi roll that has fruit on it.  Somehow, they have one that is really quite good.  The hand rolls are very generous with a nice piece of fish and not a ton of rice.  I'll be back for sure.

Everytime we are out in Vegas, one meal has to be at Sushi Mon.  It's a great AYCE nigiri, side dishes, rolls, and desert selection.  The dinner includes uni, toro, and amaebi...if you love this type of nigiri sushi.  I don't know any place that have this option in the AYCE menu.  I'm usually full from the nigiri but they have a wide selection of rolls.  That's what the hubby enjoys...a variety.  We keep coming back here to Sushi Mon...the fish is fresh, good quality, and prepared well!  Kan pai to our sushi chef, Rocky, who made everything delicious and such a great environment.  We'll be back!

For years, this use to be our go to sushi spot and the only place to eat sushi in Vegas.  The last few visits have been disappointing and it's been downhill.  They use to have the freshest fish and best selections.  Now there's barely any special sushi (like Uni, of course they tell us mid-meal, tons of rice in the nigiri and fish doesn't seem fresh or top quality - not the place it use to be.  Not sure if we'll be back...

Fish is not fresh,  sushi is salty and fried tempura ice cream-is generic and old.  Shrimp tempura is fast and cold,   Sauce is. Cold and light. Calamari loos like a fried tofu chalk, poke is tasteless.  Don't know why this place is full. Won't go back here anymore.

Hands down the best AYCE sushi experience anywhere.  I wish i can say i have joked about making the trek from Los Angeles out to LV just for this sushi but it has happened!  We always have to visit Sushi Mon whenever Vegas happens.  This is not cheap, poor quality, limited option, endless up-charge sushi either. It is impossible to try everything here even on multiple visits since they always have new offerings. Your options are close to 100 and include hot items like baked mussels and gyoza and desserts like mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream.  You can order half rolls too so you can try more of a variety.  I have never seen fresh scallops, sweet shrimp, uni, halibut, and sometimes toro all  on a AYCE menu.  The best part of it all is lunch is about $27 with tax/tip and dinner is just a few bucks more!  I am sure we easily would pay double since they amount of food and the quality is on par with $100 sushi experience at any of my normal spots in the South Bay.  On top of this they give you a punch card so after 10 AYCEs you get one for free!  BONUS!!! So yes it is worth the trip, the gas, and the experience!

I am kicking myself for coming here! I live close and thought I would try it. The worst sushi I've had in a long time. The rice was super dry and the fish is prob grade D. They hide the worst fish in the rolls.

Fish was fresh and cut in decently thick (read: not paper thin) slices.  We had salmon belly, tuna, seared tuna, super white tuna, scallop, snow crab meat, unagi, amaebi, uni, and more that I don't remember (3 guys ate about 45+ orders) and there were basically no complaints.  Service was pretty fast, despite a mostly packed house.  Orgasm sauce was unique and tasty, but it kills the purity of the nigiri.  

Best AYCE sushi I've had and good enough quality for non-AYCE.

Came in on a weekday seems to be a popular local place for sushi ...dress pretty casual ....place kind of small think McDonald's size ...happy hour they have $4 something glasses of wine and cheap beer ...the best part is out of the all you can eat menu you can do halfs of each my favorite baked roll !!!!

Great AYCE sushi place. I went for lunch. A smaller establishment than other AYCE sushi places in vegas but still solid fish. 

They have a 45 minute time limit, but they didn't seem to enforce it since it took them about 20 minutes to get the first set of rolls out. 

The salmon belly was amazing. The sushi rice was a bit  blah and I got tired of it really fast. 

The yellowtail was also very fresh as well. 

In addition, great rolls and very different from the standard fare.

ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI...

and they're not stingy with the sashimi!

Wait just a minute! how the hell do they manage to have so much fresh fish when they're located in the middle of desert? Better than the places back at home in CA. 

Next time your in Vegas take a little trip, about 15 minutes away from the strip, come here with a big group, order everything on the menu, 
and enjoy!!!

I love the sushi here, they have delicious rolls. The only down side is how busy it can be. Coming here for dinner you have to expect a 30-1 hr wait at least the times I've come. Other than that my favorite place to eat Sushi with a group.

parking: parking in front. lots of parking. 

environment: came at 12:05 pm, a little bit after they opened, and the place was half filled. customer service is a - ok. i think they have more people coming here earlier so service slows down. they are really good with serving food. we had the ayce for 21.99, each order is 2 pieces. what has changed since the previous time i was here is that, before we got uni for lunch too. this time you have to add 5 dollars, then every person can get 2 orders. which isnt a great deal.

food: sushi is fresh, and sushi is cut nicely. sadly the food doesnt come fast enough, and leave us starving :/

My wife and I eat at this location at least once a month.  Today was our anniversary so we decided to go here.  This visit was awful.  Normally the service is excellent, but tonight not even close.  After our 1st serving of the all you can eat deal the waiter asked if we were ready for desert, and ask three more times before we were finished.  We were reminded that our hour was up and we could make one final order.  I have no problem with this, but it was the first time that has happened.  While I was still chewing my food the waiter who had dropped our check on our table kept checking to see if we put our card out to pay, and we said we would pay at the counter and he said they needed the table.  So before I swallowed we just got up and paid.  I am terribly disappointed and most likely will not go back.  It's sad because the food is great and I can deal with bad service, but not straight up rudeness.
awesome prices awesome food and they are generous with it! i can't forget to mention the great service. this is my new sushi spot! i highly recommend it

This place is a great go-to for AYCE sushi AND ice cream! The service is fast and the quality of everything is pretty damned good considering how much you are paying for AYCE. 

They limit certain menu items (e.g. toro and amaebi nigiri) so beware when you order! The shooters and carpaccio items are good when you need something other than just straight up sushi. We got an order of the shrimp tempura for some fried goodness and were happy with our decision to do so. 

Don't forget about the AYCE ice cream!

I...don't know why I haven't written a review for this place yet. How weird. 

This is definitely what I consider to be my gold standard when it comes to AYCE sushi. For $35 (dinner) this is definitely a bargain...especially since the quality is up there.

I hate to admit...but their rolls are pretty amazing. I'm usually not a fan of rolls but their sexy girl and ecstasy rolls were my favorites. 

Their selection of nigiri sushi is pretty good. Don't forget to look at their specials...those are usually too good to pass up! 

Did I mention I'm a fan of their tempura ice cream? Soooo good! 

And I'll be honest, service here sucks (go figure). They're slow as heck but you definitely get your money's worth (and then some) so whatevers. I'll overlook the poor service this time.
Food was very good. Service was fast and friendly. That's why the wait is soooo long during peak times though.

Having a sushi roll named after me is an automatic 4 stars!! 
Come on now, a Cynthia roll!?! My goodness. That NEVER happens!! =D

But besides that, I'm glad there's a sushi place located on this side of town that is opened pretty late. It's good for those late night sushi fix and you don't have to go all the way to the busy Chinatown area.

Aside for the Cynthia roll, we order a couple others and they were all delicious. Each order came with 8 pieces. 

Cannot justify giving Sushi Mon the full 5 stars because 1. it's a bit pricey if you are planning to order a la carte. I'm a  very small eater...I love trying different sushi rolls but I just CANNOT, will not get AYCE because it won't be worth the price for me. So ordering a la carte, you're looking at $10-14 per order. Also, the place is pretty small which means tables are fairly close to each other. Not a big fan of that...I really don't want the table next to me to hear my mildly-inappropriate conversations to my significant other. ;)

We've been going here since 2008 and we are never disappointed. Place is clean, sushi is always fresh with great quality, staff is always nice, friendly, happy and accommodating. Sushi Mon is a tiny restaurant, sometimes a long wait on weekend dinner nights but it's worth the wait for something local. They don't take reservations either, they keep their business simple. They are not over priced, their sake menu is awesome and sushi menu is exceptional.

Having eaten my way through most of the AYCE sushi places in Vegas, I can say that some definitely shine bright (more creative rolls, better fish selection, etc), but Sushi-mon wins every time in overall value, consistency and freshness.

Admittedly, I have history here, so this review may be somewhat biased. I've been coming here since the advent of AYCE sushi in this town. Though I've ventured off to try other places, I somehow always find myself back here. It sort of has a "Cheersish" vibe for me.

The main reason I love it here is that I know I will get fresh, consistent product. I have never received anything less than that. At a lot of places in town, you may receive old or frozen fish which is very disconcerting. Sushi-mon somehow always has beautifully fresh fish. 

In addition, they are FAST! I order something (in most cases, LOTS of things) and it's on the table in 5 minutes. Sushi-mon chefs seem to get a kick out of the people who order ridiculous amounts of food, so they send it out as quick as they can. 

Speaking of the staff, they are as friendly as can be. Fransisco is my "go-to" server and he always takes care of us. Paul, the busser/runner, knows us well too and always keeps our drinks filled and our table clean. 

But on to the food...

As I said, we usually order our fair share of nigiri: hamachi, garlic tuna, aji, hirame, hotate with yuzu...but our favorites are the hokkigai (surf clam) and sake (salmon). I've never had surf clam as fresh and delicious as theirs. If you've tried surf clam somewhere else and hated it, try it here. Trust me.

The rolls are no joke as well. Some favorites are the Yebisu, Stacey and Hurricane roll, but I've yet to try one I didn't like. Another tip: you can get most rolls in "hand roll" form. I like to get yumyum scallops, california and spider rolls that way. Also, try some baked green mussels. They're creamy and briny, yet sweet and unctuous. If you're still hungry after all that, get the Frying Jason roll. It's delicious, but it'll put you over the edge. Their side dishes (miso soup, tempura shrimp, sesame chicken, calamari) are terrific as well. 

Ok. That's enough. This review is making me hungry. I'll see y'all there!
:::insert Cheers theme song here:::

I absolutely LOVE this place. AYCE or not, best fish in town! the fish is soo fresh! it's a bit of a wait depending on your luck.. but worth the wait and the price. 

must haves during visit:
- baked green mussels
- yellowtail collar
- cajun albacore nigiri 
- super white tuna nigiri
- sexy girl roll
- moment roll
- yellowtail belly (check for specials)
- salmon belly (check for specials)
- lychee sorbet, green tea ice cream
YUMM-MAYYY! trust me! 

the staff from sushi chiefs to waiters provide excellent service!

Oy. I don't even know where to start. My friends have gone to the Sushi Mon over on Maryland before, and one of them got pretty ill, but she gets sick pretty easily so I didn't necessarily think it was cause to boycott all Sushi Mon locations in the state. How wrong I was. 

I was here the other night on a date (his choice), and I was immediately underwhelmed by the super small interior, fishy smell, and the fact that they said the wait was 20 min but ended up being 35. We finally got seated at the bar and opted for the AYCE, which I normally never do, but seemed like a good idea so I could order some uni and salmon belly. I was slightly skeptical about the quality of the fish, but I've eaten a lot of gross things in my day and figured it couldn't be thaaat bad. 

Well, a few pieces of sushi into the meal, a beetle comes crawling across my plate. That's right, a BEETLE. I sprang into action and crushed that sucker with my napkin, as it became incredibly clear that my date was paralyzed by bugs. Too stunned and disgusted to fully comprehend what just happened, I was in the process of looking around for a server to tell them what I saw when ANOTHER BEETLE came crawling up from under the sushi bar and onto my plate. At this point I jumped up from my seat and my date's face was white, (I was grossed out but also found this whole scenario incredibly funny, and I felt really bad for him), and as small as the place was, no other diners really seemed aware that they were eating next to bugs, and what's more alarming is that the employees barely cared!! A busser came over to take my napkins with the bugs in them that I had already killed, mumbled out an apology, and went on his way. We had to then ask for the bill so we could get out of there, but that was it, no other apology, no comping of anything, we barely ate more than 4 pieces of nigiri and they still charged us for 2 AYCE meals. Absurd. 

Bugs on Sahara, recorded illnesses on Maryland, horrible service at both. Health Inspector...where are you!?

Love this place.  Been going there since 2003.  Best all you can eat sushi in town. My favorite are the baked mussels. Make sure you order what you can eat.  Sometimes Toro is on the special menu. I highly recommend it.  Also plan on waiting a little bit. This spot is hot. They have a texting system. They told me 45 minutes. I left than came back when I was texted. Sweet.

Good food and service.

Their sushi is pretty good but I felt that their fish wasn't as fresh as other joints that I have been to. Their AYCE selection caters to diverse palettes. My favorite picks would be the garlic tuna and bake lasagna. Another plus is that you can order as much ice cream and desserts.lol The staff is very attentive and friendly too.

My favorite all-you-can-eat sushi spot.  Extensive appetizer menu including baked mussels and himachi kama. Yummmm! If you like heat, try their 911 roll. Absolutely delicious!

I give it a 4, not because of the food (food is definitely 5 stars), but the service is hit or miss. I would suggest sitting at the bar. The chefs are always great. The waiters...not so much. 

Quick tip: expect a 20-30 minute wait if you go around lunch time or in between 5 and 7.

This sushi place is good but not great. We got there and there were no seats at the bar and only a table for 6 they said we couldn't have. Well when another group of two came we all said we would share that table and they still wouldn't give it to us. So we waited but not too long. 
The service was good as came by frequently and kept drinks full but not very friendly just there to do their job it seemed.  
The roll options are good but not great. I like spicy options but try to stay away from tempura. Not many choices without tempura and without yum yum sauce. No options without rice.  Shared the pixie and the sexy girl were good though and the chubby was the first time I tried eel and it wasn't overwhelming and it was good. We got two others I can't remember the names, maybe the sunrise was one and i didn't like the spice of the garlic sauce. 
Good but not great as there are other places in town I would rather venture further for to have more options.

Not the best sushi I have ever eaten, but it was pretty darn good.  We went on a Saturday night and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated.  We were going to get the all you can eat special but you only get an hour to eat and after looking at their menu, we thought it would be cheaper to go the a la carte route.  I got the screaming orgasm and calamari appetizers.  Both were tasty and I loved the screaming orgasm sauce.  My husband got the salmon teriyaki, which was not the best, but not bad either.  I got the chicken teriyaki and was pretty good, not the best.  But, for food value, this place rocks.  Our entrees came with miso soup, small salad, tempura, and a small california roll!! Our bill ended up being just at $40, not too shabby if you ask me.  I will definitely return.

I love this place. The Plum wine is great, the service is awesome. It is a great price point. I can't complain about one thing. I always get the chicken teriyaki bowl, its soo good. Everyone who visits me here, from out of town. I take them there and they love it. We go to the one by South Maryland Parkway.

Amazing ! I go here all the time. The servers are great. The decor isn't the best, but who cares because the sushi is amazing. The workers are awesome. They are very accommodating to my meal modifications since I eat a little on the healthy side. The sushi is also so so inexpensive. My friends flew in from Michigan to visit me. Instead of taking them anywhere on the strip I took them here ! Its honestly such a great place.

MY all time favorite all you can eat sushi spot since I've moved to vegas!

I mean its always busy! It's open till 2am so its usually crackalackin!  Through the years I've noticed they have gotten faster with bringing out the food.  

A very famous spot amongst local hawaii peeps! People visiting from Hawaii come here.  We bring our friends here!

I have too many favorite rolls to list.  

Just get there with enough time to wait for a table = 0)

Sushi Mon is perfect for a sushi wuss like me who doesn't like to get too wild and crazy. There is a ton of variety but I like to stick to my core rolls and with All You Can Eat being $25 bucks you can get a lot.

The weekends are super busy but here's my little trick. Run over to the PT's bar across the parking lot and just call in your reservation. By the time they call your phone you'll be 2-3 beers deep and ready to put some spicy tuna inside you.

Oh and ask for the Hulk Roll, it's crazy good. Don't ask for the Shewchuk Roll... they might boot you out of there.

Me and my family eat here very often. I can say that we've filled out those AYCE cards several times over. I always get the seaweed salad as a starter because of how fresh it tastes, and then basically any bit of sushi, nigiri, and side that they offer on the AYCE menu. I then finish off with one of their desserts such as the mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, or litchi ice cream. Sometimes they are out of the strawberry mochi (which is my favorite) but I'm fine with getting their other flavors when that happens. While this place is kind of small, it is around the corner from my house so it is the one we always go to. I don't feel like the wait time for food is that bad; if you order several sushi dishes at once they bring the next out just as you finish off the last dish. Go as a group and all get the AYCE so you can share. Lastly, if you order an nigiri, don't forget to request their fresh wasabi to go with it!

I vote the next location opens in the San Gabriel Valley, California! It's painful to have to wait until a Vegas trip to fill my belly with this delicious fish (and mochi ice cream)!

The cuts of fish were above what is typical for an AYCE sushi gig. The scallop nigiri was fresh and tasty. The cut of fish simply named "white fish" was really good, too. I could eat unagi anything all day long. 

They have many rolls to experience as well. My personal favorite was the spider roll which was huge, and had the best combo of ingredients and sauces. I like that you can order half orders of rolls, so that you can try a greater variety. 

The desserts were wonderful, too! The vanilla and strawberry mochi ice cream balls were the best. The tempura ice cream ball was next best, and the green tea (wasabi-looking) ice cream came in at a close third place.

The best part about this place is all of the choices! You get to try such a variety of great-tasting different things, and even experiment with things you've never had the opportunity to try before. 

An entertainment aspect of Sushi Mon is they have some pretty awesome names for their rolls... We had many "that's what she said" comments with their creative names, especially the famed "Monster Roll". I also can't wait to try multiples of the Orgasm Roll next time! Should be a real treat! ;)
Place is not what it use to be. Wait time is very long for mediocre sushi. I would only go for the tempura ice cream. Quality in sushi has declined.

If you're going to hit up a Sushi Mon, go to the one in Henderson. I'm pretty sure this location is where they send their old fish and slow sushi chefs. I swear, I am sitting here watching this guy move as if he's underwater. Maybe he's pretending he is a fish - maybe it helps him connect to his job on a spiritual level - maybe he just took a little too much NyQuil for that pesky cold he can't kick -  I don't know. All I know is that I'm hungry and when you're sat by the bathroom you get a lot of poo smell. Double fail.
Sushi is awesome and delicious, however, seating is extremely limited. I would recommend ordering for pick up because it is always busy!!

We spent 22 dollars a person for AYCE lunch and an additional $1.75 for soft drinks. Our waiter was very understanding of my husband's shellfish allergies and even jotted down a list of safe rolls for us to enjoy. We got about 8 different half rolls, including our new favorite ecstacy. We will be back for lunch again, or maybe just to try stuff ala cart.

This place is NOT kid friendly, they state clearly at the table that you can't share food with your child and I'm sorry but my 3 year old is not going to eat enough that they should be worried. Additionally they charged is 3$ for our infant whom we know is really going to just slobber on some rice.

Aside from the fact that this was a sushi spot open late at night, it was just okay to me. None of our group was hungry enough for the AYCE sushi, but we got a few nibbles at 1am. 

The nigiri itself was very good, as were the rolls we ordered. The Japanese style diced beef steak was very dry, which was disappointing because I had high hopes for it.

Other than that, nothing really stood out to me, but I'll definitely give it another shot when we're in town.
Always a good choice to come here! Drove 598 miles from Sacramento to eat here tonight! Autyte!

My boyfriend and I didn't get the all you can eat. We just ordered 2 specialty rolls and 3 basic. The reason for the 2 star is bc the quality of the yellow tail for the yellow tail rolls were not good. It made me never want yellow tail again. The color was off and also I have never had to pull a bone out of my mouth from eating a roll until today.... a pretty large one at that. Today's experience made me not want sushi for a long time.

Fantastic!

Way away from the strip on Sahara. Seems mostly attended by locals.
Very small, can get hard to get in sometimes.
Fantastic selection of sushi to choose from, all are very fresh and well prepared.
GREAT staff. very friendly

Wait this isn't right, this is not the sushi-mon i know.
Ok so this is my first time at this particular sushi-mon location and I'm here with my sister & my dad and not in the best of moods but I'm hoping some all u can eat sushi will help fix this melancholy.

I must say compared to Sushi-mon on Marland Prky there is a completely different atmosphere. it looks nice and the place is larger but it is not the atmosphere I'm use to.  There are still chicks with pink panties hangin out of their low rise jeans but the menu and clientele are different. And there is no mochi or tempura ice cream! They do have plum ice cream but it is not a replacement for mochi and tempura ice cream however. I didn't have any edamame but my sister reports the edamame wasn't good and from the look of it I wouldn't try any either. Looks like it was left out to dry.
And I don't know if it's because of my bad mood but the sushi was not up to snuff. Even the seaweed salad was bleh.
At least I didn't have to wait long when i got here at 615p. 
Uh the service was good and I did enjoy my miso soup. 
I am going to have to come back and give them a second chance since I do have a free all you can eat card filled up. However, I must say this is the first time I decided not to stuff myself with more sushi and just leave feeling content with the amount I had eaten.

Sushi Mon has a special place in my heart. When I came to Vegas in 2005 I had never had sushi before and thus is the place I went to try it. Funny enough, it is also the first place my wife ate sushi, and back then, we didn't even know each other. Anyway, to me, this is one of my favorite places. I always get along with the chefs, they are very fast, the rolls are good, and the fish is fresh. What more could I ask? The price is pretty standard for an AYCE. You really can't go wrong here.

If you want a place with great customer service, this is not it! Usually one of my favorite places to go because a few of the chefs and servers are really friendly and it is close to my house. I have recently changed my schedule and have to go later in the evening which means longer waits to get a table. Along with this comes bad service. As it gets later the better chefs here get off and they have a bunch of new people that are not as friendly or good behind the bar. They also recently changed managers and promoted a server to that position, which is not a good change. What irritates me in particular is one waitress who usually takes over service of the sushi bar when she comes in and she would rather talk to coworkers and hide in the back then actually take care of customers. I have been a loyal customer for years and the food is always good but the service here is getting to the point where I am starting to look for another ayce sushi joint. So if you want great service this is not the place for you.
My friend's daughter became sick from the fish there.  When they tried to reach out to sushi mon about it, they ignored their calls and communication attempts.  Stay away from this place.

Ok.. this place is OK.. the fish is good and the options of rolls is good but after about 10 visits I have to say the service is consistently hit and miss and just like most other local AYCE spots the rice is overwhelming in the portions. Not bad all around though

Really? 4.5 stars and 90 reviews. Are you kidding me? Maybe it's a teeny notch up from Todai back in them days. This is exactly like the all-you-can-eat quality. If you are into sushi for the good quality of fish, rice, and presentation...this isn't the place. The rice is hard and fell apart when picking up the nigiri and the ahi poki came out in 2 seconds meaning it was pre-made sitting around. This was a bad choice and I'm sorry I messed up a lunch for my brother and mom who were out of town guests. Next time, we're going back to En Sushi. We can't go wrong there and they have great, friendly service!

For an all-you-can eat sushi bar, this place is really good. But otherwise it's just eh. Not the place to go if you are looking for a high-end sushi restaurant.  They do have a very interesting selection of rolls they have created, so if you like an all-you-can-eat place with a lot of unusual options for rolls then this is a decent choice.  Very casual, no reservations and a long wait to be seated during busy hours.
