Sushi Mon has both great value and product, the salmon and tuna tasted very fresh and the servers were quick and attentive. We sat at the bar and were attended to within the first minute (despite being mostly full) and were eating 5 minutes in. Normally I have to wait 30 minutes for a table, then another 10 minutes for an appetizer.

The selection of rolls and appetizers were varied enough, not the most eclectic I've seen but we loved almost everything we ordered, especially the Cynthia roll. Their baked mussels were pretty good as well. Didn't try the nigiri or sashimi so I can't review them but I will definitely be coming back for more.

My favorite AYCE restaurant in Vegas. I make it a goal to eat here set least once every time I visit. 

The rolls are tasty and I love that you can get 1/2 orders so you can try many different dishes and not have to waste food.  I used to always order rolls until I discovered that their nigiri is surprisingly fresh. My usual order consists of uni, sweet shrimp, shrimp head (tastes like shrimp chips and its not on the menu), yellow tail collar, 6 x super white tuna (I'm salivating just thinking about this buttery goodness), 5 x albacore (the Cajon albacore is also delicious), 4 x scallops ( giant Japanese scallops, not the dinky ones mixed in mayo), tempura ice cream, and lychee sherbert (the mochi is good too if you' re a mochi fan).

I eat like I'm preparing to hibernate for the winter. It's cheap and soooooooooooooo good. Mmm.

It's like experiencing a break-up, ate there tonight and upon entering the restaurant; I felt "off"  - something wasn't right.  The sushi chefs were wearing hats, they were new chefs, new waitstaff and later find...new owner.  

The owner, the sweet lady at the register, sold the business.  So sad!!  The food was still good, service was great but again ... it didn't feel the same anymore.

I'll still visit, I just hope that the new owners do not take away a lot of the old charm that the former owner built.

What a deal!

The place was pretty packed at 2 PM on a Sunday; our local friend said that lotsa people like Sushi Mon and it seems so from the reviews. 

We went for lunch and saw the lunch special: 2-roll combination comes with a side salad and miso soup. Our waitress was courteous and came back several times to take our order (I need pictures to decide!).  
I ended up ordering the spicy shrimp and Unagi roll. 

The food didn't come out all at the same time, but when you're busy, you're busy, and she brought the food out as soon as it was ready.

I thought they'd serve half (4 and 4) roll portions to make one roll but they actually served a 16-piece lunch.  Oh. Emm. Jee.  That was too much, but the rolls were good; soup was good (Miso generally tastes the same to me where ever), salad was fine (too much dressing for me). But it was a steal @ $8.50  :)

I would definitely return with an appetite and with or without a limited budget.  :)

I used to love this place, But lately my dining experience there have gotten worse and worse.  Sushi is sliced paper thin, the rice is hard and dry, and service is terrible..  For the money that was spent it would of been better spent for sushi at Walmart.  But a few streets away SIN CITY SUSHI (Eastern/Serene) is superb but only open til 11.  Sushi Mon R.I.P

Sushi mon is a great deal for an ayce. They have a great variety of rolls and sides that you can eat along with your sushi. I love sitting at the bar and being able to order as I go along. However, Depending on the time that you go, service can be a bit slow. They only down side to sushi mon is that uni is limited to 1 per person for the ayce.

The sushi was not all that great. The volcano roll #2 was disgusting. It was way too creamy & smelled funny. The only thing I liked was some Hawaiian roll. 

I only went there because my sister had a coupon but they didn't even honor it. 

The service was horrible. Every time my sister asked the sushi chef a question, he never acknowledged her. Nothing special about Sushi Mon. Bottom line..never coming back.

Awesome All You Can Eat Sushi!!
Traveled from Hawai'i and came to Sushi Mon for the first time with family. Decent price ($27) per person, all-you-can-eat dinner and dessert.
Although we came while it was busy, the wait to sit wasn't too bad.
The service was great, the waiters/waitresses we very attentive. The food was excellent- hands down ;)

This is hands down my favorite sushi joint in Vegas. I've been coming here for the last 8 years whenever I'm in town and have a chance.

The main menu is pretty basic -- you can get almost any kind of sushi, rolls, and side dishes you can imagine. But the best part? Their special blackboard menu for the day, where you can order (sometimes limited) uni, sweet shrimp, toro, snapper, pork belly, salmon belly, and more! And as a bonus, ayce dessert including ICE CREAM!!! For the price, it's extremely great value.

Service is always superb and efficient.

Honestly, I wish they would open one in LA; I would go almost everyday.

Sushi Mon, yum yum (AYCE)! A friend told me sushi mon in Vegas, this time we were in vegas and planned to try out this unbelievable place. 

Two of us orders the followings to share, each dish for both of us, otherwise too much 
Toro 
Sweet shrimp 
Uni 
RedSnapper
Mackeral
YellowTail
Octopus
Unagi
Tomago
Inari
Spider Roll
Salmon Skin HandRoll
Fried Oyster
Redbean ice cream
For each person 26.5

I think we save about $20 on the bill, the fish are fresh and nice cut. I will go back

Visiting Nevada and stumbled upon this spot. There was a 45 minute wait for 4 on a Sunday night at 7. We barely waited 25 minutes and it was worth it! $27 all you can eat dinner. The fried calamari was the show stealer, definitely try it. The Pixie roll was delicious and the gyozas were pan fried heaven. Ate a healthy serving of sashimi and it was all fresh and tasty. Servers were attentive and food was great! Perfect spot for our last dinner in Vegas.

Sushi Mon has the best sushi ever! ALL YOU CAN EAT!!  Literally, all you do is sit there and they serve you! You get to order however much food you want and you can just sit in your chair and get fat!

The food is so good! You must order the FRIED SHRIMP HEAD and Ahi Poke!! I love this place!

This must be the easiest, more informative review I will ever write; here we go!

All you can eat sushi + 2am close time + good quality + fair price + excellent service = Hell yeah!!

See? Easy!

If you're gonna come here...YOU HAVE TO GET A SEAT @ the SUSHI BAR. TRUST ME! The chefs are just GREAT! Order the "ALL YOU CAN EAT"  Just tell them what you don't like...and they will keep making you the most delicious rolls ever! YUM! Never been let down here before. Every time I go to Las Vegas I have to stop by Sushi Mon....*drools

Bad management, Bad Service! They advertise a special for 10.00 but when we got there they told us they weren't honoring that deal any more because too many people showed up!! Ummm not my problem. Instead of offering an apology for the wasted gas and time,they rudely just said no more. Don't bother going here.

http://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/dirty-dining-sushi-mon 
 *Look up Sushi Mon dirty dining!
Not only is the quality of sushi not fresh its sub par. The people making it weren't even Asian, I thought they were gonna bring me out an enchilada roll and horchata. What the hell????? I left feeling robbed of my $33.70 I spent on dinner AYCE. Came home to tell my mother the horror story of poor quality sushi only to be informed further more that sushi mon was on dirty dining. I'll go throw up now...
I WILL NEVER BE RETURNING EVER AGAIN IN LIFE!!!
Good sushi. Fast service even when busy.

It's just A-Right, over-priced for what you get. I'd still rather go to Yama Sushi down the road. http://www.yelp.com/biz/yama-sushi-las-vegas 
Cheaper and better quality!

The names on the menu is not as cool! You know that's really important, Being cool! especially in vegas! The rice on the sushi was cold and hard, not sure what that's all about. The fish was ok, nothing spetacular. The best one on the menu was the Salmon Sushi, you have to get that!

$22.95 for lunch is a bit steep for what I got...

This place was the #1 for AYCE Sushi until they failed their Inspection. To those that still eat here, I give you 5 stars for a good stomach. http://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/dirty-dining-sushi-mon

The sushi here tastes really fresh especially for a all-you-can eat sushi place.  The prices are the same as anywhere else.  The service is pretty good too.   I really like the cucumber salads here.  There's just one problem, it's so popular at this location, and the building is so small that there is a long wait line many of the times which can be a burden.  Sometimes the wait isn't worth it, but I do think this is the best all-you-can eat sushi place around this area.

I love the all you can eat sushi here. Word of advice know your limits and once you do order all at once, because sometimes the waiters tend to "forget" about you. All around I love this place and go at least once every 2 weeks. O yeah don't forget to leave room for the tempura ice cream its amazing.

UGH. BEST AYCE SUSHI I'VE EVER HAD!!!!

RIDICULOUSLY good sushi.  Best part is, EVERYTHING on their menu is AYCE.  for 1 easy payment of $27.  I easily ate more than that.  I don't want to keep rambling on with how amazing the food is, but they have so much variety, that I don't see how someone could dislike this.  

O btw, they're open til 1AM (well technically 2, but stop seating at 1).

O. O. AND they have dessert as a part of their AYCE...

This is an all you can eat place, it's a little small thus doesn't have the largest waiting area. We waited outside a bit for a table, they were nice enough to bring us water as it was so hot outside. Once seated we ate a lot of food. I usually stick to nigiri, salads, and cooked dishes. The quality of the fish was okay, not as good as some other places. I did like the poki and seafood salads. My friends liked the rolls and tempura. Service was good, but as with all other ayce places, food is also forgotten. Maybe places do this on purpose if they think you've had enough. Anyway, great options on dessert, I like the option of having ice cream Mochi.

Omg this is the place to get your sushi fixing, lunch is $21 and you get anything on the menu, u just have to make sure to eat all. Unlimited supply of sushi and desserts! It's so good that my stomach was about to burst! This has been a the best sushi experience I have ever had by far. I walked in hungry and walked out happy! Great job sushi mon for satisfying my craving!

There are so many places to choose an all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas/Henderson...the best I have tried so far has been Sushi-Mon!  

Every time my family members visit Vegas, that have to get a fix of Sushi Mon.  

Why is it that they crave this particular restaurant?  

*their awesome and fresh quality?
*their quick service and friendly staff? 
*their myriad selection of delicious sushi combination and original master pieces? 
*great price?
*not only do you get to choose from a extended selection of delicious sushi, you also have the option of ordering appetizers including gyoza, seasame chicken, miso soup, shrimp and vegetable tempura, hamachi kama...do I need to say more?  

What I love about this place also is that the sushi to rice ratio is just right!  (meaning they are not cheap and do not overload their sushi rolls with rice) haha.  

One of my pet-peeves regarding sushi is the rice quality and boy does Sushi Mon meet my standards.  

My opinion, check this place out!  

Don't forget to save room for dessert! =)

Yum, I love Sushi Mon!!

Sushi Mon is definitely the best 'all you can eat' sushi restaurant!  I came here for dinner with a group of friends, and we all decided to enjoy the sushi buffet for $26.95/person. 

We ordered some rolls as soon as we sat down.  The rolls came out within 5 minutes, which is really fast.  Everything tasted fresh and really delicious.  I love how there isn't a lot of rice on the sushi, too.  Its great that we can order half rolls, so we got to try more items.

My favorites were the following:
1. Grilled Yellowtail Collar - the fish was cooked to perfection.  The fish fell off the bone and it was juicy.  I really liked the dipping sauce which gave it more flavor.

2. Seaweed salad - tasty

3. Lychee Sherbet - I've never had this before, but it was really good.  The sherbet tasted like lychee, and it wasn't too sweet.

4. Spider roll - The roll was pretty big, and the soft shell crab was good.

Overall, service was great.  Even though it may be a bit pricey, its definitely worth it!  I can't wait to come back when I'm in Vegas again.

My husband has been coming here for years on his yearly visit to SEMA. I'm glad I finally got to try it. I was amazed at the service and quality of the food. If you are a sushi lover All you can eat sushi is the way to go . Although I would have preferred sashimi I settled for nigiri . I definitely over stuffed myself but it was so worth it.

We've been here a few times and Arturo is great with recommendations. I would give them 5 stars, but in the evenings the wait time can be pretty long and that can be a pain but they're good at calling when tables are ready and the staff are friendly.
Tip - I love the Cajun albacore best! It has a lemon hint to it and it's delicious!

I don't think I'll be going back here again. The food was SO bad. I was practically forcing myself to eat. I ordered 2 dishes and couldn't take anymore. My friend, who I apologized to multiple times afterwards for agreeing to eat here with me, kept getting evil stares from the waiters and chefs. I could tell they didn't like him because they would ignore him or never give him respectful eye contact when talking, but would turn around and smile brightly at me and give me almost flirtatious looks. Creeped me out!

Got the AYCE sushi for dinner which was $26.95 per person. Sushi quality and selection were both excellent. Our order came fairly quickly during the 1st round but lagged a bit afterwards. Unlike other sushi places where all the sushi rolls taste more or less the same, the rolls here maintain their individuality. 

Get the mochi ice cream
Get the mochi ice cream

They  have something called orgasm sauce. I'm not really sure what it is but it will probably blow your dirty dirty mind. 

Had to dock a star for speed and one of the waiters accidentally spilled soy sauce on my friend's pants. They gave us wet wipes though. =)

my favorites: 
- white tuna
- fresh scallops
- salmon belly

consistently great quality!

My favorite thing about this place is the rice to fish ratio! Some AYCE sushi places put so much rice in their sushi that you get full super fast! Here, you'll be able to try more sushi in one sitting cus you won't be as full after several orders of nigiri or a couple rolls. Also, you can do half rolls so you don't have to worry about finishing it all unless you're with a big party.

Besides the rice to fish ratio, they have a wide variety of appetizers, sushi and dessert; great service & sushi chefs; plenty parking; but limited seating. We arrived around 9pm and was able to get bar seating right away. 

For all you garlic lovers... the garlic edamame is a must try!!

Overall, everything tasted great and satisfied by AYCE sushi on a Saturday night.
Staff was great. The all you can eat is the way to go! You must try the hamachi collar and savor the moment because you are only allowed one.

Way way worth the price. Honestly the fish quality was middle of the road. Not bad, not great but lets be real. If you want to stuff your face for 27 bucks it dont get much better! The green mussels were excellent and the udon soup was delicious!

Was here last night. One of, if not my favorite sushi place in town. Friendly staff who helps you if you don't what what fish is what. With a great selection of rolls, including the Spider and the Dragon. The sake wasn't my favorite, but overall a great place.

Will not eat here ever again! Had a very bad experience here because of the server Jeffrey. Very disrespectful!! If you do plan to eat here request not to have the server Jefferey. And to the manager of this place please talk to Jeffrey and teach him how to provide good customer service. If he has a problem with the customers be PROFESSIONAL and not to show some attitude especially  use of foul language to paying customers. Definitely not a place you want eat at. Had the worst service, food was NOT even good and Manager is not available when needed.

Been coming here for years. Sometimes the sewer smell inside is really bad. I have not been there in a while so maybe they fixed the issue they had. I would almost do take out all the time. It's not the best sushi but not the worst. 

I usually get the lunch specials if I'm working near by.

Wow, first of all, I'm from Socal and I didn't expect to find a gem of a sushi joint like this in vegas.

Didn't feel like paying big bucks for overrated pricey sushi joints on the strip, so we decided to hit this place up as a recommendation from a friend.

I was blown away by how many items they had on their AYCE menu. Suppppper thrilled to order every single item possible to try.

Their nigiri was superb because the fish was really fresh and sweet. The best has to be the white tuna! The sweet shrimp and uni definitely had to be my favorite, and it sucked that you can only order it once.

All their rolls were very unique and each one satisfied my tastebuds. The best part was that they allowed half orders on the rolls, so you can try more!

The icing on the cake was the selection of ice cream at the end. From tempura, to mochi, to red bean... It was heaven

Can't wait to come back to Vegas in 2 weeks and hit up this spot again. BEST AYCE sushi I've ever had, and that's coming a lot from someone who's had multiple hot spots in socal. 

THUMBS WAY UP

So yummy! Had a dinner date with my girls and we so amazing. You definitely need to get there early they are really busy around dinner time! The conch was delish! Ayce is a must then you can try a bit of everything! They also do half rolls which makes it easier to taste everything. The strawberry saki was very good as well! Will definitely be coming here again!!

Since last been there 3 years ago, the management has changed and the food was no longer as good. The establishment had been expanded and added a sushi island and the all your can eat price is cut in half. However, if the food quality and selection went down by half, I don't know why I would take that extra time to go away from the Strip just to visit this place.

This had been my all time favorite in the past and this time, it let me down big time. I will no longer be visiting this restaurant. I miss the meal I had in 2011.

Who would have thought that Las Vegas can have super fresh seafood. Sushi mon is definitely ranked tip top in the list of sushi places to go. Food is made fresh to order. Even though there is limit on the pricey items such as uni and fish collar, but try to eat everything on the menu. That'd be a challenge. And just for fun, order the monster roll. It is huge. Try stuffing down one of those at the end of your meal. Overall, super delicious.

Food was acceptable but the service was not.  I've had better sushi here in Vegas, from a few places, but everyone raves about sushi mon.  I thought the menu was rather inspirational and the rolls were just so-so.  Hopefully, if I ever go back, they will have been brave enough to think a little outside the box.
The fish was fresh and the service was excellent. This was not my first time here but my first checkin with Yelp.

I love this tiny place!
Far away from the strip, but located in a strip mall, this is a veritable treasure in the city of sin.  
Any time of day, for $25.95 per person, you can eat all you want - anything you want - on the menu.  Though there is a sixty minute time limit, I have never been kicked out after an hour.  However, after eating sushi for an hour you are done!
Especially after eating their deep fried or monster rolls, you won't have much room left.
I advise sitting at the sushi bar.  You can tell the sushi chef directly what you want, you can have half orders of almost all the rolls, so you can sample a wide variety.
Here is a sample of what I ordered on my recent visit, just to give you an idea:
Dynamite (scallops baked with mushrooms and onion, a creamy mayo sauce, into a scallop shell) 5.25
Baked Green Mussels 5.95
Cajun Albacore Sushi (this is my favorite) 4.00
Salmon Sushi 3.50
Seared Tuna 4.00
Salmon Roe 3.75
1/2 order of Mingus Roll (deep fried spicy tuna, cream cheese, and avocado) 4.25
Pixie Roll (deep fried sot shell crab, spicy yum-yum shrimp and cucumber, avocade, wrapped with soybean paper and topped with smelt eggs) 10.75
J.J. Roll (crab stick tempura, cream cheese, avocado, asparagus, topped with eel sauce) 
Of course I sampled my friend's dishes as well, and they were all delicious.  Though only the sushi is all you can eat, there is still an extensive Japanase cuisine menu, from which to sample.
Drinks are not included in the all you can eat, but the desert is also included. I love the green tea ice cream and the plum sorbet.
Curious about the 50 rolls they have? Go to the website for their complete menu and photos and descriptions of all the rolls.

My husband and I have been coming here for years.. Really loved this place for all you can eat sushi. It only takes one bad experience to run off good customers!! They have a sign as soon as you walk in that if all your party is not present, that seat will be given to next customers.. So was not the case today.. As they left 2 open seats empty for 15 minutes to wait for another person to join a party at sushi bar as other people were waiting for seats. When I asked employee for a manager, she paused for a few seconds and said that they were not available!! One star because I really liked the variety; but we ended finding something better and less expensive without all the "rules" and "time limit"!!

I like this location much better than other.. It can get pretty busy at times.. You give them your phone number and it gives you updates of the wait time.. The staff here is very nice and prompt. I love the tempura ice cream!!

We had never been to this Sushi-Mon location, but it's our friends favorite and right down the street from their home, so we said 'why not?' 

We sat at the large table just inside the door, it seats six, and that was the size of our party. We spent almost an hour in the restaurant, all ordering AYCE, and were only able to order twice. Once upon arrival, and once for dessert. What a sham. We kept trying to flag down the waiter (this place is tiny, so there shouldn't have been an issue) and he was just too busy for us, apparently. We requested a hot tea refill 3 separate times to no avail. The nigiri that I was able to get to the table was great, fresh scallop had a pine flavor to it - strange. Our friends had many rolls - they ordered everything they wanted in the first order, and asked later on why we ordered so little. We explained that with AYCE, you're supposed to order little by little so you don't over-order. They have clearly eaten here so often that they knew you only really had one solid chance of getting your order in. Sad. 

We won't be back to this locaton. We'll stick with the other Sushi-Mon and Goye-mon along with other faves in the valley.

The fish here is fresh! Me and my sister do the sushi & sashimi dinner. It's $25. Not too bad. For AYCE is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. We'll try it next time. I gave them three stars because of the location and set up. We got sat right by the door. There is no waiting area. So people's butts are right near your food! Request one away from the door. But, there's not many tables so you'll have to wait. The service isn't too bad. Not the friendliest but attentive to your needs.

Mediocre sushi. House salad is extremely salty, teriyaki chicken is dry, and the sushi doesn't "WOW" me. A plus side is that their lunch specials are great sized portions for not so great sized prices, but you compromise with the quality. Sashimi doesn't appear to be fresh. Potato salad tastes like nothing... is it supposed to be a palate cleanser? Tempura tastes fine, but the onion is impossible to eat and the sauce is extremely salty, overpowering the tempura. Staff is nice, we got free oranges. yay.

I've come here twice, once with my s/o and the other with my cousin. When I sat Bar side the orders were made very promptly! The fish was absolutely terrific and it none of the items seem overloaded with rice. Staff is polite and quick to check on us, the sushi chefs are great jokesters! Tricked my cousin into eating a piece of the 911 with me, the chefs gave him some cream cheese on the house to cool his mouth...and jokingly asked if he'd like the habanero sauce with it  

I would urge to order the uni, however when I dined with my s/o i believe I came across a bad batch. We ate the exact same items, save for the uni and I ended up becoming ill and blowing chunks once we arrived home 

Other than that experience I love the place and would come again for sure! I wouldn't blame the staff over that incident.

For ayce sushi, this was a very excellent experience.  I tried to order a lot of different nigiri and determined my favorites were negi toro, barracuda, and ikura.  All the others were good but the negi toro really stood out.

I'll keep this one short.  I've been there once, but never again.

Pros:  All you can eat menu
            Open late

Cons:  Rubbery, old fish even on the day they supposedly get deliveries
             Service is horrible unless you are friends with the waitress
             It's tiny for being so packed all the time....the wait time is bad.
             My boyfriend saw mice and their babies fighting and running from under the sushi bar into the bathroom


Enough said.

Great spot for all-you-can-eat sushi!  They don't skimp on the list of nigiri your can order, and I'm always happy to get some yellowtail and unagi as part of my AYCE.  Also, they give you one delicious sake drink and a few other higher priced sushi items as part of the package.  I especially like that this place is open until 2am.  I just wish they didn't raise the dinner price to $25.95 recently.  It's getting expensive!

Still my favorite all you can eat sushi bar. Went there last Sat and we were the only customers at the sushi bar at 2pm. Chef Jilson served us with nicely cut fresh sushi. Some photos are uploaded. Lunch is $21.95 + tax per person which is reasonable for the quality of fish they serve. Thanks! And I added 20% tips for the excellent experience.

This place is my favorite sushi restaurant and has amazing food and service. The staff is super nice and it's all you can eat sushi!!! That is amazing and plus the place is super nice. I love coming here and will be returning almost once a week. You should try it out if you love sushi!!!!!

If there is anything less than 1 star I would have click it.  My first time entering a review as this place has the WORST (when I say worst I CAP on it) management ever.  The manager at the front desk has the worst service as it was a cold night out we had kids with us and he rejected us a seat stating we could go somewhere else if we cant wait.  It took us 60 dollars in taxi fee to get there to try it out and he told us we could go somewhere else if we dont want to wait for him to feel the mood to let us in.  The night was busy but he was letting in 2 to 3 people but not reserving table for us.  STAY AWAY!
Love this place!! Anytime I wanna just get away and get myself a nice meal this is my go too!! Food is always great and great customer service. And fast. Also very fresh

It was my birthday and I wanted Sushi. I had come here once years ago and didnt really remember the experiance but I figured if I didnt remember anything bad, then I must have enjoyed myself. I was not disappointed. Let me say that every selecion I made was delicious. The staff answered any question my wife or I had. The food came quick and the staff was attentive to our needs. Now for the best part. Due to the fact that it was my birthday (I let the waitress know) when my icecream dessert was served, it had a candle on it and a chorus of happy birthday began. If that wasnt enough as we were about to leave my waitress asked what size I wore, and she presented me with a shirt for my birthday! What a way to finish the evening. I shall return.

Been here twice, first time was not too bad, second time for dinner was not that great, maybe it was a off day. Sushi not bad, service is not bad too, so you can get your sushi fix here. This is 100X better then Sushi Yama, which serves spoiled sushi. Go here instead if you want AYCE.

This place was so crowded! We went on a tuesday night and it was absolutely packed, not just at the bar but at all the tables as well. My wife and I decided to give this place a try since it is just down the street of our new apartment and we were hoping it would make for a good alternative to our usual sushi place, Yama. Afterwards we decided it was an OK place, but the extra drive to Yama was worth it for the better quality food. 



Ok, so the good parts first I think... first, all you can drink soda was a plus, most sushi places will just give you a can of soda but this place gave nice big glasses. Servers were also very quick on the refills, and since I can down a glass of soda or water very quickly during a meal I kept out waiters busy, lol.

We both got the AYCE at the sushi bar and once we got the attention of our sushi chef started ordering. Most of the food was OK, the baked green mussels were about average while the garlic albacore was delicious. My wife absolutely loved their special "Sushi Bon" dish, one of their new specials. For dessert my wife and I also recommend the lychee sorbet, very tasty. Sadly this just about ends the positive portion of this review.

Ok, now for the problems. Other than the refills, service was slow as hell here. It took the chef about 20 minutes per item, longer if it was baked. At first I thought it was just because of the crowd, but even once it started emptying in the restaurant it remained painfully slow. This is despite the large number of sushi chefs on duty at the time as well! 

As for the majority of the sushi itself it was nothing all the great. We tried a number of different items and found most of them to be a bit bland. Also, they all seemed to be variations of the same thing (and not a good thing at that). Presentation was a bit lacking as well, nearly every dish we had looked rushed and fell apart while we were trying to eat it. They had an item which was a variation of a dynamite roll that we ordered, it looked like they had skimped on the toppings, then when we went to eat it the thing turned to mush before we could take a bite. Most of the food was like this, either it fell apart or didn't seem to be cooked right or something just wasn't right. Really a let down for the evening. 

All in all it was an OK experience, the plain sushi was yummy and I enjoyed a small number of the rolls, but the bulk of it was just not what I would consider quality sushi. How it got this busy and such a good rating is a mystery to me. But they do have a huge selection and if you are willing to brave some of the more interesting rolls then give it at least one try, you might find it is more to your tastes than my own.

I use to visit weekly. 

Average Sushi, poor service, and inconsistent quality. 

Do not recommend visiting on the weekends. Wait time is not worth it.

Lots of choices and the sushi was fresh...nothing like the conveyor belt type.  Service was fast once your seated, but if arriving during peak dinner hours, expect a wait as the dining area isn't a huge space.  Definitely would come back again if visiting Vegas.  Beware...the 911 roll is hella hot.

What's that? All you can eat sushi? SIGN ME UP. Coming from Rhode Island, then living in San Diego for years, of course I was hesitant about sushi in a desert. WRONG. It was absolutely AMAZING. Being the little adventurer I am, I of course ordered the usual favorites, but then started venturing off and trying things I wouldn't have tried in a million years. Was not disappointed by a single. one. absolutely stellar food.

I love the all you can sushi here! I stop by this place every time I go to Vegas. 

The sashimi is pretty fresh and you get two orders of uni and sweet shrimp included in the all you can eat too!! (I wish they allowed more..) They have a huge selection, ranging from nigiri, sushi rolls, hand rolls, to cooked food like yakitori and dynamite (which i looove but don't recommend for all you can eat because it's very filling and prevents you from eating more sushi and sashimi).

One of my favorite sashimi is salmon, and since it is not one of the limited quantity ones, I tend to order a lot of it. But what I've noticed is that, the first order is always REALLY FATTY and tasty, but as you order more and more, it just gets less and less fatty, to the point where the taste of salmon is gone. I don't know why that happens, but I have noticed that every time I've been there (about 5+ times).

In the end, I still go to this place every time I go to Vegas because it's just such a good deal and it's good quality sushi for the price you pay. Good variety, fresh sushi, great price, can't go wrong with that.

I came here with 4 friends after hiking at Red Rock Canyon and we were all really hungry.  4 of us ordered the AYCE and 1 ordered off the menu.  I have not had much experience with AYCE sushi--I've only been to one other sushi place for AYCE.  

We placed quite a few orders of various Nigiri sushi with some extra things like miso soup, shrimp tempura, and a few other things (I got a 4 piece Mexican roll).  The fish was fresh and tasty.  

Service was good.  There was a misstep or two when something ordered was not brought but given the amount we ordered, I guess I could expect this.  

My biggest issue with the place is that it is so small.  5 people at one table and with all the plates that were brought meant that our table was quite crowded.  This made for good conversation and sharing of what had been ordered, but I was amazed I didn't elbow one of my dining companions during the meal.

There is a 45 minute time limit for lunch and an hour for dinner but the way we scarfed everything down, we almost had time to spare although we weren't watching the time and I don't think they were either.

The red bean ice cream for dessert was very good.  I wish they had mochi on the AYCE menu.  Rather, they just had three ice cream flavors.

I will come back and sit at the sushi bar--my wife is a hater of fish (raw or otherwise)--and I'll do the AYCE.  Maybe I'll go slower and really enjoy the meal.

My boyfriend and I were in the mood of all you can eat sushi dinner experience. We absolutely love this place.Talk about Fantastic food all worth for $28.00  for dinner price. The quality, the presentation, was far from expectation. We tried tems that we haven't tasted in any AYCE place.

Must try on our list: 
Calamari just burst of flavor

Mahalo Roll: If you like Spam you won't be disappointed, order the Tuna POKI and you feel like you back in Hawaii.

Finish the meal with Tempura Mochi ice cream and Call it a Night!!! Can we say "Carry me Out Service"

Whenever I get the sushi bug, this is where I go. 

Let's face it. Sushi is expensive.  $2 or 3 per piece is a bit spendy IMO, but hey, that's pretty much average cost for nigiri.  And I am a hungry boy.  I am there to taste the fish, so I generally don't order rolls, much less dip my fish bits in soy sauce.  That said, I usually do all you can eat ($28-30 dinner, 1 hour), and for that price I think the quality of the fish is quite good.  

For starters, I usually get about ten pieces yellowtail (which is my fave and always good here) and 6-8 pieces garlic tuna (also snacktastic!)  That alone pays for the AYCE.   Other faves are tamago, the grilled eel (unagi), and salmon.  

They also have a nice variety of sides included on the menu, and I usually get at least  three or four things including shrimp tempura, gyoza, miso soup and sometimes a seaweed salad or ahi poki.  

To satisfy my sweet tooth, I get a green tea ice cream and a lychee sherbet, because honestly, why make tough decisions when I can have it both ways!  Sometimes a mochi too.

When I finally put the sticks down I've generally put away about $80 worth of food.  Cuz that's how I roll.  (Get it, ha!)  Not bad for $30...

I always sit at the bar and the chefs are attentive and speedy.  The waitresses, even though they are focused on waiting tables, are usually pretty good about getting your drinks, side orders, and clearing empty dishes.  

The place is kinda small, little decor and you may wait a bit on the weekends

If you are looking for the BEST sushi in town, this probably isn't the place for you.  If you need a fish fix and want to save a few clams (another ha!) I say charge it.

Deeeelicious sushiiiii!!! Of course get the all you can eat and order half rolls of everything...the sushi chefs will make you amaziiing rolls. Super friendly staff. Fast service. I'll have to go back so i can recommend the ones i loved :)
This is places all you can eat is out of this world! great service and open late. Quality food as well!!!

Can't go wrong with Sushi Mon.  All-you-can-eat is winning.  I cannot believe that uni is unlimited!  The quality of the fish blows my mind--am I seriously eating this in the middle of the desert?!  the increasing prices make me apprehensive, and worried.  For this little restaurant, there are way too many servers, which might be why the price keeps going up.
Make sure you eat all your food (or try to at least be incognito in your method of disposing your rice) because they will charge you ala carte prices if not.  **Order half portions if you think you cannot handle!
My faves: 
Nigiri - Uni, hamachi, salmon
Special rolls - Athena (spicy hamachi, cucumber & avocado wrapped in shrimp), No Name (spicy tuna & asparagus, wrapped in hamachi), Dragon (California roll wrapped in unagi w/ unagi sauce drizzle)
Sides - Grilled hamachi collar, dynamite!, baked mussels, ahi poki (reminiscent of Hawaii)
And my all-time favorite... Quail egg shooter.  A shot glass filled with hot sauces, quail egg, and tobiko (fish eggs).  Mmm!
Try to get out of your element and try new things here at Sushi mon, because if you do this at another restaurant you will have to pay per plate.

Considering this is location is now a member of the Mon Restaurant Group, I guess it would be easiest to compare this place to Goyemon.

Not as many choices as Goyemon. Appetizer items such as kama, gyoza, yakitori, and even takoyaki. But you won't find any udon or ramen, grilled pork, spicy tuna on rice crackers, etc. There is a blackboard with daily special however.

The quality of the fish is similar to Goyemon or any other AYCE sushi restaurant, not Sushi Dai, but definitely not shark chum. The service was above average, but sometimes the chefs were a little distracted with the tv or chatting with each other.

I guess you can describe this Sushi Mon as "Goyemon-lite" or a little brother to Goyemon. It is a solid AYCE sushi addition to the west side of the valley for anyone who doesn't want to drive all the way to Sushi Mon's "older brother."

I would give this place 5 stars.....ONLY if they were a little bit easy on the hawk style watch over you when you eat "all you can eat" menu with people who are eating a la carte.

They literally watch you like a hawk and no one likes to be watched like that when they're eating.  I have witnessed a really bad scene once where a man stated he was too embarrassed to finish his meal because of they way they were watching him and accussing him of sharing his all you can eat menu with his family.  It was ridiculous on both Sushi Mon's part and the mans part.  

But all in all, all you can eat sushi..is bomb.  Their sushi tastes fresh and they have an awesome side menu to order things like seaweed salad, miso soup, tempura shrimp, yellowtail collar, baked mussels, beef teriyaki, and shumai which is all also all you can eat.  This is the place to go when you are hungry and its open pretty late.  Last call is at 1:30am.  Price is about $27 per person.  To me...good deal because I can eat way more sushi over that price.  

Plus you have all you can eat dessert ;) green tea ice cream, mochi balls, red bean ice cream.....man.  Whats not to love?

They even have those stamp cards for frequent customers.  Free 11th all you can eat meal.  HOLLA!

One of the best AYCE sushi meals I've ever had, and it is the first & only AYCE sushi bar I've sat at where the food would come out faster than I can order.
Their ayce menu consists of a bunch of nigiri sushi, special rolls, and some appetizers/side dishes. 
The gf & I ordered mainly the nigiri: Yellow tail, Salmon/seared salmon, and Albacore/Cajun albacore. The shrimp tempura was really good too.
Although their nigiri pieces were sometimes small, I was never unhappy about the fish to rice ratio. It also didn't matter if the pieces were sometimes smaller - we sat at the bar and whenever we wanted to order something we just yelled it out, like "3 more salmon!" and in less than a minute the chef would hand us the plate of our order.
Usually at any decent or good ayce sushi bar, you gotta wait a good amount of time in between orders, plus you're given a limit on the amount you can order at a time, and sometimes they even pack on the rice to try to get their customers full. Sushi Mon doesn't do this. They say that they give you a 60 minute time limit which sounds not cool at first, but when you are constantly handed plate after plate of whatever you order, I guarantee you'll be full within half an hour. At the end of our meal my gf & I had a 15+ stack of empty plates in front of us, I'll post a picture of this soon. Highly recommended you sit at the bar.
A good 20 minute drive off the strip, but totally worth it for a very satisfying meal with friendly and attentive servers & chefs.

Notes:
*They don't put a full wad of wasabi like authentic Japanese sushi bars, but they do put a little smudge in there. I loved that they did this, since most American Japanese sushi bars don't make their nigiri with wasabi in it. My gf didn't like this, so she requested that they don't put any wasabi in the nigiri sushi and the chefs gladly did this for her.
**There is another Sushi Mon more south of the Strip. We asked a chef if this Sushi Mon and the other were acquainted and learned that they once were, but not anymore.

When it comes to ayce this place is ok but they did have toro and uni which was great and really fresh a+ for that.  We sat at a table and service was great till it started filling up waited for 20 minutes for my last order and didn't feel like waiting any longer so we paid and left but hey that can happen at any one of these places.  If I would have got my last order I'd give them another star.  

The sushi was fresh and all but my last order was correct and timely doesn't always happen at tables.  Good selection of nigiri I've seen the special rolls at most places now.  Nothing seemed to set them a part from any other place but they 5 minutes from my house will I be back probably.

Toro!  One of the few places to publicly tell people they have this item on their menu.  Most places would hide the fact they have fatty tuna.  

I wouldn't call Sushi Mon the best sushi place out there but it is certainly top 5 in Las Vegas.  Not only for the quality of food, attention to service, but the hours!  I would hope they have everything I listed above because the prices pinch the wallet.  I don't care too much for special rolls, I've always been the rice on the bottom and fish straight up on top type of person.  And the quality of fish they serve here is fresh and good.  I had one bad experience with their uni but they replaced it with the quickness.  

If I do order special rolls, I usually order half rolls if available just so I can try other special rolls without getting full too fast.

Sushi Mon is my all time favorite sushi restaurant!!!  Despite there's always a wait around dinner time, the sushi is fresh and they have the best tempura ice cream.  I'd recommend to get the all-you-can-eat to take advantage of all of the appetizers, sushi and dessert.  Trust me, you have a lot to choose from!

Sushimon has always been the go-to spot for sushi. The sushi rolls are always good but what I really love about this place is that their Nigiris are amazing for AYCE. I have been to many sushi restaurants, and most of the time the nigiris are gross, but Sushimon gets them right! They make their rice really small and the piece of fish large, so you're not overwhelmed with the sushi rice. The service isn't always the greatest and they do have ups and downs when it comes to the fish or sushi chef, but sushimon for me is the best place to come for AYCE.
5 stars for the sushi which my girlfriend loved.  3 stars for the limited selections of food for the non fish eating people.

Has something changed?
I was a huge fan of Sushi Mon when I lived a mile away...going at least once a week for their superb sushi.  
When I recently flew in to town from my new home in Salt Lake City, I called in from the airport for a large take-out order due to my craving for some great sushi.
I didn't recognize the food anymore.  The fish was different...muted colors, strange unrecognizable cuts in my sashimi, much thiner portions too.
Not sure if I will try it again...I was quite disappointed that an old favorite let me down.

the service here was above and beyond. our waitress was very friendly and offered us some good suggestions based off of our initial order. she came by frequently to see if we wanted to add more food to our order. food came out fast even though they were busy. other waitresses came by and topped off our drinks. this place would have been a perfect 5star if the price was a tad bit lower and if all the fish came out fresh. get the plum ice cream, stay away from the over creamy green tea.

Summary: Disappointed

Cons:

-Probably the worst fish to rice ratio at an ayce sushi place I have been too. I have been to almost all of the ayce sushi place in orange county and only a handful of ayce sushi places in LA, but I have never seen a worse rice to rise ratio for both the nigri pieces and the rolls. Actually some of the rolls were ridiculous large, especially the 5 piece rolls. The biggest rolls I have ever seen. When the menu states that you will be charge for extra rice, and then the rolls comes out a gigantic and filled with rice. Should have taken a picture of this. 

-Service. Our server was new, but overall very nice and did the best he can. We asked him if we can get a spider hand roll and he wasn't sure. My biggest gripe is that we have a kid. Most AYCE places have a different price for kids. He failed to mention this. A kid that is 8 years old should not be charge the same price as an adult, if everybody is charged the same price the restaurant should let customers know. 

-From the rice to fish ratio, to not disclosing the price difference, can't help but feel a bit of disingenuous on part of the owner. At the very least it is a lack of disclosing information that could easily enhanced a customer's experience. 

Pros: The freshness and quality of the fish is above average in comparison to most of the ayce places I have been to. Too bad you only get to get a thin slice/small piece of it. If it wasn't for the quality of the fish, this place would really get one star.

Who doesn't love this place?!?!? It's amazing! A vegas gem my only complaint they need more of them I don't live on this side of town anymore :( put one in the southwest PLEASE:) if you haven't been here go now and your welcome :)

I come here all the time. It's my go to place, very affordable and very clean. The bathrooms are awesome as well. Food there is Grade A and some of the best sushi I've ever had. The chefs there are so nice and friendly, there's an older Japanese man who is just the cutest! And he always makes my rolls perfect. 10/10 always. The staff is also very friendly and helpful with every question I have.

All-You-Can-Eat & High Quality Sushi are normally two things that I wouldn't associate together. Until now. Their full menu is available for the AYCE price, and it's a very wide menu. The rolls and cuts are made to order and the fish was very fresh. I love that you can order half-rolls so you can try lots of different ones. I had my doubts as to how good this place would be after my friends had talked it up so much, but I was not disappointed. I must've tried at least 9 different types of rolls, a couple of handrolls, tuna poki and we finished off with a refreshing lychee sorbet that cleaned the palate wonderfully. 

Service was definitely on top of it and the sushi chefs behind the counter seemed very enthusiastic and were having fun being there. The place isn't very big, so even full, all of our food came out very quickly and our table waiter came back frequently to find out our next orders. It took some effort to control myself from ordering everything on the menu, but I believe my heart appreciated it. 

I think a return to Sushimon will be a must for my next trip to Vegas.
Terrible service. They said last call was at 1:30. Drove 20 minutes to get to the location and got there by 1:30 and they refused to give me service! Never coming here again.

I've been going to Sushi Mon ever since they opened and honestly it is my favorite sushi place! I never want to go anywhere else if my friends say lets get sushi I always tell them I won't go unless it is Sushi Mon!

I love sushi and I love trying new places so when I was trying to figure out where to meet a friend for lunch, I went right to Yelp to find a new place that would be in a good location for both of us. Between the 4 out of 5 star rating, and remembering that I had heard good th8ings about Sushi Mon, we decided to meet there for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. 

Most of the tables were full when we arrived so we decided to sit at the bar. After a quick glance at the menu it was clear that AYCE would be the best way for us to go so we started out with some edamame, miso soup for my friend and drinks while we decided on a few rolls. 

I love that they offer 1/2 rolls, it allows me to try things that look yummy but I am not sure about. I also love that ACYE included nigiri sushi, and the fish was nice and thick and tasted very fresh. We started with an order of tuna, salmon and yellowtail to start and ended up having seconds and then thirds of the tuna as it was just delicious. 

As for rolls, we started with 1/2 orders of Caterpillar and Philadelphia rolls. These are my basics that I almost always order, and Sushi Mon did them well. We also had the Frying Jason roll which was a baked  roll that had scallops and yum yum sauce. A little heavy on the sauce but I would certainly order it again. We finished off with a Spider Roll because my friend wanted somethign with soft shell crab. This was made with soy paper and was large so I had a hard time eating it. This was my least favorite of the rolls we had...

The only problem I had was having to ask for water refill. Otherwise it was an extremely tasty lunch. They charge a little more for AYCE then some places but the quality of fish makes it worth it in my book... Sushi Mon is definitely on my go back ASAP list.

This is where I lost my sushi-virginity. The place that made me overcome my aversion to raw fish.  The place where most of my paychecks were spent when we lived in Vegas.  I think it's obvious: I LOVE this place.  The quality is fantastic... by far the best I've had in Vegas and in LA. Plus, they have AYCE (all-you-can-eat) for around $26.  That's pretty hard to beat. Service is friendly and quick. And they're open until 2am.... Just when I thought it couldn't get any better.
 
My favorites:
1) Miso Soup
2) Albacore tuna
3) Yellowtail
4) Super white tuna
5) Shrimp tempura
6) Tiger Roll- shrimp tempura, cucumber, avocado, spicy tuna
7) Rainbow roll- California roll wrapped in tuna, shrimp, salmon,  yellowtail, & white fish topped with smelt eggs
 
The tiger roll is a must. It's texturally balanced and has an awesome flavor combination.  The super white tuna is dressed with the most amazing ponzu sauce....  I have yet to find one that comes close. Sadly, they don't serve strawberry mochi anymore which was one of the best I've tasted. All in all, this is my favorite sushi place and I'm happy they were my first ;)

Been coming here for years prior to my yelp career.  Time to pay respects to Sushi Mon...man!

Service: You're greeted immediately upon walking in, and the sushi chefs at the bar have always been friendly. Wait staff keeps the drinks fresh every time I've sat for AYCE. The sushi chefs keep things moving and I've never had a problem with the wait.  They're moving quickly to get you full af asap so they can clear more covers with their limited seating.     

Food: The Nigiri has always been fresh and on point with a great rice ratio.  Check the specials board because it's never failed me.  Great place to find something new to try. My particular favorites have always been the salmon belly and the fresh af Uni.  Everything is good quality and a good time.

Value: $26.95 for dinner ayce sushi.  Pretty good value for getting you a lot of good quality sushi in a short amount of time.  We rock the miso soup and dessert (Ice cream, mochi, and deep fried ice cream) that comes with the ayce option.

Ambiance:  Casual decor for your typical sushi place in a strip mall area.  Not a first date sushi place but a casual date sushi place.  There's flat screens strategically placed for diners and is brightly lit.  The tables are placed rather close to each other which I don't mind but may be an issue for others.

There's limited seating and it's a hot spot.  I'd never consider going here on a friday or saturday because I'd there's going to be a wait.  It's been my sun-thur late night ayce sushi craving go to the past 7+ years.  They close at 2 am and my visits have been usually around 10 PM on a sun-thur.  Sometimes even then it's been a 15 minute wait.  The wait is worth it, and Sushi Mon is one of those great restaurants that makes it hard to move from Vegas.  I know that at 12 AM on a wednesday night, high quality sushi is only a 15 minute drive away. Thanks for providing me a solid late night weekday sushi option Sushi Mon!

This place is to die for !I recommend you do the all you can eat it's reasonable and really worth it ! I love the roll sexy girl and hurricane ! There my favorite !(: sit at the bar they make then faster you have 45 minutes for lunch in 60 minutes for dinner!
I love coming here.  I enjoy the options and that I can try whatever I want for the one flat price.

Awesome plce to get AYCE sushi if you are in Vegas and dont mind the 5 mile drive from the north strip. Believe me it is well worth it. The fish was very fresh and tasty, great service and very clean inside. I like the fact that the place is run by Japanese people who really seem to take pride in thier business. i would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves good fresh sushi and lots of it!

Man I ate at this place around 2010 2011. They had this all you can eat deal where you could basically eat all you wanted as long as you finished it and the sushi was delicious. I was hanging out in Vegas with an ex who turned out to be a total pig and  could totally knock down tons and tons of sushi and keep going . So I guess what I'm saying is I wouldn't recommend dating any women from Vegas but I definitely would recommend all you can eat sushi at this place if you are dating or engaged to a total pig like I was.

Came as soon as it opened and it was already busy. Visiting from Hawaii so this was our very first time. Service was great. It took a while to get our orders but we weren't in a rush so we didn't mind. Great quality food!!!  We did the all You can eat for lunch which is 21.95 dinner is $26.95. So we made sure we Ate it's worth. Will return next time in Vegas.
Excellent, high quality, fresh sushi. Good variety of sushi choices. Very friendly staff.

Love love love the quality sushi at SUSHIMON!! Have been won over into the sushi world by this small suburban gem!  However, since it is such a small restaurant you almost ALWAYS have to wait for a table. 
We always get AYCE because my husband loves his sushi.... Definitely worth it if you get more than 3-4 items when you eat sushi. ($28 dinner). 

My favorite Nigiri = Cajun albacore 
Favorite rolls= JJ and (basic but delicious!) 007
I love almost all of their appetizers, buuuut the green tea creme brûlée is definitely FABULOUS! 

I would give it a 5 if it wasn't for the wait time.

One of my new favorite sushi places in Vegas!! The food was amazing and the staff was very friendly! I opt for the all you can eat and what a great lunch price! Only $$21 before 4pm! I will be returning for sure!

My favorite sushi place I've eaten at in the US, basically.

I love Sushi Mon to the point where I'll leave the strip and go several miles out to this place, stuff myself with almost 60 pieces of sushi in a sitting and feel as sick as I can afterwards. Well, it happened once, at least.

There hasn't been a better place that combines all-you-can-eat sushi with quality that I've come across. The balance is great, there is no slack on the variety you can choose from. Same with the dessert. 

I write this review with some hesitation, though, since I don't want to see any of you waiting in front of me to get seated the next time I'm there!

Been here twice and do not plan to come back again. First time I came here w coworkers for an outing. Service was great but food was not all great. I went back again but this time brought my bf to get his opinion. 

The cons:
Tako and tuna poke is very bland. Miso soup barely has any tofu and the seaweed is paper thin. The takoyaki is frozen as it's quite mushy when bitten into. Had quite a lot of hand rolls and it was quite bland so I decided maybe it needs to be rolls instead but it was still bland. I noticed for basic rolls, they add a bunch of other ingredients in which, imo, ruins the taste of it. For instance, Phillip roll should only have avocado, cream cheese and salmon but they add eggs and cucumber. 

The pros:
Nigiri sushi are yummy. They actually put less rice just like at Sushi Neko. They actually have salmon and yellowtail belly which is good. Tako wasabi was pretty good too! Green mussels was flavorful. They can pretty much make all rolls into handrolls.

So all in all, both experiences weren't that great.  IF I wanted only Nigiri, then maybe I might go there.

of course i go overboard here but its worth it. my newly discovered favorite rolls are the sunrise and the moon river roll. its always good, get good service, and open just late enough if you ever get that late night hunger that fast food isnt going to cure.

i don't want them points.
because, they changed owner so now they are changed staff and owner.
i go this restaurant for 5-6years. 
and today i had so so dinner all you can eat. 
after all you can eat i just asking to manager, what's your name? because of my college project i need your name, and he was scowl his face say to me NO. and waving his hand. what make him upset? did i do something wrong?
in my opinion  manager should have their name tag on their shirt don't they?
and also manager is their restaurants face. what's wrong? don't go their you can feel with horrible service.

I've ignored this place in favor of sister restaurant Sushi House Goyemon for too long. It may be an equal or superior experience.

Sushi Mon on Maryland is one of my favorites from back when I did AYCE (all you can eat) sushi multiple times a month if not a week. In case you're not familiar with Las Vegas, the AYCE sushi scene is huge and prepared to order, not buffet style. Goyemon and this older restaurant have identical menus (including AYCE dessert - that 1 per person limit at many restaurants is a pet peeve), but I always recalled Goyemon having a larger offering of special nigiri and appetizers.

Sushi Mon has almost caught up in specials variety since my last visit a few years back. I don't have a photo, but the nigiri included a hefty array of nigiri, including yuzu tobiko, seared bonito, and other ignored options. I tried and loved the blue fin tuna, salmon belly, yellowtail belly, and masaba (a variety mackerel that's far less salty). A full meal of those would've been more than satisfying.

From the aforementioned specials menu, I also enjoyed these nigiri: Japanese mackerel, toro (1 per person), young yellowtail, red grouper, and asari rayu, asari being Japanese littleneck clams and rayu being chili-infused sesame oil. The Japanese mackerel was rather salty like regular saba, the toro wasn't substantially better than the blue fin, the young yellowtail and red grouper were similar to regular yellow tail and red snapper, respectively, and the asari rayu was a bit more spicy than I would've tolerated if I'd eaten a full piece (but it does taste pretty good).

I don't recall Goyemon favorites such as spicy tuna rice cracker, sashimi salad, grilled pork belly, and fresh "wasabi" (I'm told it's not actual wasabi, but it's similar) being available at Sushi Mon before, but they were available and at least as good if not better. The pork belly at Goyemon has actually been significantly overcooked almost every time over the past year, but the pork belly in this meal was fatty, juicy, and only slightly overcooked on edges. Some grilled items which I missed from Goyemon are cajun salmon, miso salmon, yellowtail, and super white tuna, but I was more than willing to overlook those after having the best yellowtail collar from either 'Mon. (Salmon collar was also available, and both were 1 per person.)

The standard menu appetizers were also as enjoyable as usual. Dynamite (bay scallop, "crab" filling, onions, cream sauce) and atypically large mussels were great. As for standard nigiri, I enjoyed the super white tuna, hotate (sea scallop), and amaebi as much as I have at Goyemon or other AYCE establishments in town. Uni was slightly subpar, but I've had far more unpalatable experiences at similar spots.

As far as dessert, standard menu green tea was as awesome as usual, although some unusual ice was present around, but not inside. This stuff actually has matcha, unlike some competitors. I also had pineapple sorbet, which is as delicious as you'd expect, and a cream puff, which was enjoyable and packed full of vanilla cream. That's the first time that I've seen those desserts available at a 'Mon.

Wait was about half an hour for Friday night peak dinner. Dress accordingly for the weather if you're not able to come here during off-peak times. Cost for AYCE meals is $19.95 for lunch, $26.95 for dinner. Time limits are written as 45 and 60 minutes respectively, but still aren't really enforced except for special occasions. Most rolls are available in half orders, although I completely ignored rolls this time as I often do.

Sushi Mon remains in my top tier of Las Vegas's AYCE sushi (along with Goyemon and Sushi Koma), but I may be naming it as my new favorite soon enough if I experience enough delicious meals. I do hope to visit more often because it's more convenient for me than Goyemon is (although the latter is still 4.5* at least, so make no mistake about my opinion).

My favorite Sushi restaurant in Vegas so far.  They have an ALCE option which is usually the best way to go.  **if you order a la carte and  decide to spend more than the $28 AYCE price, they will let you just pay that flat fee and go to town!!! sunrise roll and seared tuna nagiri are my faves!

It might be our 10th time here and it's the first time in my life that I don't have to speak to order the chef Sung already know exactly what I am looking for me and my girlfriend. Very good quality awesome ambiance, great service and best food. Well done !!!

Went here on St. Patrick's Day, decent rolls and great service!   

If you are getting AYCE I would recommend:
-Ecstasy Roll
-Supreme Salmon
-Sushi-Max
-Garlic Tuna Nigiri

Warning: We also got the 9-1-1 Roll and it was VERY HOT...SERIOUSLY.  It has a habanero sauce in it that makes it extremely spicy.  Our whole entire table enjoys spicy food, but this was hot.  We couldn't feel our tongues for a minute.  Luckily our server was nice enough to take away the remaining 4 sushi pieces without any trouble.

Definitely has become somewhere to stop before leaving each Vegas trip. Forget the $50 hotel buffets. 

We come here for the all you can eat sushi. Everything's made/cut fresh. The quality of the fish is on point. For lunch all for $21.95. It also includes their choice of appetizers (which includes such like edamame, Takoyaki, shrimp tempura, veggie tempura, poke, cucumber salad, seaweed salad, miso soup, etc.) and DESSERT (Mochi ice cream, tempura ice cream, and other more ice cream haha)! It's not close to the strip but worth the drive, trust me. It's a long list of choices for their rolls and sushi, actually quite a bit of reading. And allllll so yummyyyy! I wish there was one near home :( 

It's better if you sit at the bar for the all you can eat. Cause you can order for sushi right there instead of bugging the waitresses that are serving others. But do be aware you do need to eat all the rice that comes with the fish too or I think they charge you extra.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone! The best sushi I've had in terms of both quality and price. I got a salmon roll and salmon nigiri and my girlfriend got an avacado cucumber roll and an avacado asparagus roll. Each roll comes with eight pieces, the nigiri comes with two pieces, and they were all delicious.

This used to be our main All-you-can-eat sushi place where we'd go twice a week. It all changed when they got new owners. It's okay, but not the same service -- probably because our regular sushi chefs went to Goyemon. 

They have the same menu as before but the quality is different. I know you're thinking, how I can tell, but if you've gone to the same place for years and the fish doesn't taste the same, then I have to say the quality is different. 

On the other hand, compared to many of the other sushi restaurants, I think it passes for OK. The new service is friendly.  If you're nearby and you needed AYCE sushi place, try it. It might not be the best, but probably a good value.

walked in and the place was about 1/3 full. not one person greeted us. the sign says "wait to be seated". 2 employees looked at us and didn't say anything still. after a few awkward minutes I asked... should we seat ourselves? one of the employees looked surprised that I asked. another employee seated us. the menu had several options and we opted for all you can eat. our waiter took our order and someone else brought it to our table. our waiter was busy watching a game on TV. the food was delicious... I've been here before and the service was good..  I'll give them the benefit of doubt... it was after 9pm. maybe they were tired. a simple smile and welcome would have make this a better experience.
They always serve freshest fish! I love the variety of rolls, ecstasy roll is my favorite!! They also have amazing service.
One of the few sushi restaurants worth a short wait. The food is always fabulous and the service is attentive.

Came here for AYCE sushi before heading back to Los Angeles and it was soooo good! This place is unlike other AYCE sushi joints where there is a set price for the weekend the entire day. There is still a lunch and dinner pricing. I don't remember what the dinner price was but for lunch on Sunday it was $22. They also don't give you a paper to write down your order, there's a server that comes to take your order. 

There is a lot of things to choose from in their menu. My group got a few rolls and then mainly stuck to nigiri the rest of the time. Don't forget to look at the daily special menu because that is included as well! 

The sushi that definitely stuck out to me and was soooooo good were the fresh scallops, negi toro and the blue fin toro. I have no idea what was on the fresh scallops but it was my favorite! I could've kept eating that for the entire time! For their special rolls the ecstasy roll was BOMB. Def recommend trying those 4.

They also have really good desserts! A variety of different flavors for their mochi ice cream and the lychee sorbet was AMAZING!

Service wasn't bad. Well at the beginning service was great but towards the end of our meal it kind of got pretty slow but we didn't mind it. 

I will definitely be back here on my next visit to Vegas!

Very rude! Kicked us out because our 4 year old doesnt eat sushi or anything on their menu so we got him a happy meal to eat while we could enjoy a meal together and be able to eat sushi. Kabuki had no problem with it and that is where our future sushi outings are going from now on. I also have a facebook mom group of over 1400 moms and plan to share this story and a kid friendly alternative to here.

My daughter & I were in the area and were in the mood for Japanese food. I remembered that my good friend and fellow yelper, Edith S recently ate here so we decided to give Sushi Mon a try. 

Upon entering we were greeted by the friendly staff, then seated. They have AYCE, regular priced menu items and lunch specials. We decided on ordering from the lunch specials menu. 

We both had the 2 Roll Lunch Combo which comes with 2 Sushi rolls of your choice (from list), salad & miso soup. All this for $8.50! 

Items tried and liked (so far): 
Miso Soup comes with tofu & wakame. 
Salad with Ginger Sesame Dressing
California Roll
Spicy Tuna Roll
Avocado & Asparagus Roll

Everything tasted fresh & yummy!  Service was quick & friendly.  We will definitely be back :)

Cmon now. This is place is not good. I think the location works and that's how they are busy, but there are so many places that are better. I felt like I was eating Walmart sushi or maybe sushi at the dollar store. Nasty. The service was arrogant? I can't think of another word for it. Here's the rules, what do you want, see you when I see you. 
Oh thanks for bringing me my nice dull looking tasteless nasty raw fish. Oh and can you bring me some more tripe looking beef for my daughters teriyaki bowl, thanks. Ordered all you can eat and after a round it was all I could stomach. Maybe it was a bad night, but how much could quality improve. Maybe I'm spoiled because I usually like food to be edible, hard to say. 
Pass on this. Matter of fact drive in the opposite direction.

3rd time in this place.  Its so good! 

This time I visited there during lunch.  Even better.  No Lines, Food came in fast.  Since this is an all you can eat restaurant, you will not worrying about "left over fish" issues like other a la carte sushi (yes, in Japanese culture you may get to eat the fish from the day before during lunch).

Everything is fresh and their fried stuffs are actually quite yummy (Shrimp tempura, fried shumai).  Ahi Poke salad is good too.  I didn't like the grilled yellowtail cheek too much. 

Make sure to save rooms for desserts!  Yummy lychee ice creams!

Great All You Can Eat Sushi Joint in Vegas.

Located in a shopping plaza.  Easy to park.  

The restaurant is not too big but staffs are very efficient with orders.  During non-busy hours, you can actually eat longer than the regulated 60 mins but usually people are full before they hit an hour landmark.  

Fishes were fresh.  Make sure to check their daily specials!  I like their fresh scallop (its previously frozen, however) but still pretty good for AYCE standard.  Uni melts in your mouth as well.  Sweet shrimp is better than typical AYCE place too.  I also liked their salmon, yellowtail, amber jack, albacore sushi.  Their tempura shrimp and seaweed salad is good too.  One of the best I have had in the AYCE restaurant.  Thumbs up.   They also make pretty good rolls, including 1/2 order rolls so for those who can't consume the whole spider roll, this is the place to go.

My only gripe for this place is that their sushi rice is bit on the firm side.  It wasn't  very "sticky" when I was there.  Maybe just one of the bad nights?  Their Ikura (Salmon Eggs) weren't that salty too so if you don't like fishy stuff, try to avoid that.  Other than that, its definitely worth to make a trip here if you are very hungry and loves sushi!

Never going back.

We did ayce & were only able to order twice, while flagging the chef down because we were sitting at the bar. They were two feet in front of us and wouldn't even look at us to order.  For like two hours. 

Half the time the order is wrong (I've gone here 3x and they always bering out other things besides what we ordered, or not the sushi /roll we ordered at all.)

"Hospitality" doesn't exist here. Ok there was one kid and he was really nice. Really it's like fishing. You just sit and wait and maybe you'll get to eat. And pay the 25/person bill. 

Sushi isn't bad. If you want to bash your head on the table trying to get it in front of you.

I had AYCE sushi a few nights ago and sat at the bar with a friend. When we sat we were greeted by one of the chefs who was extremely friendly. We ordered one of every roll and the two that stood out the most were the hurricane and ecstasy, both were excellent with flavors that complimented each other perfectly. Other than food the inside was clean and the staff was friendly. The only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is the menu is a bit small compared to other AYCE sushi places in the valley.

This place is deliciously amazing. Everything is made to order. There are prices listed for those who want to order dishes individually.  We opted for the lunch buffet which includes everything on the menu.  I appreciate that you can order rolls in halves because we would definitely not have been able to try the many other dishes.  The down part is, if you don't finish everything you have to pay for it. Thus, half orders are a great way to prevent waste.  The lunch buffet is about $24.99 and the dinner buffet (with the same options) is $26.99. 

Baked Mussels: WOW WOW. I don't even like mussels but these were so amazing! Make sure you are careful though, I grabbed the shell right when the waiter brought it out (because I'm an impatient pig) and boy did I burn my thumb, it was red for the rest of the day.

White Tuna and Uni (Eel) Sashimi: AMAZING AMAZING. The only negative part is that every slice of sashimi is over rice.  And you have to eat all the rice or else you will get charged.

Monster Roll: They make it sound like it was a ginormous roll.  The size and taste definitely did not meet my expectations.  Definitely a PASS. Don't even bother or think that this is a challenge. It is full of rice and does not taste good.

Besides that, EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!
We ordered two dinner special and fired shumai..Quick and taste good.. Price reasonable. Service also good. Will come back.

When you just need some quick and affordable good sushi:  I love this place and its prices. And did I say it's fast?  Great place for all you can eat. Packed with tables and chairs and other diners, the atmosphere is busy and electric. Great place to bring a group of friends and just have a good time.  Cheers!

Not bad for an ayce sushi joint in Vegas!  We were lured in by the notion of limitless salmon, tuna and Uni.. But please note:  the Uni is not all you can eat!  We went in for lunch service (lunch-$21.95 and dinner-26.95).  I didn't read the menu thoroughly and so after I ordered 2 orders of Uni, the bill came and we realized that they charged us both for dinner price.  There is a limit of 2 pieces of Uni per person.  



Regardless, they still had my all time fave white tuna and salmon.  Restrooms were clean and service was friendly.. 4 stars!
Fresh nigiri was good. The baked rolls had way too much cream cheese; it was overpowering. The rice was overcooked and burnt. The wait was too long and there were not enough sushi chefs working.

Not a fan of this place my husband and I have raved about this place for years it's been awhile since we've been in so I decided to have lunch there with my mom I ordered three rolls of California rolls when I got them I could barely taste the crab and the roles were very small the Cucumber normally has the peel outer skin shaved off but they kept it on making it very hard to chew when the rest of the scroll is soft it jabbed me in top of the mouth every time the avocado was so thin I didn't even taste it definitely would not recommend this place to anyone and do not plan on returning back I also ordered vegetable tempura it was definitely supersaturated and oil and cooked very quickly as opposed to them being dried and the tempura overall looking a lot better I just peeled off the outer breading and eat the vegetables no big the cucumber salad that we ordered once again was 50% skin and 50% cucumber not yummy will you have to chew the crap out of your cucumber salad I ordered two drinks two dr. Peppers they were a buck seventy-five apiece not bad I was done eating my three orders of sushi - 3 small bites and I asked the lady for a to-go cup she told me I'm sorry we don't have to go cups I don't understand how I can pay for a drink and not take it that's not right I paid for all of my stuff alicart and it was not all you can eat there should be no reason why they shouldn't offer to go cup I don't think that is good service at all so I sat there and extra 30 minutes while I drink my drink and that time I stared at the check and realize they forgot to charge me for the drinks mind you I was upset that they didn't have a to-go cup I thought that was rude but I wanted to make sure that they didn't offer the drinks because if that was the case I had no right to complain about not having a to-go cup the lady said to me oh no she forgot to charge you so me being the nice person I am cuz I could have said that's your problem not mine I had her fix the bill to charge me for two drinks but seriously there was maybe four people in that shop and you forget to add the bill correctly I definitely will not be back and I will make sure the people know my opinion when it comes to Sushi Mon I will definitely be returning to Sushi 21 on Flamingo and Decatur it is worth the drive because apparently nothing close to me is halfway decent
Exe lent food. Good service. Only negative was there isn't a lot of seating b

We decided to come here after learning it was part of the "mon" chains and we love goyemon! It's a smaller establishment and I used to come here a bunch when it was owned by an previous owner. We were seated right away and they told me that it would be $3 bucks for my one year old to eat. That irked be a little bit, because 1. how much can a one year old really eat and 2. I was feeding my child food that I had brought at that exact moment when they asked.
